I really wanted to like this considering all the hype. First off let me say that I am 51 years old and started drinking beer in my early teens. This is not like any of the beer back in my day. I suspect the new craze of extreme hops in beer has developed over time in that people who enjoy the hops bitter flavor needed increased amounts of hops to satisfy them. Like someone who tries a some mild hot wings and then graduates to medium, and then to very hot wings. I do not like strong hopped beer. I would not have tried to drink this if I had known, but I did learn this through my first extreme hopped beer experience. If you love this beer, good for you. Beer drinking is all about enjoyment. I have a different palate than most and prefer the old school lagers of my day. Cheers and may you find beer truly enjoyable whatever you choose!

bottle shared with a friend. poured a clear dark amber colour with an off head. nose has a lot, but i mean a lot of malts. and imo its showing no signs of an ipa whatsoever, slight earthy notes, riped banana, cloves, and caramel. taste is not as bitter aswell. overdone? not a big fan

Bière complexe avec une belle présence de sucre, de résine, de caramel, et dépices. Peut-être trop sucré par contre. Jai limpression davoir dégusté un barley wine plus quune impériale IPA... bien.
Probably my favorite brew on the planet. Seriously. I try many others but always come home to Dogfish. Heading the Delaware is like a religious pilgrimage.

330ml bottle (thanks martjoobolut). Clear dark amber color. Small size, beige head, stays as a ring. Sweet, fruity, malty, caramel, alcohol in aroma. Sweet, caramel, fruity in taste. Caramelly and malts and bit of burtness in aftertaste. Medium bitterness. Medium carbonation. Sweetness covers alcohol quite well, but can feel the heat. Drinkable brew.
Hazy copper with white head. Citrus, green leaf, tea and herbal. Sweet, round and spicy finish. Overall: old bottle

Bottle, bottled 11.2015 (from beergium). Pours amber. Aroma is sweet, grassy, caramel, malt. Flavor is sweet, malt, caramel, citrus. Alcohol is well covered. Finish is citroc bitter. Overall: very good.
B. Pours a clear amber color with white head. A little harsh, but full flavor
A little boozy. From a bottle at a brazilian grill. Tasty brew, good hops. Good one

UPDATED: FEB 8, 2017 pours amber color, clear, almost brilliant, with very stable creamy yellowish off-white head. Aroma: malt aroma, which takes on candied fruitcake, supported with hop aroma, which takes on pine, citruses and some other fruits. Flavor is practically the same, with the same notes menitoned above, but with somehow disturbing honey like sweetness before finish. Finish is slightly bitter, dry. Bitterness lingers in aftertaste. Malt sweetness and moderate high hop bitterness are pretty well balanced. Body is medium, texture soft, carbonation is moderate medium.
From tap at The P.U.B. in Vegas. Copper color with a nice off-while head that leaves lacing. aroma is citrus and caramel. Flavor has citrus and pine hops with sweet caramel malts.

Cor de ouro envelhecido com leve brilho, espuma de leve tonalidade amarelada de médias formação e persistência com bom lacing.
Aroma muito agradável de caramelo e frutas cítricas amarelas (abacaxi e maracujá).
Sabor de início maltado (caramelo e doce de abacaxi) com um final levemente seco e amargor suave. Retrogosto amargo e de calda de doce de abacaxi.
Corpo médio e carbonatação média; álcool muito bem inserido.
Altíssima drinkability.

Malty, caramel, sweetish, grapefruit, resin, alcohol, 
Amber colour, medium white head, lacing. 
Noticably sweet, big bite, ABV evident, malt forward, lots of hops, but somewhat subdued. 
Fullbodied, soft carbonation, bitter finish.

Nice tan head that lingers providing lacing but not excess carbonation. Color is a rich amber. Pleasant aroma. High ABV yet easy drinking...palate pleasing. At first I got bitter though not lingering and since I am a IPA newbie...it just might be that I dont identify the hops flavor accurately just yet.
Tasted during DIPA shootout. Light aroma, light fruit, not too bitter, good integrated sweetness.

I do not know how I have gone so long without trying this beer. Dark copper color and lacing foam in my snifter. Big hop aroma, some honey in the aroma as well. I feel a mild hop burn, and I would have guessed the IBUs were higher than 90. Flavor is balanced. Sweet malt flavor and strong hop character of dry hops. Alcohol is noticeable in the flavor and the palate, just a little bit hot.

UPDATED: MAY 23, 2016 Bottle. Pours copper. Aroma has biscuit, raisin, pine and citrus. Has a strong malt backbone with a nice smooth biterness. Good mouthfeel with alcohol not over present. A great beer, very satisfying.

Servida en un Spiegelau IPA. APARIENCIA: de color ámbar, con destellos naranjas y ligeros marrones a contraluz, se observa cristalina y una alta actividad de carbonatación; corona de espuma color blanco de buena retención, de burbujas compactas y algunas abiertas al centro.

AROMA: se alcanzan a percibir los lúpulos de características cítricas y herbales sin embargo no es tan intenso, se percibe el dulzor de maltas con ligeras notas a caramelo.

SABOR: las notas cítricas como cáscara de toronja y ligeramente herbal de los lúpulos se percibe, además de notas a caramelo de las maltas, se alcanza a sentir el alcohol en boca pero no es agresivo; en el retrogusto queda un amargor medio-ligero, con sensación cálida en garganta por el alcohol.

SENSACIÓN: cuerpo medio, sensación oleosa y algo así como de sirope, carbonatación media.

RESUMEN: IPA de la vieja escuela, no muy de mi agrado.

Copper colored, clear, medium- off white head. Aroma is of malt, caramel, medium fruity and floral, pine hops. Taste is medium+ sweet caramel malt, bit hardcandy, quite fruity, some pine, citrus, medium bitterness, semidry finish, lasting aftertaste, resiny. Medium to full bodied, soft carbonation, sticky-oily. 
(bottle, Bierhalle Deconinck, Vichte)

Bottle. Dark color for an IPA. Nice hoppy balance with a smooth finish. I've had 70 minute IPA. I guess that extra 30 minutes was well worth the wait. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle. Pours dark brown color with light tan head and lacing. Malt and hops aromas. Hop flavors with strong malt backbone. Excellent. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Bottle. Perfumed citrus aroma, and a rich biscuity backbone with spicy hops. A lovely well balanced beer.

From 12oz bottle, about $1.50 for single at Trader Joes, poured into 16oz tulip glass

Aroma: citrus, spruce, caramel, vanilla, 

Appearance: amber, clear, frothy, white foam, 

Taste: very bitter, medium sweetness, 

Palate: medium body, creamy, average carbonation, bitter, long finish, 

Overall: A solid heavy bitter, balanced double IPA. Nice body and malts with good American hop (citrus, pine). Very well made and balanced IPA.
A beautiful beer, this is all about the dance between hops and malt, bitter with a large amount of caramel, herbal, boozy notes. Smooth, well balanced, and hides the alcohol well

12 oz bottle. This is a decent double IPA, although it could be hoppier (wish I could find a bottling date). It is fairly malty for the style, although not cloyingly caramel sweet and you definitely cant tell it is 9%.

One of my favorite DIPAs so far, beautiful glass of beer, nice color great head retention, aroma gets better as it warms as do the individual flavor notes. This beer is still tasty at room temperature! Great malt choices blend with the hops to produce a very smooth, high bitter nutty flavor finish that keeps you asking for another round. Have to check myself with this beer as it can put a decent buzz on you fast.
citrus, grass, herbs, hay, caramel, alcohol, golden, clear, white foam, medium sweetness, very bitter, full body, sticky, soft carbonation, long finish, bitter, well balance

Bottle: Its a very decent imperial IPA, the mouthfeel is rather refined , aroma like burnt orange skin, sweet, and very well balanced to the IBU, I think alot of people would love ending their meal with this beer, sharing it with mates, and those who dont belong to the table at 3am !!
From bottle. Poured amber with nice head. Nice resiny aroma. Drinks easy with balanced sweet hop flavor, booze and bitterness. Tasty
Purchased bottle. Lovely flavour. Rich and poured well. Will definitely try again.

Bottle.
Amber, clear, thick white head
Aroma of alcohol sweet citrus, caramel 
Taste sweet and bitter, quite round taste.
Nose is very citrusy Pour is a creamy brown frothy head. Color is amber/brown. Wonderfully heavy hopped flavor that is balanced with a very generous amount of malt.

Bottle from Drinks of the World. More tropical and intense than the 60. Still mostly on the sweet-bitter side. I like my hops to be lighter. And my aromas to have more complexity. Certainly a good IPA, not quite as impressive as I was hoping for.

This is an absolutely perfect Imperial IPA. It is not bitter for bitterness sake. It is well balanced with malt and has a constant flow of hops added to give it real hop complexity in flavour, bitterness and aroma. Perfect.

Aroma: malty, citrus, grapefruit, malty.
Appearance: clear amber-golden color and thin white head.
Taste: high citrus bitterness, citrus, grapefruit, warming alcohol, malty, balanced.
Palate: full body and medium carbonation, bitter finish.
Overall: Really good DIPA, tasty.

Poured from bottle a clear almost gold colour. This smells great. It taste great. You can tell its high alcohol content but still an enjoyable drink. Caramel notes and a malt feel. Not a large hop proportion

Crystal-clear color with leaning more towards gold. Very malty and caramel flavor gives a hint of toasty and chocolate taste. Not as much bitterness and a healthy amount of sweetness from the malt. Impressive overall

Interesting IPA but a very good one.
This beer has really tightened up since its initial release ... of which I was not a fan of. 

In the realm of Imperial / Double IPAs, 90 Minute IPA is King ... or at least one of the mighty Kings within its growing empire.
Caremel malty aroma / Light orange color / Littlebit hazy / Nice carbonation / Full body / Medium sweet taste. Excellent IIPA.
Golden Orange color. Complex aroma mixed with caramel, mango and other tropical fruit. Fresh smell. Medium body. Very good.

Appearance - More amber than gold even reddish. Thick head. Very good retention.
Aroma - Earthy tone predominant. Lots of hops. Slightly Piny.
Taste - Its a lot to take in. Earthy. Very very malty. hoppy. citrus. raisins. caramel. raisins. malty.
Aftertaste - more carbonation than expected. still smooth on the lips though. pleasant maltiness on the tongue

Bottle. Dark orange amber with tiny head. Nose of citrus fruits and bready malts. Complex and malty flavour with grapefruit, pine and raisins. Medium bodied. Ends very sweet and not really bitter.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

My opinion,the best ipa is big eye so generally it is fine just too strong for me.
It is so difficult drinking with food that not so good match. 
once a week is fine but everyday ? i dont know.

Bouteille achetée chez Drink of the world - De couleur cuivrée avec une bonne mousse blanche crémeuse qui tient longtemps et cole au verre - Au nez des arômes fruité et malté, agrumes, mangue, malté, céréale, biscuit, une pointes dalcool, fruits sec et legerement ananas - En bouche toujours un grand equilibre entre le malt et le houblon cest vraiment impressionnant, les houblon citroné, orange, mangue, le corp malté biscuit, céréale, alcool, légèrement vineux sans être acide, infusion de houblon légèrement herbacé, thé - Corp puissant, amertume forte, carbonation correcte, sucrée et amère, final puissant houblon alcool et céréale - cette bière est impressionnante malgré que ma bouteille ne soit pas des plus recente, un equilibre incroyable entre le malt et le houblon, lalcool arrondi les houblons et vice versa, exceptionnel

Translucent golden orange with a meager sized white head. Complex aroma with notes of caramel, vanilla, pineapple, mango, lemon, orange, and citrus. Mid bodied, smooth, and malt oriented. Delectable taste with flavours such as the aforementioned aromatics, particularly sweet tropical fruit, finishing with a sweet nectar and hop finish. Nice.
Nice balance of sweet and bitter. Beautiful golden amber color with full of flavor. Malty taste on medium body.

I wish I head this beer fresh. Bottle 4 months ago so read with a grain of salt. Aroma is caramel, resin, earthy, woody. Quickly disappearing white head. Flavor is light sweetness, complex mouthful. Overall a solid imperial that I wish was fresh.

UPDATED: APR 6, 2017 Visual: Pours clear deep orange without much head, very thin hazy layer of retention, scattered singular steady streams.

Nose: clean biscuity toffee malts. (lvl-6)-pungency

Attack: crisp-slick-thick, nano creamy mouthfeel

Mid-palate: (lvl-5)-sweetness, tangy-light sour backbone, (MAIN) orange citrus , toffee barley malt

Finish: residual sweet barley malt, super subtle dry grassy citrus bitter hops, zen-like clean finish

Summary: Incredibly smooth transitions and outright ridiculously well hidden 9% ABV. After 800+ beer tastings Ive never come across such a fluffy creamy mouthfeel! A must try for any beer connoisseur.

[Re-tasted 2017, April 6] After cellaring for 1.5 years, the initial sip still knocks me off my feet. Out of this world mouthfeel, rich balanced body, clean sippability, wickedly smooth.

Ein bisschen enttäuschend nach allem was ich über dieses Bier gehört habe. Für mich ein gutes, aber nicht überragendes IPA. Eher Malzlastig mit Caramelnoten. Der blumige Hopfen ist für meinen Geschmack zu wenig present, und im Gesamten ist es eher Süss und es fehlt an Bitterkeit im Abgang. Ein Gutes Bier, aber kein hervorragendes IPA.
Nice aroma, pours a nice copper. Some hint of the 90 ibu, behind the sweetness. But for me, it is just too malty sweet, nearly soda like.
Bottle on Celebrity Millennium Fresh sticky beginning. Lots of hops on a sweetish body. Round and fresh, but a bit too sticky. The hops are intense in the aftertaste, sticky and smooth. Nice.

355ml bottle, pours clear gold with a small head. Aroma is caramel malts, pine, floral hops, citrus. Finish is beautifully balanced with no big hoppy bitterness, just a nuanced light bitterness balancing the sweet malts perfectly. So drinkable for a 9%. Great beer.

Disappointed. At 90 IBUs I was expecting a wonderfully bitter bite, but instead I got a mouthful of sweet malt. Definitely prefer their 60 minute IPA. This 90 min. is hoppy, but malt-heavy for an IPA.

Still working my way through the top 50 IIPA list, but Ive yet to find one I like better than this. So smooth, you hardly notice the high alcohol content. I always have some of this in the fridge, and its my benchmark for a good IPA, the close it gets to this one. Love it.

Ambar levemente turva. Espuma amarela de média formação e persistência. Aroma resinal, caramelado, maltado, dulçor açucarado predominante, lúpulo secundário. Paladar segue o aroma, dulçor médio, amargor leve/médio. Corpo licoroso, alcoólico, baixa carbonatação. Aftertaste de média persistência, maltado, açucarado e lupulado. Boa, bem equilibrada, mas esperava algo excepcional (o que não foi ...)

This is the gold standard for beer. The 90 minute is exceptional and far superior to the 60 minute and also much better than the 120 minute. I guess its the perfect balance. The higher ABV can sneak up on you since the beer doesnt have the extra fullness feel of other high gravity brews. The color is a light bronze that is darker than other IPAs, but still in the amber-red family. The foam is an orange tan that gives a nice tickle when consumed. The initial taste is slightly bitter hops, yet remarkably smooth with just a hint of citrus and smoky wood, It rests in the mouth like a fine single malt scotch with an impeccable smoothness of perfectly balanced hops and malt with hints of golden raisin, candied orange peel, vanilla and caramel. The finish is what truly sets it apart from other IPAs. It has a touch a bitterness, but still leaves a smooth essence like sweet tobacco and refined hops. This is the beer to compare all others. While a few may be better or have more complex tastes like barrel aged and flavored porters, the list is very short.

Pours orange with medium head, disappearing fast, but leaving a nice lacing on glass. Aroma: a burst of peach and mandarine, followed by some herbs and pine tree. Taste: malty sweetness comes first, followed by a nice hoppy counterbalance (herbs, citurs) and a nice mid- to long hoppy palate. Very good, dangerously drinkable.

Rating #1575 - 21.03.2015 - On tap at Larrys - Venice Beach. Pours a darker amber, with a bubbly tan head. Aroma is citrusy, soft fruits predominant. Taste is extremely hoppy, lots of cool citrus notes - mild tropical, mild pine, mild orange zest. Huge toffee, caramel, raisin, plum pudding malt bill adds a pile of sweetness, zesty hops and sharp bitterness. A lovely DIPA.
Ámbar limpio y espuma marfil compacta. Aroma especiado, caramelo, toque cítrico. Cuerpo denso, inicio maltoso, con sabor de pino y resinas hasta un final de amargor intenso.

Pour to taster snifter. Deep gold pour with thinner-than-average head. Nose is bready, syrupy cherry, grapefruit, flowery perfume, pine. Ripe flavor with a barleywine alcohol/malt combo running along the base of the palette, apple, orange rind and juice, resiny sugar, tea-like flavors. All in all, not my cup of tea for an imperial. Definitely some clove-y belgian yeast mingling somewhere in it.  Not the best IIPA by far, but enough complexity to give a nod to. A bit too clingy and not enough cleanliness. If you like your residual-sugary resin, grab this.

<>Kolor: Bursztynowy. Niebywała wręcz klarowność. To co wyróznia amerykańskie browary - ta niesamowita czystość piwo. Można dokładnie odczytać napisy i logo, które jest na drugiej stronie Hamburga.
Piana: Jasnożółta, drobna, średnio i drobnoziarnista.
Fenomenalna gęstość, puszystość i trwałość.
Piana jest wysoka i powolutku opada do grubego kilkucentymetrowego kołnierzyka.
Lacing wzorowy.
Nie ma tutaj słabych stron.
Zapach: Aromat od pierwszej sekundy zaznacza, że rzadzą tu amerykańskie chmiele.
Jest słodko, tropikalnie.
Przede wszystkim: mango, ananas, marakuja, papaja, karambola oraz lichi.
Słodowe, słodkie akcenty są daleko w tle z minimalnym stężeniem karmelu.
W drugim podejściu żywiczne nuty lasów tropikalnych. 
Smak: Po pierwszym łyku już wiem dokładnie wszystko o tym piwie.
Smak jest słodki, chwilami wręcz likierowaty.
Słodycz ta pochodzi wyłącznie od chmieli i tropikalnych owocowych akcentów.
Nie ma tu landrynkowej, karmelowej, maślnej cukierkowatosci.
Jest za to smak świeżo wyciskanego soku z mango, marakuji, papaji i luchi.
Piwo wydaje się napompowane tymi owocami. Sprawia wrażenie jakby wyżej wymienione składniki były przepuszczone przez Randala.
Na drugim biegunie mamy aromatyczne sosnowe, żywiczne niuanse.
Niebywałe jest to, że przy 9% alkoholu i 90 IBU odczucie w ustach jest wciąż lekkie i gładkie.
Pijesz Double IPA, a wydaje Ci się, że to lekkie, sesyjne APA.
Goryczka jest wysoka, ale krótka, stylowa, w ogóle nie przeszkadza. 
Piwo jest kompletne w każdym calu. 
Wysycenie: Niskie.
Podsumowanie: 

90 Minute Imerial IPA - nazwa nawiązuje do CIĄGŁEGO dodawania chmieli przez 90 minut gotowania!
Swoisty majstersztyk!

Bardzo popularny w USA magazyn dla mężczyzn "Esquire Magazine" nazwał to piwo Najlepszym IPA w Ameryce.

Podpisuje się pod tym rankingiem.
Była to dla mnie wycieczka do świata piwnej rozkoszy.
Doznania smakowe były nieograniczone.
Piwo jest wybitne.
Jedno z najlepszych IPA jakie piłem w życiu.
Kompletne smakowo w każdym detalu.

Buteleczkę przywiozła mi koleżanka z Nowego Jorku.
Jest to świeżutka warka, dlatego też walory smakowe są spotęgowane.

Wiem na pewno, że zrobię wszystko, żeby ktoś przywiózł mi z USA - 120
Minutes Imperial IPA - 18% alk. +120 IBU - to dopiero będzie torpeda chmielowa ;-)))

Poured from a bottle. Pours a clear orange amber with a thin white ring. Light pine resin and sweet citrus aroma. Smooth with only a little bitterness. Semi sweet citrus flavor with a slightly bitter finish. Not as good as I thought it would be. Refreshing and good ;but not as good as all the hype.

12oz bottle. Clear amber with a foamy off-white head. Flavors are biscuity cereals, resinous hops, stone fruits, honey, alcohol with spicy and vinous notes. Medium to full body, moderate carbonation, sticky texture.

Bottle 4 pack. Pours Golden Amber. Aroma is Sweet, malty and hoppy. Taste is sweet, malty and hoppy all at once with a hoppy warm sweet finish. Very balanced. I tend to like the unbalanced towards the hoppy end but this is enjoyable.
Excellent beer, very tasty, sweet at the beggining....nice aroma....tasted from Santa Ana El Salvador

Bottle, quite fresh. Pours clear amber colour with almost no head. Aroma of forest fruits, some reisin, orange, just a hint of caramel - not too intense but very pleasant. Sweet but not cloggy with strong carbonation, solid discernible malty backbone, fruity accents and short, moderate bitterness. The key is the balance - nothing stands out and I have no idea how they managed to conceal the alcohol so well. If I tried this one in a blind test I would bet that I am drinking a well balanced AIPA, guzzle the beer... and then I would regret that.
On tap at Gotts Roadside in Palo Alto, CA. Aroma is a bright bitterness. Surprised this comes across so boozy and bitter (not getting the malty balance that you hear about).

Bottle. Cloudy amber, medium off-white head. Aroma caramel, hops. Taste sweet, sugar candy, turning hoppy before again sweet finish.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

0,33l bottle. Pours golden clear with tall white head. Amazing aroma of caramel candy and some tropical fruits. Medium thick body. Very rich taste of caramel malt and some tropical fruit hop bitterness. Not as bitter or alcoholic as one would expect from a double ipa. But all in all a really great beer. The only downside - having to fly half the globe to get another chance to enjoy it.

33cl bottle, slightly old. Excellent hop profile in the aroma, and the taste did not disappoint. Citrus and exotic fruit taste on top of a sweet malty base that masks the ABV quite well. Would love to try this fresh.

Bottle. Hoppy Aroma of citrus, riped fruits, pine and grapefruit with notes of malty caramel. The flavour starts very sweet, but finish very bitter and dry. Lingering bitterness and nice heat of alcohol. The body is medium and the texture is oily. Average carbonation. A balanced and enjoyable beer.
Clear copper with off white head. Aroma spicy and earthy, with die caramel notes. Taste full and bitter, with some spruce notes, a little strange, but not bad for a DIPA

Aroma: caramel and toffee with generous grassy hop
App: clear amber, perfect meringue head and sheet lacing 
Flavour: huge toffee and citrus and grassy hop
Palate: long grass and citrus hop finish

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

IPAs are admittedly not my number one style. I have tasted many, and enjoy them from time to time. They often seem to taste extremely similar to one another. The same fruitiness in the hops. The same bitterness overpowering the malt. This one executes evreything perfectly while still reminding me of others

Reddish brown, lot of foam. Great, full aroma of toasted malt and caramel. Taste is less satisfactory. Mild sweetness in the mouth, orange and resin. Not bitter at all. Alcohol first in the background, but gets heavier . An o.k. beer, I dont see the hype.

Bottle in the Trembling Madness, York. Amber with a cream head. Fairly mild pine aroma. The taste is lots of pine and caramel with light aniseed spice. Full mouthfeel, Very good, but no where near as good or hoppy as I was expecting. maybe it doesnt travel too well.
A sweet malty hoppy contradictory libation thats a must try. An imperial ipa thats not bitter. Wow.

Golden clouds with white head. This is much maltier than most IPAs. Bitter grapefruit peel and light floral hops. Alcohol content is present but not overpowering. Light in the mouth but heavy in the gut. Definitely different!!
Tap @ Potawatomi Casino, Milwaukee, Wisconsin.

Woher die super Bewertung kommt von anderen? Keine Ahnung...
Ist wohl eher nach Vorbild der Ur-IPAs gebraut. Auswahl an Hopfen recht monoton. Schön stark und gleichzeitig mild. Im Glas eine schöne Pils-Farbe mit lang anhaltender, reinweisser Krone. Nicht trüb. Lecker und erfrischend, aber nicht überraschend.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Pours a nice golden color with a really thick head. Aroma of a sweet citrus and malt. Taste is citrus (sweet) and a follow up malty flavor with very little bitterness and a small hint of booze. Overall this is a fantastic IPA.
I dont like IPAs. I love this beer. Its not too hoppy, its crisp, its rich, and tastes less like an IPA than it does a slightly hoppy beer that anyone could enjoy.
Golden slightly cloudy pour. Smallish head. Light syrup, pineapple aroma. Maltier than most IPAs but quite tasty, overall balanced. Alcohol.
Muy buena cerveza. Redonda, agradezco una IPA que no sea amargor por amargor. Recomendable totalmente.

Not my kind of ipa. Very faint hop citrus smell and taste. Mostly malt on the nose and taste. Very smooth drinking but not enough bitterness or hop profile. Would not buy again unless only craft beer option. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle at home in sf. From trader joes. Mostly clear holden golden coloured pour with a lasting small white head. Aroma is grainy, nutty, jammy fruit, spicy hop, whiff of hot alcohol. Earthy caramel on the nose well. Flavour is composed of grainy, light caramel, orange peel, jammy fruit, pine, spicy pine needle, solvent. Harsh alcohol in the finish. Palate is medium bodied, highish carbonation. Lingering hot alcohol. I dont see the point in this beer. Why do I need this much boost?

UPDATED: NOV 26, 2015 Really good, finally got to get my hands on one with my Brother in law in town. Super clean, not that bitter and maltier than I would have thought but plenty of clean tropical hops.

Aboard Amtrak. Pours a super clear Amber, slightly off white medium white head. Aroma is dank pine, citrus, cracker malt, booze, floral hop. Flavor is med sweet, bready malt, pine, citrus, floral notes. Medium / big body, lasting bitter mouthfeel. Classic classic stuff.

If I'm gonna have an IPA it needs to be like this one. Not the traditional IPA with pine sol added but a nice blend of hops and malt.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Draft. Just plain good. Wouldnt have guessed was ipa. Malty aroma. Slight malty flavor but so rich. Not sure why Im not giving 5 stars
Hazy amber, small and dense offwhite head. Aroma has peach, pine and caramel. Malty, caramely flavour, notes of dried fruit and glue. Creamy mouthfeel with just a tiny alcohol bite. Good.

Love it and Im not ashamed. Its a great imperial IPA. I cant say anything about taste that hasnt already been said, but I will say this is in my top 5 IPAs. Its really good, always. A little buzzed on my second one as I type this...

Pours hay butterscotch, brief white head, but sustained shore cap. Aroma sweet biscuit, shortbread, resin hops, and first hints of ripe fruit. Taste starts surprisingly sweet, but evolves into a drier, more hops, profile with subtle rich dried fruit note that lingers. Lots of entertaining complexity, that earns the Imperial in the name. Overall its sweeter the I would expect from an I IPA but the complexity it offers make if outstanding. It reminds me of "old ales" in its richness, that plum pudding taste in the later moments that linger on the palate. The hops play a tempering role, keeping it an IPA.

The 60 min was pretty darn good and after reading reviews i bought a single to give the 90 a spin. Disappointed is the word that comes to mind, Although it looked good (color, head and lacing.) The aroma was almost non-existant and the taste was one of burnt barley, the hops were hardly noticeable. After trying this a few times over the past few years it just hasnt done anything for me

En bouteille. Couleur ambrée avec mousse blanche. Arômes de pins, agrumes, malt, alcool. Goût étonnamment malté, très pins, très résineux. On sent le 9% dalcool, belle chaleur en poche. Amertume relativement courte en fin de bouche de style écorce de pamplemousse avec un bon goût sucré résiduel. Palais modéré avec effervescence élevé. Cest très agréable à boire quoiquun peu fort en alcool.

I can see what all of the hype is about, this is really good. 12 oz. bottle from Pacific Liquor. Pour is hazy golden amber with a nice, dense, one finger, white head that retains and leaves thick lacing. I detect caramel, bread, grass, citrus, and pine in the aroma. Has a rich, fruity flavor, not very bitter for an Imperial IPA, low resin, low high alpha hop bite. Has a balanced flavor, the alcohol is well hidden. Full body, creamy texture, medium carbonation, and smooth finish.

UPDATED: MAY 20, 2017 Vom Fass im Brauhaus in Rehoboth und aus der Flasche. Klares Bernsteinfarbenes Bier mit cremigem hellbeigem Schaum. Fruchtiger Hopfenduft mit Malz und Trockenpflaumenduft. Dazu Honig und Karamel. Malz und Brot. Der Geschmack ist schwer aber auch weich und rund. Frucht und Malz sehr ausgewogen. Dazu Honig, Trockenobst, dunkler bitterer Karamel. Harzige Noten. Ein Hauch Rum. Wunderbares  Bier. Vom Fass am besten.

Had this several times, but finally getting to rate it. Cloudy sunshine in a bottle. Lots of pine, pineapple, and citrus aroma leads into a medium body. Hops are spicy, sweet, and dank without being too bitter or grassy. Nice beer.

Crystal clear amber with a beautiful creamy head. Aroma is sweet English malts and some hops. Malts are the backbone of this beer, very British, and the hops arent as strong as expected. A very tasty beer, but not what I expected from an Imperial IPA.

Growler - Very clear color, cross between a golden color and amber color with leaning more towards gold. Slight alcohol smell with a hint of hops on the nose. Alcohol taste with this one at 9% ABV. Not as much bitterness as I would expect from this one and a healthy amount of sweetness from the malt. Actually more sweetness than I was expecting from this imperial.

Pours copper color with white head. Medium body. Initial hop taste, bitter but not overpowering. Malty, caramel, peaches and raisins fruits. Finishes with a string fruits flavor with very little hoppy taste. One if the greats.
Bottle. Clear copper color with white head. Aroma - Sweet, apricot, pine. Taste - Hops, citrus, grapefruit, candies.

Nice aroma of pine and hops with some hints of lemon./citrus. Nice clear amber color/ thin tan head. Nice rich malt up front, sweet caramel. Nice bitterness sets in. Fresh hoppy flavors noticeable. Some warm alcohol burn on the finish. Nice balance. Crisp mouthfeel. Solid.
Boa breja, mas merece uma nova avaliação.........................................

Bottle 35,5cl / Botella 35,5cl.
@ Friendly Greek, Lancaster, PA, USA
A: Amber / Ambar.
T/S: Hops, citrusy, malty, fruity / Lupulo, citrico, malta, afrutado.

Poured from a 12 oz bottle into a snifter. Remarkably clear, copper color. Aroma is of pine and citrus, though not as strong as I anticipated. Nice, full body, slightly thick for an IPA. Really enjoy that. Sticky on the lips ... always a welcome trait.

Ive been enjoying this for years, including having a sixtel keg as my first on my kegerator. Into a Delirium Noel glass, pours gold with head and lace. Aroma of light malts, grains, slight fruit rind, fresh bread. Medium carbonation and significant mouthfeel. Flavors of rich grains, white grapefruit rind, straw hops, light malts, slight citrus and spice. Overall full bodies, flavorful, and quite tasty.
Keg at the hanging bat. Pours hazy amber, nose is sweet toffee, piney, taste is similar, dry, sweet, fruity, much better after it warmed.

This is a big bruiser of a beer. Big hops in the front, middle, back and in between. Malt notes and hints of raisin and fruit. Fairly complex for an IPA. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Aroma: caramel, spruce, citrus, 
Appearance: clear copper, off-white head
Taste: medium sweetness, medium bitterness, 
Palate: medium body, sticky, soft carbonation, long finish, 

Delicious
Holy cow thats hoppy! Nice amber to copper color. Pungent hop aroma. Strong hop flavor. Nice beer! Good IPA!

I poured it from the bottle into a pint glass. It pours a copper color with a big and fluffy off-white head and lacing. The aroma is strong floral hops and biscuit. The taste is big on hops with some sweetness and some bread. Its nice and dry with lots of bitterness. This was very tasty.
bottle amber color . sweet malty not that hoppy but i love that. medium body.

Keg at Buxton Tap House. Slightly hazy orange shade. White head and lacing. Red berry fruity, caramel, sherbet. Relentlessly bitter. I like a bit of sweetness in a DIPA but theres little to be found here. However, this drinks like an archetypal example, so I can see why people like it so much.

Flaska boxbeer. Orange kulör med beiget skum. Humlig doft med enbär, hö och knäck. Möjligtvis också lite lakrits. 
Ganska söt och karamellig smak med bra maltgrund. Tjock och fin humlehinna med bra beska.
Flaska från boxbeer. Bärnstensfärgad med vitt skum. Bärig och syltig doft. Söt och fruktig med ganska låg beska.

Keg at Rainbow event at Beavertown, London. It pours a clean golden color with a large white head. Aroma is grapefruit grass and piney hops, quite dry. Taste is lightly sweet and boozy and medium dry and bitter, with more notes of grapefruit, grass, pine cones and resin. Medium bodied with good carbonation. Overall, good but not exciting
A gift from Dan. Bronze, clear with nice yellowish thick head. Mild caramel, fruit in the aroma. Apple, apricot, caramel, complex flavor with nice growing burned sugar hoppiness in the aftertaste.

Aroma is dank with some citrus and almost raisiney qualities. Taste is hops on the front, sweet on the middle of the tongue and more citrus on the back. Dank and tasty a world class Imperial IPA. Way to go Dogfish Head you have a homerun with your 90 Minute Imperial IPA.

Tap. Magic Rock Tap. Nearly clear, dark gold. Thin, dense, lasting, white head. Lovely, juicy, minty, fruity hop. Halcyon on juice? Taste is soft sweet, first off, turning juicy, fresh hop bitter. Smooth, juicy, richly sweet palate. Finishes long, juicy, fresh hop bitter. Absolutely delightful.
Bottled. Nice brown. Has a big hop floral taste. Nice sweet nutty malt after taste. Awesome easy drinkable imperial IPA.

Bottle. Gold-amber pour, dense light tan head. Great head retention and lots of sticky lacing. Nose is citrus orange, malty caramel and pine. Taste follows through on the terrific balance between sweet malt leading into a nice lasting bitter finish. Lives up to the hype.
Good color and a nice faint aroma. Doesnt taste as hoppy as Id expect from an IIPA. The barley clearly takes a lot of place making it more like the english roots of the style.

Bottle. Pours a clearish orange with a lasting foamy off white head leaving loads of lacing around the glass. Aroma of orange, caramel, some burnt notes, pine, woody. Taste is of orange, melon, caramel, some exotic fruits, sweet on the finish with sherry or rum flavours coming through. Soft carbonation, oily mouthfeel. Really smooth and well balanced. Loved this.

Aroma is roasty malts, caramel, toffee, light honey, clove, slight earthiness, lemongrass and citrus. Taste is rich roasted malts , caramel and toffee with a deep hop profile akin to the aroma that is fabulously balanced and finishes remarkably smoothly. Appearance is a clear gold with a thin pearl head that retains fairly well.

Deep golden with an off white head - Good malt and hop aroma with hints of fruity notes - Malt ot support a nice hop profile that gives a decent bitterness - Long lasting hop finish that has some dry bitterness - This was nice
Bottle. Amber colour with white head. Citric, malt aroma. Sweet, malt, caramel, citric, fruity, pine, bitter taste. Medium to full body.

Probada draft en Barcade Chelsea. Imperial IPA que deja un sabor en el paladar solo comparable con probar un pedazo de cielo. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

9% ABV. Imperial IPA.

Poured of the bottle a deep rich amber, 16-18ºSRM.

Nose was full of fresh roasted malty flavors. Sweet but not cloying. Not much in the nose to suggest that this is an IPA.

Heavy soapy, syrupy mouthfeel, this is an homage to the very best quality barley malt that started this whole brew. All that sugar contributed to the robustly alcoholic palate that is gradually scrubbed off by progressively bitter herbaceous and eventually almost bright citrus hops. Finishes with a palate that is like sweet tangerine peel. Sweet and bitter at the same time, like getting French-kissed and then bitten on the lip. Perfectly balanced. Again, the fact that this is an IPA slowly reveals itself in a most engagingly intriguing and painfully teasing fashion. A artfully choreographed brewing striptease.

A wondrous effort by the fine folks at Doghead Fish.

Goes on Favorites List big time (top 10) although the one that I had wasnt perfectly fresh!!!

I dont know if theres a protocol that says, dont review the style, review the beer, but I gave this one a shot not realizing that its a barley wine (or very close to one) a style I cant tolerate. Too malty, too sweet, too hoppy, too strong, too winey (port or sherry), too over the top, too unrelated to what I actually like, i.e., beer. I like the DH 60 minute, I like strong IPAs (Southern Tiers 2X, Lagunitas Maximus and so on) but really cannot handle this overcooked beer soup.

Bière de couleur ambrée caramel très limpide et gazeuse avec une mousse légèrement tenace
Olé va sentir des notes dagrumes mais aussi sucré comme le caramel la cassonade les écorces de pamplemousse les fruits exotiques
En bouche on va sortir les saveur très fruitée un peu comme le raisin ou la pomme avec une amertume assez franche
Cest une super bonne bière est assez complexe à expliquer
Hard to find fault with this one. Stronger tasting than I usually like but in a good way. One my favourites list for sure!

Lets start with the easy bit. It looks like a DIPA: rusty orange, white head, good lacing. Full bodied. Powerful and boozy. Now the trickier bit. This is a very different IPA. Its like the last two thirds of a "normal IPA", with the caramel malt and bitter finish, but no fruit bomb at the start. Its malty enough to be a Belgian strong ale, but without the spicy yeast. Deep and dark enough to be an old ale, but not quite complex enough. Just a little citrus nip at the end to remind you what it is.

Picked up while in Door county 

Great appearance and decent mouthfeel. 

Not sure this beer is a 100 beer though.

Great nose of everything you want in IPA, fruity citrus pine grass all above yum. Flavor of same just palate is a tad sweet. A little too much caramelize for me. Not bad but just keeps it from a five score.

Poured from a 12 oz bottle. Appearance is a clear deep orange in color, a large amount of very light tan head. Aroma is a sweet, syrupy, light hops aroma. Taste is slightly sweet, slightly boozy pine-citrus hops. Palate is medium. Overall, quite the powerhouse. Boozy but not too boozy.
Mild aroma. Hops and malts are well balanced in my opinion. Drinks almost like a barley wine, but maybe slightly less sweet.  ---Rated via Beer Buddy for Android

Murky orange color color, small white head. Aroma of grape fruit, tropical fruit and sweet malt. Surprisingly sweet taste with notes of orange, grape fruit, bitter hops, alcohol, malt. Not your everyday ipa - very good though

Pours copper with some nice thick long lasting head. Aroma is a piny dankish hop. Flavor is great. Balance of bitter, malt, and hop well combined. The sweetness is pretty light flavored, not roasty. The hop flavor feels orange like and the bitterness seems to just be a hint towards the beginning. Medium to thick body. Love me a malty ipa.

Bottle purchased at Historic Casanova in Hudson, WI. This one comes with pretty high expectations. Pours a heavy handed head. Color is pretty solid copper with strong head retention. Slightly off white on the froth. Taste initially throws me off...less piney/hoppy than anticipated. You can definitely taste the amber/caramel malt flavors at the start and middle of the sip before it gives way to a little bit more of the citrusy tendencies of a traditional imperial IPA. Feels like a heavy mouthfeel with an oily/syrupy lean. The alcohol doesnt shy away from making its presence felt. Overall, its not really my style of Imperial IPA...maybe I went in with too high of expectations.

12oz bottle from Hudson with commonmac. Light copper with very thick foamy head. Powerful bread and alcohol hop nose. Sweet grain, sugar, almost raisin. Not very hoppy at all for the style. Mouthfeel is smooth and not a crisp dry bite. Finish is almost whiskey like or similar to a barrel aged feel. A very distinctive dipa.
Excellent aroma of pine and dried apricot. Nice carbonation, and white head. Mild malts and some caramel. Thick mouthfeel. Dried fruit hop finish.

355 ml bottle bought at Q-Club in SoHo, Central.
Looks: Clear amber honey colour; One-quarter finger head and residual soapy white foam which fades in 20 seconds; Very good sticky lacing with quite fizzy small carbonation.

Aroma: Fragrant, oozing and very sweet Ale malt, with fruit cakes, raisins, light brandy, floral, quite strong liquor-ish alcohol, strong sugar, pine, strong resin, Yeast, lime cordial and grass.

Taste: Medium sweet, very rich Amber Ale malt, with very light caramel, very light grapefruit, raisins, light brandy, quite strong alcohol, syrup, strong pine, very strong resin, biscuits, yeast, strong lime, moderate to strong bitter hops and quite sharp grass.

Body: Full body. Thick and very oozy palate.

Mouth Feel: A simple-minded amber malty bomb! Rich to the core in a thick and somewhat oily background. Tastes match as much as the aroma with strong and sweet brandied fruitcakes, very strong ooze but pine is not that strong. Syrupy and oozy turned the limey hops into cordial, but manages to be pretty comfy all along. Quite amazing!

Hoppiness: Very strong fruit cakes soaked in light brandy, raisins, lime, pine and strong resin in both nose and taste.

Bitterness: the 90 IBUs seems pretty low-fi compares to most German Pils at even lower bitterness level. Still a good lasting, quite strong astringent sweet malty finish.
 
After Taste: Fairly dry. Sweet-oozy and bitter to mouth.

Comments: This is a fairly hard-hitting IIPA, walked in a rather simple direction to give you a knock without being too bashful. The brandy liquor background is tamer than many strong Belgian ales, and the resiny ooze does not go overboard, which I like, and while the hoppiness is simple, the overall result is comfy and enjoyable, small sips at a time of course. Strange but nice!

Botella @II cata Ratebeer Asturias. 19/07/2015 
Color ambar, aroma frutal, sabores dulces, malta, final seco.
Espuma consistente, muy buen cuerpo, sabores dulces pero a la vez lupulada.

Flaska från Best of Beers, Ålborg. 
Tungt dimmig mörk bärnsten med ett lättare vitt skum. 
Doftar riktigt tungt av övermogen frukt och granskog. 
Fantastiskt len i smaken, kraftfull maltbas med en söt torkad fruktsmak. 
Något klen i beskan kan jag tycka, men ytterst välbalanserad i sin helhet. 
Perfektion! 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

UPDATED: AUG 3, 2015 pours clear light amber with a white head and nice lacing. aroma is not very strong; some sprucy hops, raisins. flavour is dominated by malts; caramel, raisins, oranges. balanced bitter finish. interesting, but a bit too sweet for my taste.

On tap at Cobbs Landing. Appearance is dark straw with white head with good retention. Nose is surprisingly bland, but what this beer lacks in aroma is made up in taste. This continues to be one of my favorite imperial IPAs.

Pours a cloudy orange amber hue with a medium frothy head and medium carbonation. Has floral/spruce hop aroma. Taste is bitter and fruity and leaves the tongue dry afterwards. Overall, the beer isnt that bad but dont recommend it to newbies.

Bottle - pours Amber with white head. Was expecting a big hop aroma, quite surprised by Hom much the malt dominates. Taste is quite sweet and fruity with a decent amount of the hop coming through. Mouthfeel is creamy light carbonation.
Very effervescent and well balanced. Sweeter and not as hoppy as expected, which was too bad. It was a gift and I was happy to be able to try it, as I have heard lots of good things about it.
A very well balanced IPA. Slightly sweet malty flavor mixes with a nice light hoppy citrus flavor. Another wonderful brew by the DFH guys!
Zacht van smaak, lichte tinteling en bitter. Merk niet dat het een biertje van 9% is..
Just had the Swedish fish infusion version. Really smooths out the hops. Adds a sweet flavor and that touch of strawberry licorice. Tap
Sampler at Mondial de la Biere in Montreal. Hazy golden body, medium white head. Faint aroma of peaches, oranges and caramel. Taste of grapefruit zest, orange candies, peach. Too sweet for my taste.

i love the balance of this beer. The flavor is strong and the finish is smooth. All hop-heads need not apply as this is a great balanced beer with no hint of the 9% alcohol it delivers. Reminds me of Nugget Nector and a tiny bit of Hopslam.

330ml bottle at home. Light hazy golden orange color with off white head. Aroma is malty and hoppy, caramel, pine, citrus fruits. Sweet and bitter taste like aroma. Medium oily body with soft carbonation.

OHKAY AMERCA LISTEN TO THIS LET ME TELL YOU BIG COPORATE BREWERYS MAKE THIS WEAK BEERS THEYRE DONT DO OWN HOPS AND THEN PUT DUBEL IPA (INDIAN PALE ALES) ON THE FRONT. WELL YOU BELIEF STUFF LIKE RACHELE DOLEZOL THEN OBAMA SO WHY NOT THIS $$)@ TO. HERES THE TRUTH DUBEL IPA (PLINY (THE ULTIMATE BEERS IN THE EARTH) NEEDS REAL HOPS (200++ IBU) $$ 90 MINUTES TASTE LIKE FLAYVER OF FRUITS AND SPICE BUT WHERE IS HOP!!! NEEDS MORE HOPS!!

355 ml. bottle @ home. Obtained in a trade with LouS. Thanks! Bottled on 04/08/15. Touch darker caramel amber, a handful of small stream of rising bubbles, off-white, small solid head. Nose is oddly malt, plenty of biscuit malts, some caramel, mellow candied fruit, cake, light maple, totally different from what I expected. Taste is herbal bitter, bitter tea, faint cough syrup bitter mixed with biscuit, faint maple & rum cake, raisin, light pine, bitter herbal & light plant, tea leaves taste, light rum-like booziness, quite heavily malty, herbal, faint ginseng, Malty, lightly chewy & heavily biscuit body. Totally different from expected. Quite British in a way. Quite herbal, biscuit & rum cake like. A bit odd & rather unusual for the style. I can see this being quite the divisive brew despite the excellent score on RB. Interesting beer.

Copper color ;medium-sized off-white head. Marmalade and caramel aroma, some spicy straw hops and booze present in the smell as well. Taste is sweet candied oranges and caramel followed by barley spice and straw.

Jaune orange foncée, avec une bonne couche de mousse blanche ; carbonatation faible, texture mi-mince. Nez de malts caramel, de sucre cuit et dananas. En bouche, les saveurs sont impressionnantes, les houblons dominent joliment, sans amertume âcre. Les malts forment un lit solide qui soutient la plante verte de façin admirable, sans prendre toute la place mais en saffirmant fermement. Délicieuse.

Btl pours crystal clear copper color with a huge tight head that hangs on forever leaving huge webs of lace on glass. This beer just looks amazing! Aromas of caramel, alcohol,cooked apricots,brown sugar and other candied fruits. Tastes of sweet toffee,a hint of alcohol,earthy hops and light toast. Medium body, smooth,soft mouthfeel,perfect carbonation and a slightly bitter and dry finish. This IIPA is simply amazing. Nicely balanced, easy to drink beer that is smooth as a babys a$$! What an absolutely outstanding time to be partaking right in the middle of the craft beer "Revolution"!!!!
I am not an I.P.A. fan. But in all honesty this is one of my favorites. With the strong malt presence as well as a great mouthfeel. Has a copper body, and a strong hop afterbite

Si ce nétait de son manque deffervescence (javoue que le 9% aide un peu) et du fait que les houblons se font discrets au nez pour une Imperial IPA, elle serait en tête de liste. Fruits confits, citron, caramel, grains fumés (tourbe on dirait), petit côté vineux, un beau mélange quoi! Jen prendrais tous les jours ;-) Lalcool est tellement discret que ça fait peur!!! Elle me rappelle certains Barleywine américains bien houblonnés...

Marmalade and caramel aroma, some spicy straw hops and booze present in the smell as well. Taste is sweet candied oranges and caramel followed by barley spice and straw. Taste seems to very much match the aroma.
Has decent head and a good foggy copper body. Flavour is indeed hoppy but not in the complexity department that all these accolades seem to suggest. Nonetheless its highly drinkable.

BOTTLE. Poured clear golden in colour, solid but thin white head. Sweet fruity hops on the nose with subtle sherbet. Nice fruity hops up front, passionfruit?? subtle malt middle with a good citrus hoppy finish... hides the ABV extremely well.. Sourced RW

12oz btl. 3/27/15 bottle date (69 days old). Appearance: clear golden with a moderate off white foam cap. 
Aroma: Underlying resin and maltiness, with a pop of grapefruit and peaches. 
Taste: Rich maltiness with fruity, fig like flavors, with a toasted edge, giving way to a balanced bittereness that gradually increases in strength. 
Mouthfeel: Medium body with moderate carbonation
Finish: Dry, resinous feeling left on the tongue, with strong but not sharp
Overall: A great, classic IIPA. Strong enough malt backbone to balance the high IBU, while remaining extremely drinkable, especially for the style.

Bottle from Hannaford Supermarket Exeter NH. Aroma is strong piney/spruce hops along with toasted malts. Appearance is beautiful crystal clear light golden orange with trace sparkling, 1/2 finger width head that dissipates quickly to ring with fair lacing. Taste is robust complex mix of malty sweetness with sweet liquor fruitiness and finishing mild bitterness. Palate is light bodied but meaty texture and lively carbonation at the sides of the tongue. Overall, this is a beer with a lot of things going for it--complex aroma and taste with a beautiful look and an interesting palate.

Pours pretty amber-orange, initially hazy with effervescence but quickly clears, and modest off-white head that reduces to skim.
Big pine aroma with whiff of citrus and brown sugar. Even bigger, rougher palate with candied mango and grapefruit, biscuit, fortified wine, vanilla and cleaning solvents, like a PineSol fruitcake.
The disparate tastes seem like Thomas Pynchons spoofs of English candy in "Gravitys Rainbow:" salted plum, gin marshmallow, camphor nougat, sweet-and-sour eggplant. 
90 Minute goes past the usual over-hopped American IPA, with similarly large amounts of malt taking it into barleywine country, albeit a very evergreen type of barley. On the plus side, that puts it into better balance than a lot of rival products. 
And the 9 percent ABV, while substantial, is quite reasonable for a barleywine. Still, you probably dont want to be operating your backhoe while drinking this.
In short, a prime example of the more is not enough school of American brewing, throw everything at the wall and see what sticks. Completely unsophisticated, but true to the wackiness that is Dogfish Head.

Bottle from BarleyWine, Copenhagen - orange amber pour with good white head. Aroma and taste is big sweet malty, tropical, citric and herbal hoppy, piney hop resin, sweet caramel, toffee, cake like, also some dried fruit, and slight spice gives it almost a barleywine impression, beautiful.

Amber in color. Pours a one finger head that goes away over time. I smell a lot of malts. Not much else. Medium body. Very well balanced. Its not as hoppy as I thought it would be. Goes down smooth. Oily texture. Overall REALLY good beer. I would like a bit more hop presence on the taste, but its balanced VERY well so Im just being picky.

Bottled 03/18/15. Pours crystal clear golden honey orange, effervescence with off-white creamy looking head. Aroma is citrus hops, malt, slight grape, grapefruit, mango, papaya, tropical notes with lots of biscuit malt and candied sugar to balance. Flavor is citrus, honey, sweet malts, mango, papaya, grapefruit, really sweet citrus. Just such sweet fruits. Like candied fruits. Its got a great IPA bitterness but its so sweet at the same time. Effervescent on the body. Its been a while since I had this. It was the first IPA I really thought was fantastic. And coming back to it, its all still there. Still amazing.

Aroma has malt, citrus, caramel. Taste is malty with bitter and quite dry finish. Flavors of grape, pine, grass. Nice balance between malt and hoppiness.

Very pretty deep orange pour with a thin-ish white head. Tangy nose...citrus and brandy. The entire experience is indeed like drinking a brandied fruiitcake (which I like). Raisins, citron and bready malt. I know the hops are in there, but not a hoppy beer in a traditional sense. 

I dont taste a west coast ipa, just my opinion.

Pours golden with a long white, foamy head. Nose is pure hop deliciousness with a touch of apple. Flavor is classic west coast IPA and quite well balanced. Nothing ground breaking but a fine west coast style IPA.
Bloody excellent beer, fantastic look and pour. Growler az bought! Herbal notes. Will definitely buy again.
Gyllenorange vätska, med tjockt skum. Dofter av grape, mango och något annat, kryddigt. Bra punch i beskan. Fruktig med en söt närvaro, som beskan lätt bemästrar.
Bon gout de fruits rouges avec de bonne notes damertumes. Gout dalcool plutot present mais tres bien dosé.

Bottle. Appearance: copper colour with fluffy white head. Aroma: fruity and floral, hops, citrus fruits, malts. Taste: malts, caramel, citrus fruity notes, hoppy bitterness. Great balance. Medium body. This is one of the best DIPA out there!

Bottle on Acela train. Ive had this beer many, many times. Very good. Nose is hoppy and pine. Taste is lots of hops but really well balanced. Very smooth texture and enjoyable. Smooth and creamy in the delectable finish.

Bottle on Acela train. Ive had this beer many, many times. Very good. Nose is hoppy and pine. Taste is lots of hops but really well balanced. Very smooth texture and enjoyable. Smooth and creamy in the delectable finish.

Aroma is malty and hoppy with citrus and oranges. Some pineoil breaks through. Deep malts. Taste is sweet with caramels, pine needles and gentle hops falling from the sky in the end. Dry ending and pleasant bitterness. A superb Imperial Ipa.
Poured medium amber with a frothy off white head. Aroma of moderately heavy citrus and floral hops. Medium body, flavour is medium sweet, lightly bitter.
Absolutely the perfect IPA. Draft or bottle, doesnt much matter. Clean, crisp taste, mild hops, and amazing finish.
2014-10-19 Bottle. Pours copper in color with a white head. Piny, citrus aroma, slightly weak (probably by the age of the beer). Good malty base over hoppy, bitter finish.

UPDATED: MAY 10, 2015 12 oz pour from refrigerated bottle into Spiegelau IPA glass. Moderate fluffy white head with nice retention and lacing. A bit opaque. Golden. Nose is citrus, pine, and malt. Mouthfeel is fairly creamy. Crisp. Taste is complex. Buttery, piney, citrus (strong orange and tangerine). Strong malty backbone balances well all the aggressive hops. Theres a lot going on here, but it never feels like too much. Awesome IPA.
Good. Sweet nose. Molasses at the start, Hoppy middle. Thick mouth feel with a bit of a bitter finish.

Pours dark clear orange. Hops with fruity aromas. Tastes hops and fruits like pineapple. Hops bitterness is balanced with malts. Not a true IPA but tastes really good! Edited: additional spicey taste of cinnamon.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Wow, the malt bill just about makes this well balanced, but this is a full on beer, hitting you with hops and abv.

One of my favorites. Usually I prefer my hoppier IPAs and the West Coast styles, but the 90 minute is a malty work of beauty in my eyes. Slightly harsh in the finish, but thats really the only downside in my mind; Deliciously balanced and an exemplary imperial IPA overall. Sadly hard to find on tap here however!

독피쉬헤드-나& 임페리얼 IPA 9% ABV 스무스하게, 하지만 높이 치고 올라오는 알콜기의 고도수 IPA. 도수를 높이려 당을 더 첨가하고,당 비중이 높아지므로 맛이 점점 단순해질수 밖에 없는듯. 시트러스향의 예쁜맥주
https://twitter.
Beer no 318 for me. One I've been looking forward to for a while. I forgot my snifter and escargot, but Drank with my good buddy Drew. Great beer but a bit under hopped in my humble opinion.
Copper color ;medium-sized off-white head. Aroma of pine , grapefruit and malt. Taste follows the aroma. Strong hoppy bitterness , but very easy to drink .Great IPA.

Very hoppy, smelled as such. Malty and pine notes as well. On tap. Easier drinker than most DIPAs. Very solid, as good as you hear about. Not the biggest fan of Dogfish Head but this is a good one. Enjoyed it.
This is a great beer...probably one of the best IPAs out there. Lots of hops that follow to the aftertaste-- also have some malty aromas.

This was another old-school beer that got me into IPAs and DIPAs. I had rated this higher originally on beerpal, but downgraded a few points after a few more samples over the years. Still a solid beer for this style, just have found some more well-balanced ones out there.
This beer did not tickle my palate it started off watery and flushed my touge with massive amounts of pine note which mad it wicked bitter. There are much better ipas out there
Poured from a bottle. Golden color with a great bitter hop and citrusy. Very smooth. I agree with the hype that it is one of the best IPAs.

Bottle from Craft Beer Cellar. Poured into a Shaker, a hazy orange colour with a fingers worth of head. Aromas of pine and citrus, like any good AIPA. Carbonation was somewhat softer than I expect for an IPA. Taste was somewhat sweeter and maltier than other imperials Ive had recently - I actually like this in an IPA. Other than the lack of fizz, I couldnt find much to dislike about this one.

Bottle sample at Beer & Beyond, Tel Aviv. Clear golden with small off-white head. Very malty aroma, notes of toffee and caramel with some prune and hint of hops. Very sweet and malty flavor, sugary, notes of raisin, moderate hoppy bitterness, some citrus and caramel notes. Soft carbonation, medium to full-bodied. Not so fresh and quite hard to drink.

Bottle sample at a tasting at Beer & Beyond shop. Clear copper orange with a small head. Aroma - very malty, fruity, alcohol and biscuits. Taste of sweet malts, honey, caramel, sugary and fruity with bitter finish. Medium bodied, sticky, low carbonation. Too heavy and not fresh.
Well hopped. Small taste of toffee and alcohol. Small bitterness. Good beer overall

oured from a 12 oz. bottle into a pint glass.
Aroma- Has a citrus aroma along with a whiff of alcohol.
Appearance- Pours a clear amber color with almost zero head.
Taste- Hops and malt with an alcohol bite.
Palate- A heavy bodied brew with mild carbonation. This beer has a very dry finish.
Overall- A really good beer but I didnt enjoy it enough to give it world class ratings.

Bottle (trade non Rate Beer member); pours clear orange gold with a khaki head; aroma is malt, tropical fruits, pine, and a little caramel; taste is caramel, tropical fruits, and malt; has a bitter hop finish; very nice imperial IPA

UPDATED: NOV 21, 2016 2016 re-rate: Yeah this is still so good. Nothing changing on the rating. Old rating. Bottle from Old Town. Hazy orange color with a big soapy off-white head. Big citrus, grapefruit aromas with hints of caramel malt, honey and pine needle. Well-balanced. Sweet and bitter on the palate. Nice creamy mouthfeel. Bready and biscuity aromas come out as it warms up along with more tropical fruit from the hops. Fairly easy drinking for the ABV with a great bitter finish.

Everything is awesome here from great hop pine aroma greatness, only down side is cloying sweetness associated with this. It would be fine for a barley wine or Xmas ale but not for this type. Didnt let me dislike the overall experience.

Amber pour, thin skein of tan foam. Aroma is light, given the hop load. Smells a little malty in fact. Flavor is similar. Underwhelming hop flavor dominated by malt backbone. Interesting, and tasty, but not a fave in the world of big IPAs.

Bottle to glass. Pours a nice amber color with an off white head. Aroma is a pungent fresh citrusy, fleshy fruit hop character with a solid caramel malt background. Flavor is a good blend of malty sweetness and huge fruity hoppy goodness. A very tasty double IPA.

Couleur dorée-ambrée translucide avec un col blanc résistant. Aromes de caramel, sucre brun, agrumes, un peu de résine, fruits rouges. Bien balancé, pas trop explosive pour une DIPA. Respectable mais pas tout a fait dans ma gamme!

Bottle 0,355 l. Good foam, light orange color, powerful aroma of hops with half hundred of shades: herbs, pine needles, tropical fruits, berries, powerful malt. Well balanced taste with many hops: fruit, pine, wine like porto, excellent malt profile, good bitterness, perfect finish. Excellent example of Imperial IPA.
Bottle. Dark golden pour with a creamy head. Big hop and malt aroma and taste. Well balanced bitterness. Truly a world class Imperial IPA.
Cloudy orange pour, small white head. Aroma is hops, citrus, malts and grapefruit. Taste is well balanced malts and hops. Citrus and grapefruit taste. Oily smooth texture. Very well done.
Heavy on the hops - tropical fruits, lightly cloudy golden colour, good sized white head, a please to drink hop hop and then some more for good luck, full bodied with a some more hops to finish.

Cant believe I have never rated this legend... Pours a brilliant golden copper with a nice head that sticks around (heavy lace). Simple clean aroma profile: caramel, resin, dough, with a little woody vanilla. Taste is out of the park awesome. A perfect balance. Palate: medium body, velvet texture, soft carbonation, with an easy bitter finish. Quite an offering.

UPDATED: JAN 25, 2016 As someone who is trying to ease himself into the world of hops, I was not sure how this was gonna go. In the end I was pleased. The malty backbone eases the 90 ibus while still allowing the hops to shine. The finish is long and bitter.
Everything is great about this brew except price and some residual sweetness. Excellent hops in nose and flavor. Some what like seet peach pine cone flavor.

This one really has to be tried to be believed. At first I thought it would be the usually over the top hop bomb that most double ipas are but it surprised be with how well balanced it is for being both strong in the flavor of the hops which are fruity and sweet the malt is while at the same time covering the big alcohol of this beer. Absolutely delicious and should be the standard for this category.

An amber colored beer with an off-white, thin head. The aroma is not so intensive, but crispy and soury. The taste is complex, full body; crispy notes with banana and caramel. Very lond and bitter aftertaste.
Its not the best beer that Ive ever tasted, but good.
Very good beer with excellent flavor. Rather bitter after taste but over all a very good beer

An impressive imperial beer, worthy of it's reputation indeed. From a bottle, this poured a beautiful and perfect bronzed amber color with a steady white foamy head and strong lacing, a pleasure to observe. This beer just looks like a refined and full flavored beverage. Aroma is appetizing also, strong and flavorful of rich candied apple malt and grapefruit hops, but some alcohol warmth from the high ABV. The taste is layered and complex, caramel malt and fruity sweet malt notes, along with some hoppy resin and tropical citrusy notes. Warming and rich throughout. Medium bodied and smooth, although some alcohol bite along with hoppy bitterness in the finish. Possibly my go-to Imperial IPA, not that I consume this style often. I found this far more enjoyable than Dogfish's renowned 120 Minute mega IPA.
35 cl bottle @ home. Pours clear golden amber with a white head that leaves a little lacing. Aroma and flavour are resin, pine, citrus, and malt - with a bitter finish.
Overall great taste. However, the after taste was a bit too bitter for my liking. Nonetheless, I highly enjoyed it.
Bottle at the Mandalay Bay Hotel Las Vegas. Is as described, 100th percentile - really? Good but had better
Bottle, classic ipa. Nice hop aroma while having a really nice malty backboned body. Really good.
Poured into a shaker pint at a restaurant. Pours golden amber with no head..... mild grassy notes not overly hoppy
What can I say that hasnt already been said. This is a great beer and one of the best IPAs on the market.
It has a really sweet grassy aroma, classic IPA, has some punch to the smell too. It tastes a lot smoother than other double IPAs, surprised its supposedly 90 IBU.

Bottle into snifter. I am not an IPA fan but I did like the imperial version - the extra malt sweetness of the imperial balances some of what I consider excessive hops of most IPAs. Notes of candy, raisins, brandy and perhaps citrus if you think about it. Approaches a Belgian triple. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Copper hue with a tan head. The aroma is fruit and floral. The taste is bitter at first but mellows out some towards a sweeter finish. You can taste the intense hops of an imperial ale.

UPDATED: FEB 1, 2015  I have been wanting to try this beer for quite some time. I have to admit I was a little disappointed. Not sure what I was looking for, but it was more than that. Decent color with a small head. Very little lacing. Not much aroma. Very malty aftertaste with not much hop bitterness. Really expected more. 60 minutes is actually better.

UPDATED: JUN 9, 2015 Clear, golden/amber color with solid head. The smell is surprisingly hoppy sweet instead of bitter smell. The bitterness is rather decent, but noticeable. The sweetness is like drinking cristal sugar sirup. The taste reminds of chewing gum with herbal flavor, but in a good way. I had to redo my rating. This actually has its justification even if its still not my favorite.
[ölprovning med Rydis och Robert, januari 2015] fantastisk balans mellan maltens sötma och humlens beska.

Dogfish Head 90 Minute Imperial IPA was one of the first truly big IPA brews of the style and has earned its place in the proverbial Craft Beer Hall of Fame. Its radically different when compared to brews of the style today because its so well-balanced. In fact, it might even been too malty for its own good, as it seems to drink like an imperial amber ale. Regardless, its still quite delectable and easy to drink  no wonder its endured all these years.

I poured a 12oz bottle into the official Dogfish Head goblet. It was bottled on 10/2/14 and cost $3.99 ($0.33 per ounce).

Appearance: Beautiful copper hue; mostly clear with a slight haze; plenty of visible carbonation. Pours to a two-finger, white frothy head which laces and retains very well.

Smell: For a supposedly hoppy beer theres a strong malt presence in the nose. Sweet notes of caramel and brown sugar, plus flowers and pine needles.

Taste: This is an overtly malty IPA. Theres a lot of sweetness and its immediately recognizable. Toffee, caramel and other candy flavors lay the foundation for a hefty malt base. Though a highly-hopped beer at 90 IBUs, its actually not all that bitter (well, not aggressively so). Like a good East Coast-style hoppy brew, the bitterness is slightly dank with a taste of piney and floral hops. The alcohol appears on the back end, accentuating the malt character and imparting mild warmth. Theres a distinct taste akin to coffee right as it finishes; probably due to some specialty malt. This is a well-rounded beer to say the least and an enjoyable one due to its uniqueness. An oldie but a goodie.

Drinkability: This is the kind of beer that was probably a behemoth when it debuted (or to craft beer drinking newbies); yet it seems so pedestrian in its delivery. Definitely full-bodied, but the mouthfeel is not as intense or cloying or sticky as you might expect. Theres even slight crispness from the carbonation. At 9% ABV its not surprising to find the alcohol plays a role in providing some warmth, but its far from a fire-breather. Additionally, at 90 IBUs its not an enamel-scraper, either. There is some lingering bitterness, but its easily tolerable. This is the kind of beer that will pair perfectly with a meal that can match its robustness and balance.
Malty and hoppy! Maybe one of the best imperial IPA from USA. The constant hopping process gave this beer an intense (but not hard) hop flavor. On my case I also noticed a spice finish. Try it!!

Copied from my BA review.

Bottle date: 07.23.14.
Poured from a 12 oz bottle on 09.15.14 into a beer can glass.

A: 1 finger head. See through gold/yellow. Can see bubbles rising to the top.

S: Honey, grapefruit, orange. The smell blends together. The flavors dont stand out much individually.

T: Honey, grapefruit, orange are most apparent. Hop resin is more subtle.

M: Seems like it has enough carbonation. Somewhat creamy.

O: This is a very complex IIPA. The flavors follow the nose in blending together, which adds to the complexity, but theyre muted. So muted, I forgot that this was an IIPA. It is definitely in the East Coast style for IPAs, which I dont usually enjoy. This one was simply ok for me. I thought that the 60 Minute was better and more hop forward, which I prefer. Maybe the hops died a little while sitting on the shelf, but I doubt it from what other reviewers have written. If you like a well-balanced IIPA, this one may be for you, but I didnt care for it.

Gold pour, steady and creamy white head. Nose is restrained pine, touch of alcohol. Bitter. Middle is soft caramel, dried fruit, and a hint of citrus. Finish is bittersweet and lasting. Dangerously smooth.
35,5 cl. bottle. Clear amber colour with an off-white head. Aroma and flavour of hops, fruit, malt and caramel.

This is truly the perfect Imperial IPA. From the appearance to the aroma, this beer captures everything this style should. The malt profile is just enough to complement the tremendous amount of wonderful hops.

IPA wise, this beer is almost perfect for me! Pours an amber/orange liquid. Tiny bubbles going up from the bottom of the glass. One finger medium-foamy head. Appearance is delightful! Aromas of fruity but not citrucy hops. I get pears and peaches. The mouthfeel is really really what got me: a warm wave of fresh fruits invading the mouth and going down the throath. Its a bit oily, a little sugary but nothing to mmuch - so smooth!!!! The smoothness is overwhelming! I didnt give this beer a perfect score because to me, perfection doesnt exist when it comes to describe either food or beer. An fantastic one for me!
UPDATED: JAN 13, 2015 Intense, flowery hops flavors overwhelm the palate. Very slightly sweet, long bitter finish. Strong lingering grapefruit flavors.

12fl oz bottle imported by a good buddy. Strong and steady carbonation in a clear poured golden brown. Malted fruit loaf aroma nada massive alcohol punch on the mouth. The hops make their presence felt above the malty backbone and the finishes rounded and bitter. Full on amigo.

Malty and thick but hoppy. Not too much. Surprisingly smooth for an imperial. Great beer

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

I don't have to be a good day to be a good time to get a new one is the best of luck to 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Fantastic, but a little too much malt for me. Every time I drink this I get the taste of bubblegum. When fresh, ideally, it has a good balance of aromatics and bitterness, and even with some age it holds up. Unique among Imperial IPAs for me, as is most of DFH beer.

Pours a gorgeous copper color. The aroma was lighter than expected and somewhat syrupy. The caramel sweet flavor is not my preference, but to its credit is very easy to drink. The glass was empty before I knew it.

Pours an amber color, clear, topped with a decent white head and nice retention. Sweet and malty aroma, lots of caramel notes, some fruity notes as well. Taste is sweet, way too sweet and fruity for my liking, lots of caramel and some spices. Finishes with a bitterness, but again sweetness and malty feel in the aftertaste. Not my favourite.

Medium aroma with fruits, sweet pine and some alcohol. Light golden color with small/medium white head. Strong/medium taste has some sweet and a bit artificial component that masks other flavors like tropical fruits and floral notes. Some alcohol and clear taste of malts. Lots of hops that follows to the aftertaste that also have some malty aromas. Medium taste spectrum. Medium body with light/medium carbonation. Overall nice try with some individual character. Unfortunately, that character is also something that brings the grading down.

Overrated. Doesnt have the mighty dank, fresh hop presence of a Pliny or Un-Human Cannonball, Ruinten. Nor the competence and refinement of a dreadnaught. It seems a little rough round the edges.
Esquire dont know shit about beer.
Malt is dominant in the aroma - Maple syrup, caramel, a little bread, maybe a little molasses. Alcohol. Some pine and dirty citrus. Theres an unpleasant ammonia undermining it all.
Tastes moderately better than it smells. Sweet brandy, vinous initially. Before some deep, pleasant caramel malt. Sturdy and supportive. Barley and grains emerge. Moderate piney bitterness. Rising pine. Very little citrus presence.

Lovely hazy orange golden color with a fine off white head that leaves a fine lacing down the glass. Would have expected a bit more powerful aroma. Mild tropical fruity and grapefruit hoppy. Thick oily liquid. A bit sweet with a fine bitterness. Well it is actuallt some wheat in this one. That explain why I get a little bit banana feeling. Did not do it any harm. Would have been a veeery sweet dessert wine without the heavy hoppy balance. Tropical fruity, oranges, grapefruit hoppy and some banana in the flavor. Lovely evening sipper.[Bottle from a trade with CH-303]

Crystal clear orange colour with a dark white head, good lacings. Aromas of marmalade biscuit malt and raisin arise. Somewhat effervescent texture with fruity raisiny sweet flavour notes supported by some bready biscuit cake flavours. Light bitterness lingers on the back of the palate for a good while.

A dark yellow, slightly orange beer with a medium and blond head. The nose has strong fructose and slightly caramelly sweetness, some tropical fruits and rainy pine forest, also strawberries. Taste isnt so sweet as aroma, however there is strong caramelly maltyness, riped fruits, some pine needles. Probably, there is strong bitterness as the high sweetness is drying. Otherwise, the bitterness isnt feel very strong but balanced. Almost full bodied but not heavy, nice carbonation. Not as tropical DIPA as I expected, more riped fruits. Good balance, despite of the strong maltyness.

Smells great, looks nice, pours with a great head. Taste is fairly sweet for an IPA. Very nice beer all in all.
Have had in bottle and on tap.

355ml bottle from Saveur Biere. Bottled 07/09/14.


Clear orange colour with a big white head. Caramel, alcohol, sweetness, fruits. Nice but probably lost the best shape already.

Floral aroma with notes of malt and lychee. Clear copper colour. Sweet butterscotch front with flavours of orange, bourbon, and cereal; mild bitterness with quick finish. Medium body with mild carbonation. That is a really tasty beer.

UPDATED: FEB 21, 2015 Chilled 12 oz bottle from local supermarket. Have been on the West Coast in the Bay Area for 6 months and said would never buy an East Coast brew coz it would not be needed. But tried this today. Outstanding, as others have remarked a great balance between malt and hops. This is truly one of the greats of US craft brewing. Would love to try on draught.

@Pegulier pub (NYC) golden, misty with a full off-white head. nose: a lot of hops chocolate, spices. taste: caramel, chocolate. bitter sweet, bit dry. soft body, small in carbonation. good full MF. probably one of the strangest "IPAs" I ever had. Imperial indeed. crossover.

Bottle from ABC. Pours a perfect, shimmering golden amber with a frothy white head and ample lacing. Smells of floral, citrus, herbs, with an earthy backbone and some lingering malt. Flavor is bitter and somewhat sweet throughout. Full bodied, creamy, and smooth on the finish; taste lingers, and it is wonderful. A long time, all-time favorite. Acquire.

Sampled from a bottle at O'Hare Terminal 5. Darkish golden colour with a white head. Malty aromas. Intense flavours based around a really solid malt taste, with tangerine, banana, dried fruit and spices all there. Extreme bitterness. I found too much intensity in this complex beer. Not easy to drink, but I can appreciate the craft that went into it.
Aroma of intense citrus and pine waft out from the orange sudsy pour. The taste is quite a good balance of hops and malt. Very good
Draft. Gold amber color. Aroma of hay, grass, citrus, spices. Coconut?, banana, pine, cloves, well suppressed alcohol...drying.  Candied mouth.

Absolutely stunning beer. Crisp and fresh, with a flavor that lasts. The color is perfect, and its scent is mouth watering. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle. Copper. Grapefruit, honey, sugar aroma. Big malty taste that changes to bitter grapefruit with a surprising clean finish. This is a big one with decently hidden alcohol. One of the best from dfh. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

"Perhaps the best I.P.A. in America" sayith Esquire, and since I drink this more often than any other beer I will have to concur with the great beer brain-trust of Esquire magazine. My favorite IPA with the bonus of being widely available!

Appearance: (poured into a tulip glass) pours a 2 finger pillowy head, nice lacing, slowly subsiding into a 1 finger head, body is a clear dark coppery amber with lively carbonation.
Aroma: Fresh grass, malty hops, pine, resin, grapefruit, yeast,rich sweet honey, floral, citrus, bread, bready
Palate: full bodied, thick, moderate carbonation, slightly chewy like yeasty bread.
Taste: Malt, bread, caramel, grapefruit, black pepper ,mildly bitter finish with resins, pine, and, sweet honey
Overall: Delicious, complex, malt heavy, honeyed, balanced, mildly bitter, the best beer Ive had thus far.

Poured from a 12oz bottle into Spieglau IPA glass, thanks Shane! Light golden amber colour, everlasting white foam and lace. Extreme American hoppy aromas, but not severely grapefruity, more of a mild flowery, honey-like balance.
