Taste: malty, caramelly sweet, and VERY hoppy again, bitter but smoother than usual (apparently through their use of low-cohumulone hop varieties). Tangy hops-forward balance. Light-medium body, strong carbonation, lingering hoppy aftertastes.

A 1 oz sample poured at a tasting table. Pours a nice rich amber with an off-white head. Sometimes beers just defy description, this is one of those. An example of the style, yet like nothing Ive tasted.

From a 4 pack of bottles poured into a snifter. Nice orange color with a thick white head and great lacing. First taste is smooth followed by slightly bitter. Good job of hiding the 9% ABV. First thing I have tried from Dogfish and have to admit I look forward to my next

I read the high praise of this beer a few months back and since then I have had it on my list. Well today I saw a 4-pack and it was cold. Poured it into my pint glass. Orange clear little foam, smells of hops. Its really good, fruity at first, then bitter, spicy & some malty sweetness in the after taste (oh and its 9%). Didnt find it to be as boozy as other raters, or the ABV might suggest, but the rapid buzz says its strong all day long. The Dogfish Head brewery does a good job of making beer drinking fun!

(Dogfish Head 90 Minute Imperial IPA) Bottle 355 ml at home, served into a snifter, ABV 9%
Deep orange colour on the body, mostly clear, with a full finger of slightly off-white head. Thick and soapy, with very good retention, leaving heavy lacing on the glass.
Aroma of caramel malts, biscuits, cookie dough, orange peel, light resin.
Bitter taste that builds up, nothing too extreme though. Citrus, hops, nice fruitiness, biscuits, well hidden alcohol.
Medium body, good carbonation, nice dry feeling on the palate.
Very good and addictive.

Aroma contains malt sweetness, pine hops, yeast, honey and some alcohol, but not much. Looks great - copper colored, dark for an IPA with a large pillow of white foam. Too much foam for me, but otherwise striking. Taste is honey sweetness with hops taking over after that. The hops are very unique in this one - they are prevalent and pine flavored but not at all bitter. Honey and hops, simple but it works. ABV very well hidden. This is good but I thought it would be the best IPA I have ever had. Possibly top 10, worth trying but there are a lot of good IPAs out there.

Pours a slightly dark orange with a thin film of soapy head. Strong citrus and grapefruit notes. A very complex flavor, with some dark fruit sweetness and just a bite of the alcohol fading into a really nice hop bitter aftertaste. Im amazed Ive not rated this yet- its rightfully one of the best out there.
Bright orange. Light head. Some light citrus notes. Herbal orange. Earthy stickiness.

0,33 flaske hos Einar, nov-14: vi tok denne etter 90 Minute, og dennehar (om mulig) mer av alt - mer intensitet i farge, aroma og smak. Bortimot en barley wine. Dette er ganglag for sjelen. Helt superb.

Bitter, herbal orange tea with a ginger and butter scotch drop on a pancake. A slight  trace of nutmeg. Lingers at the back of the mouth but fades on the tongue. My idea of a winter warmer more so than a DPIA.  Perfect with a peppery mustard rubbed rib eye.  Oh yeah!

UPDATED: JUN 5, 2016 clear orange to amber colour, moderate sized slightly yellowish off-white head;aroma of pine, tropical fruity notes, biscuit (Scottish shortbread), slight citruses, maybe some minimal earthy yeasty notes, hints of floral notes and honey, as well as some caramel; taste of malty-syrupy sweetness, pine, tropical fruits, and biscuit notes; heavy sweetness and at the same time intensive bitterness - marvellous IIPA!
One of my favorite beers. Great mix of malts and hops to create one of the best IPAs in the world. Great aroma and incredible taste.

Draft pour at Logan Arcade into snifter. An intense blend of pungent, resiny, oily hops along with an oh-so-sweet malt profile. Big in flavor and big in mouthfeel - there is a stickiness here that clings to your palate.
On draft at dogfish head alehouse in falls church it is a clear golden color with a white head. The aroma is citrus and the taste is strong bitter flavor of citrus that lingers on the palate

Fairly clear orange-amber colour with thin white head. Grapefruit upfront on the nose with perhaps some other fruits such as banana and mango too. Kinda grassy and floral. Taste is great. Strong biscuity backbone which combines well with the oily profile and alcohol warmth. More richly sweet than a regular IPA, but the bitterness and carbonation levels balance this one out nicely.

BOTTLE 355 ML from CH-303, 6 months old.

Look: clear copper, off-white creamy head.
Aroma: rich dark honey sweetness, the hops are not that intense, but still pleasant: fruity, some resin and fresh hoppy notes. Some alcohol spice.
Taste: very sweet, honey, fruity marmalade, the moderate bitterness fails to balance out the sweetness. Zesty notes in the finish.

Among the finest American Imperial IPAs, and, perhaps the best one that is widely available (depending on how one defines that). Maltier and stickier than the usual "west coast style" that dominates this category (e.g., Green Flash, Stone, Russian River). I personally prefer the drier WC style but 90 minute just works, undeniably. Piney hops and caramel sweetness on the nose. Orange amber with a hint of red in appearance. In taste, a first sharp wave of hops, followed by a sweet, sticky, candied apple center, finished with a clean rush of more hops. A delicious treat to be savored at 9% abv. A classic, defining the maltier end of this style.

UPDATED: APR 27, 2015 Update: April 27, 2015. Bottle from Winooski Beverage Warehouse... Aroma: caramel, pine, grapefruit. App: clear orange with nice frothy head. Taste and palate: full bodied, medium sweetness with dry bitter finish. Carbonation is moderate. Overall: another great beer from DFH. I?m not a great fan of malty IIPA?s but this one is really well balanced. After drinking it a few times, I find it better and better every time.

I'm a fan of IPAs and I really sharp, sometimes bitter, high alcohol brews. This selection was very tasty. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Great aroma. Great flavor and very little after taste. Also a staggering 9.0 ABV packs a mighty wallop.

Bottling date was mid 2013, so over a year past. Dark yellow to orange color, medium hazy, with a nice white head. Aromas of caramel, toffee and fruits. Taste was really sweet, with caramel, malts, bread, toffee, some citrus fruits, lemon. Sweet aftertaste, sticky mouthfeel. Medium body with medium carbonation. Would definitely try a fresher one.

Nothing short of a fantastic IIPA. Aroma is full of sweet apricot, pineapple, grapefruit , toffee, caramel malt, and hop resin. The aroma is very sticky sweet. The taste is also very sticky sweet caramel toffee, a blast of citrus hops, grapefruit, orange, lemon peel, and pine. Everything is very balanced. Finish is bitter and long. Body is relatively light for an imperial IPA. Right up there with all the great IIPAs.

Pours deep yellow with white head. Aroma combined of many things, caramel eg. and maybe som rural aromas of barnyard etc. Heavy tastings of malty sweetness and hoppy bitterness. I really like the thickness of the brew, both in its taste and its palate.

UPDATED: OCT 10, 2016 Bottled 10/13/14, drank 11/1. Poured clear golden into a snifter. Light, white head. Aroma is citrus zest and sweet tropical fruits. The hops arent huge, but the citrus and pine resin are very nice. The maltiness is a bit too much, though. A bit boozy, but not too bad. A very nice beer, and for $10/4 pack at Trader Joes, an excellent value.

Update: Bottled 6/28/16 drank 10/10/16. Maybe its just the fact that this bottle is definitely older than it should be, but this was a different beer. Its a slightly hazier copper/orange pour into the snifter. The aroma was mostly the sweet tropical fruits, but without any citrus. The taste was quite different. Still malty and boozy, but there was a spice/malt profile that reminded me of a Märzen. There was just a little bitterness on the back end, nothing like what Id expect at 90 IBUs. This is definitely not a typical IIPA for me, but good for what it is.

355ml bottle @ home. Pours yellow golden with a frothy white head. Aroma is tea, sweet malt, tropical fruit and maybe some artificial candy? Flavour is sweet, not that bitter. Its too malty and sweet but very drinkable.

On keg in the Joshua Tree Saloon (of all places), CA, 20.9.14. Clear orange/pale amber, off-white head. Nice juicy hop aroma, as well as the citrus and pine theres some berries and a whack of toffee malt. Lots of sweetness in this one, is it fresh? Probably not but I still like it, especially a whole pint! No detailed notes, but from memory, all the usual citrus and pine with some strawberry hints and some complexity to the malt character too, definitely some warming booze. In a karakoe saloon in a 1 horse town in the desert. Not bad.

This beer is really good but as it says in the commercial tasting notes there are notes of brandied fruitcake and raisins. I can finally taste the hops I was looking for in the 60 minute but the malt profile is just something I dont desire in a double ipa

Pours a hazy copper color with a small light tan head. Aroma is sweet malt, citrus fruit, and piney hops. Flavor is malty with grapefruit and other citrus notes, some sugary sweetness, pine resin, and a bitter hop finish. Full bodied with soft carbonation. Really nice and complex IPA.

4pack dogfish 90mins. Nez dabricots sèché,caramel,des notes de citron quelque teintes chocolaté mais cest très subtiles.. une bonne présence crémeuse, alcool bien caché , pamplemousse qui colle labricot sucré cest super bien faite ,débile..

Pour is clear amber with a golden touch. Head disappears quickly. Nose is heavy dark fruits with a lot of dough. A bit boozy. In the mouth, it’s an IIPA with a heavy body, a long medium pine bitterness and a huge malt sweetness. Fresh bread and dried apricots. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle. Nice head and a wealth of aromas! Bananabread, caramel and toffee, citrus, dried fruits. Taste is enormous and this complete and full ale deserves to be sipped. Extremely well-balanced and the alcohold is quite hidden.

"solid, but i must admit, i was a little underwhelmed by this one. for the reputation that DFH has, particularly this beer, i was expecting way bigger aroma, bigger hops, bigger flavor...this ones just "good". ill try again some other time...maybe i got an old batch... 3/09 - retried a fresher one...better, but still not of my favorite 2IPAs. too much sweet malt and fruitcake, still quite good, just not on par with its rep. 8/10-the brandied fruitcake aspect really starting to grow on me. for the first time head to head i liked 90 better than 60."
Very good IPA. Golden color and pours with little head. Taste is complex. Starts with a unique fruit flavor and finishes with a slight bitterness. This IPA also comes with a nice kick.

Muted. Sweet malty. Dead. Now I do not know the date of the bottle but it was not a repeatable adventure. Disappointing. I like fresh lively bright iIPAs and this is not one of them. Sad:(...

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Nice copper color with just a hint of cloudy haze; very small light tan head.

The hops are surprisingly subdued for an imperial IPA. Some malt and sweetness. Hops have a little pine to them but also some fruitiness that provides some nice interest.

The taste is mostly consistent with the above aromas except that there is a pretty prominent honey-like sweetness.

Full bodied with just a little bit of an oily mouthfeel. Really nice long complex finish with the hop bitterness, honey and fruit.

Overall this is an exceptional beer. Its pretty sweet but it works due to the hop balance and overall complexity.

UPDATED: DEC 15, 2014 330ml bottle served in a snifter glass. 
Review #100!
A: Pours a slightly hazy dark orange color forming a medium, creamy and light yellow head. Great retention forming tons of lingering and spotty lacings left in the glass. 
S: Delicious bouquet of flowery hops. Citrus and piny hops, mainly. Strong notes of tropical fruits: mango pineapple and orange. Sweet malts, caramel, caramel malts. A little booze but the alcohol is very well hidden. 
T: Slightly sweet upfront. Strong notes of caramel malts, followed by an intense (and delicious) persistent hops bitterness. Hops are quite citrus and piny. Notes of grapefruit, pineapple and watermelon. Perfect. 
M: Heavy and molasses body. Medium carbonation. Caramel malts and pine hops in the aftertaste. 
O: Excellent drinkability. Bottled perfection :)
[ BA Review @ 4/11/2010 ]
355 ml bottle. Clear amber with white head. Smell is hoppy grapefruit and pine. Taste is bitter pine and citrus zest. Semi sweet with high bitterness and low carbonation.
A nice balance of hops and malt. More balanced than overpowering with hops. Extremely drinkable.

Sweet biscuit, candy cane, starfruit on nose. Pours a hazy light amber with little head but lots of lacing. Lots of malt backbone, caramel, toffee. Slight bitterness on long finish. Medium mouthfeel with very slight syrupy consistency.

Bottle. Hazy dark amber pour with dense offwhite head. Powerful aroma with sweet malt and fresh fruits. Taste is balanced with no overwhelming bitterness. The high ABV is clear. Good warmth and not definitly not a bad choice on a cold Autumn day.
Sample @ a tasting event. Amber body with a low white head. Caramelly base with Grapefruit, pine, tropical fruit & spices. Nice one.

Poured from a bottle into a Dogfishhead tulip a clear dark golden orange.
Aroma is juicy sweet grass.
Flavor is caramelized hops. The bitterness is balanced into the toffee malts. One of the better DIPA out there. On my top 10 DIPAs list.

Hófehér habkorona, tiszta, átlátszó borostyán szín, marcipános, kissé konyakos beütésű, gyantás-mézes árnyalatú, vehemens illatok jelzik érkezését a világ egyik leghíresebb, stílusteremtő főzetének. A 60 perces testvéréhez hasonlóan egy jó adag brit karakter jegyeit hordozza magán, a vajas-kekszes maláta beton-szilárd alapjain vaskos szerkezetű építmény kezd kibontakozni. Alkoholban ázó aszalt gyümölcsök jelenléte, majd halovány belga élesztős emlékek teszik igazán nemzetközivé a képet, mely azonban leginkább mégis egy amerikai IPA benyomását kelti annak minden vadságával és utánozhatatlanul izgalmas stílusával. Az a fajta sör, amelynél érezzük, hogy a kortyok mennyiségből adódó keret elégtelennek bizonyul majd egy átfogó jellemrajz elkészítéséhez, azonban az ebbéli tulajdonságából adódó izgalmak megteremtik a lehetőségét annak, hogy az alatt a pár perc alatt sikeresen adózzunk a mennyei élvezetek oltárán. Kirobbanó ízek tárháza, a komponensek igazi tűzijátéka szórakoztat minket percekig, anélkül, hogy bármely összetevőjét nyomasztóan dominánsnak éreznénk. Ha valamihez mindenképpen kötni szeretnénk, az "imperial" jelzőt ez esetben sokkal inkább az összbenyomás monumentalitása, az egész kompozíció fajsúlyos jellege, esetleg az alkoholfok mértéke, semmint a keserűség lehengerlő foka támasztja alá.

UPDATED: JUN 9, 2015 Orange-amber color with nice white head. Citrus-piney nose, a hint of tropical fruits, not too fruity, as the 60 minutes one. Lots of pines. Bittersweet, grapefruity taste. Full malt body. Slight esthery boozy finish. Really good.

Very good American IPA! Comes in a Four pack, great buzz!! 9%, Definitely worth a try!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Had to have this as my 90th rating true???? Great brew. Grapefruit citrus nose. Crystal clear great carbonation and the sroma continued to the end. Taste bitter and pine tar...Excellent!!!

Poured from a bottle into a snifter at home. There is minimal head and a subtle aroma that is reminiscent of tropical fruit. It is on the sweet side. That said it is a very complex DIPA and a fine East Coast specimen of this style.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Drinking my last of 4 bottles poured into a pint glass to let this masterpiece breathe! As my palate continues to develop from 60-93 percentile ales and stouts I honestly thought initially that this IPA was a case of "IPAs gone overboard". Now that I am on my fourth one (two weeks later from #1 of the brown recycled paper-looking 4-pack) this beer has grown on me! As I am nephew of uncles who introduced me to cabs, scotches, leg of lamb and cigars my senses have taken to the strong taste and this IPA puffs its chest out and goes nose to nose with your tongue! Basically to me it tastes and feels like a 50/50 mix of two of my favorite beers; Bells Double Cream Stout and Sierra Nevada. Perhaps I will soon mix those two 50/50 myself and do a live comparison! Whos in?!

Bottle. Pours clear orange with a lasting small creamy white head. Aroma is quite malty with biscuit, candy, dried fruit, mild pine, grass and spice. Taste is near heavy sweet, light+ bitter. Body is medium, texture is quite oily, carbonation is soft+. Finishes sweet with orange fruit and biscuit with a greasy mouthfeel.

Aroma is citrus, resin and peach. Appearance is golden, clear and slim beautiful head. Taste is heavy, slightly alcoholic, plum and almost spicy. Mouthfeel is thick and a bitterness lingers. Overall a delicious, complex and impressive IIPA.

UPDATED: SEP 18, 2014 Rating #1001, flaske fra Kioskh. Mørk gylden øl med flot tæt og holdbart skum. Kniplingsmønster på glasset. Lækker duft af alverdens citrusfrugter, appelsin, lime, citron og meget mere og endda lidt kiwi. Smagen er det samme plus smør, en smule alkohol og endda lidt chokoladeagtigt malt. Vildt kompleks og lækker, naturligvis med lang bitter eftersmag. Blød og luftig , men aldrig en tynd øl. Super godt bryg!-- rated with beerbasher/winphone

355 mL bottle. Pours light amber with a thick white cap of head. Candied orange, resinous pine and cedar, citrus pith, deep caramel malt and bready notes. Fairly sweet, but well balanced with a clean bitterness, not over the top, a hint of alcohol on the finish. Moderate to heavy body with average carbonation. Big and sticky on the palate, lingers long. At 3 months old, I wish it was fresher.

Sampled at Great Canadian Beer Festival. Big malt and bigger hop with nice complexity. Heavy caramel, with tangelo fruity/spiciness. Syrupy thick with sweet notes but a long, bitter finish. 
*May have rated it higher if it wasnt served from an overchilled can.

Bottled on 8.11.14. Clear amber color. Minimal carbonation and head, but excellent lacing. Aroma is overripe fruit, alcohol, banana. Taste was licorice, grapefruit, raw hops, sweet aftertaste. I believe this beer was too young. I will keep one for a few months and hope for improvement with maturation. Overall, not a good DIPA but I will re-rate if it ages well.

09/12/2014 - From bottle in tulip glass. Bottled 12??/12.

Hazy burnt orange, bubbly off-white head. Strong grapefruit and citrus hop aroma, undertones of sweet malt and slight grassy notes. Flavor opens with hop resin up front, fades to a full, sweet, caramel and malt body then opens into a huge burst of piney and citrusy hops. Finishes with a mild hop linger and a lasting citrus tingle.

BIG beer but very well balanced. Tons of hop flavor without being overpoweringly bitter. No sickly sweetness of many other imperial IPAs (*cough* duganA *cough*). This is one to grab if you want actual hop flavor in a big beer.
Could drink this all the time. Very clean and good hops taste. One of my favorite out of michigan IPAs thats available
Lots of flavor packed densely. Dried fruit and citrus hoppiness that never goes overboard. Slight alcoholic bite in the long-bitter finish reminds of the high abv and docks points.
Great malty taste with the hop kick at the end. The hops in the aroma is citrus and pine like. The malt is sweet but the hops perfectly balance it out.

Medium copper pour with a small dense white head with somewhat low retention, very clear, nice lacing. Citrus (lemon, grapefruit, orange) on the nose, floral, malts, sugar, maybe Candi sugar? Resinous start, moves quickly into the floral notes, which on turn is taken over by refined sugar, and finishes with a lingering pine note. Medium body.

UPDATED: SEP 28, 2015 Bottle pour. hoppy but not an unbalanced hop bomb. very well balanced and controlled. alcohol warmth and sweetness, strong fruity hop aroma and moderate bitterness. Very nice. Bottles in CA.

UPDATED: SEP 12, 2014 Esquire Magazine calls our 90 Minute I.I.PA., "perhaps the best I.P.A. in America." An Imperial I.P.A. brewed to be savored from a snifter. A big beer with a great malt backbone that stands up to the extreme hopping rate.

Une belle couleur de cuivre avec un tête généreux beige. Larôme déborde dhoublon avec un parfum dagrumes et pin. En bouche cest un célébration dhoublon. Lamertume est bien équilibré avec un peu du malt et un douceur légère.
From bottle. Amber appearance; little head. Sweet nose. Taste is boozy, almost wine-like with nice hop character. Meets Dogfishs lofty expectations. Recommended.

From 12 oz bottle in tulip glass. Pour is clear amber with a golden touch. Head disappears quickly. Nose is heavy dark fruits with a lot of dough. A bit boozy. In the mouth, its an IIPA with a heavy body, a long medium pine bitterness and a huge malt sweetness. Fresh bread and dried apricots. A hint of chocolate is also perceptible. Heavy beer that is surprisingly easy to drink at 9 ABV.
UPDATED: NOV 18, 2015 Aroma Is of raisin. Has a medium Fruity taste. Heavy body and finishes flat and creamy on the pallet. A top shelf IPA and probably the best heavy bodied IPA on the market.

Bouteille 355ml. Couleur orangé translucide, mousse beige crémeuse et insistante, laissant une belle dentelle. Arôme de pamplemousse, houblon résineux, malt, alcool, pointe de vanille. Goût dalcool, pamplemousse, malt caramel, plutôt sucré, caramel, amertume intense. Carbonatation moyenne, corps moyen-dense.

Putting other IPA's to shame, well balanced and all round perfection. An IPA for any time of year or day.
Rich golden colour, almost sweet in flavour with just the right amount of hop at the finish.

Ambrée or-miel, fine mousse blanc-cassé. Carbonation moyenne. Bière ultra-limpide, qui fait sa beauté.
Arôme fruité agrumes-orange, pin, nez très frais et arômatique. 
En bouche peu arômatique, un peu résineux puis lamertume des malts. Fin de bouche un peu trop alcoolisée et peu amère. Bière assez ronde, ormis lalcool trop présent à mon goût. 
Vu les autres commentaires, les arômes ont peut-être perdu de leur qualité...

UPDATED: JAN 6, 2015 Citrusy hops, quite a lot of caramel, straight forward tropical fruit, grapefruit being the standing out. Very well balanced, not a harsh bitterness, but would be more fruity and more outstanding. Good double IPA.

On tap in pint glass: Pours amber with a thick white head with good retention. Aroma of banana, caramel, and resin. Taste is very well balanced, the malt is present but is not overwhelming due to the strong presence of piney hops. Smooth mouthfeel, medium to heavy body, medium carbonation. Pretty nice beer but still pretty malty.
This is my preferred IIPA. A little sweetness but the citrusy hops balance it well. Not a bitter hop bomb but definitely hop forward. 12oz bottle poured into tulip.

Not a great head but lingers well with excellent lacing. Nose of sweet English malt, hops, and a slight alcohol note. Taste of sweet malt, caramel, and fruity hops. Great, full mouthfeel. Awesome beer. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Appearance: Golden-Honey with a two finger creamy head
Aroma: Fresh cut grass with a banana creamsicle smell that becomes more pronounced as it warms. slight creamy orange with a piney backbone
Taste: Pine upfront with malty bitter following closely behind. Some spice and alcohol toward the end. 
Palate: Creamy with some spice

12 oz bottle from Uptown Market in Beaverton, OR. Very malty nose. Thick and syrupy mouthfeel. Heavy maltiness adds sweet, earthy, and robust flavors...perhaps too robust. There a lot going on in this beer, including a powerful alcohol content. Much like the 60 Minute IPA, the focus is not placed upon the hops, but they are still definitely there. I would still prefer a fuller hop profile to balance out the strong malt flavors.

At just on cool and into a snifter. A March release so fingers crossed. Magic appearance. Burnished copper, bright as bright, with a fine bead. Head is a plume of snow-white foam that holds and daubs a thick lace. Aroma of toffee brittle, pale, rock candi, orange marmalade, pine-needles, tree sap, burnt toast and a thick perfume musk. Quite full bodied, oily and viscous with low carbonation. Heated, HOT, liqueurish finish yields plenty of plum, apricot and peach notes that come of as fortified more than raw and fresh. Yeasty, bready mid-palate with sticky orange marmalade and plenty of toasted malts. Light on in the bitterness regime. Some peaking peppery notes but very little else. Pretty simple and straight forward. Will need a fresher sample to compare but at this stage cant see passed it boozy character. Sweet, cloying and fuelled by fusels. (12fl. Oz, Bottled 25/03/14, The Liquor Shed, Jandakot)
My favourite beer! In my opinion the most enjoyable IPA. Fantastic balance and taste. Love it.

GBBF 2014 on 13-Aug. Bottle, poured into a large glass. Good head and carbonation. Malt character, full bodied and bitter. Caramel and medium hops. Sweet aftertaste. An excellent reference double IPA.

I didnt think I would ever find a better IPA than Bells two hearted but this might be it. Incredibly smooth despite the 9.0 abv. hoppy but not too hoppy despite being a double ipa. its expensive but great.
Great flavor. Really well balanced IPA with a nice malty character to it. Hops dont overwhelm the sweetness. A must try for anyone new to craft beer.
Great beer .....loved the start....the finish....and everything in between....awesome beer....a new top 10 for me.
Full oakey and rich malt ipa with plenty of bite from the bitterness. Almost a thick meal of flavors

Pours dark golden with small head. Aroma of caramel, malt, grapefruit and pine. Full bodied and very smooth. Perfect balance and bitterness.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle picked up at GBBF. Pours a clear amber with a white head. Sweet aroma with caramel, light candy and a hint of orange. Medium body, medium carbonation. Quite sticky initially with light toffee and some booze coming through, but then it gets drier with woody resin, light banana, toast, pine, lemon... Theres orange marmalade too - actually quantro. Good, decent balance, not too sweet, with a nice woody grapefruit bitter finish. Tasty.

On tap, poured a clear golden-copper hue w/ large foamy beige head and beautiful lacing. Moderate sweet citrus hop aromas. Initial flavor moderate sweet w/ a bold lasting bitter finish. Tastes are orange, honey, clover, straw, pineapple and pine. Full bodied and creamy mouthfeel.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

A supremely complex and tasty beer that is both well balanced and (at 9%) powerful to boot. The aroma, while pleasant and rather floral/fruity, is not nearly as outstanding or fragrant as certain other ipas. Despite the somewhat demure aroma, this beer is bursting with flavor and is easily one of the best beers Ive ever tasted. Its strong, sweet malt backbone is complemented by a mildly bitter hop presence and subtle hints of raisin and caramel. It should also should be noted that this beer also provides a nice warming, almost spicy effect similar to that of harder alcohol . This likely has to do with the relatively high yet well masked 9% abv.

BOD 4/16/14. Clear light amber pour with a touch of ruby. Massive head that retains and laces quite well. Complex nose of tropical, citrus and pine hops over a biscuit sweetness with a slight spicy note. Medium body, but on the higher end and quite smooth, with normal carbonation that imparts a bit of effervescence on the finish. The flavor profile is very complex, but yet well balanced with its 3 main components - hops, bitterness and sweetness. It begins with the hop flavors of the nose, transitions to a mild spicy bitterness and finishes with a smooth sweetness over an alcohol note. As it warms, the body approaches full with a nice oily texture and the alcohol more prevalent in the finish.
Floral hop aroma. Clear amber colour with excellent head. Very bitter hop flavours and finish. Heavy body with medium carbonation.

12 oz bottle at home. Pours hazy orange with a medium white head leaving nice lacing. Aroma has some caramel, pine, hops and a little bit of fruitiness. Taste is a bit sweet with some caramel, pine and a medium bitter finish. Alcohol not really noticeable. Medium body and carbo. Nice, but a bit too sweet and piney for my liking.
Draft. Pours a darker copper color. Aroma and taste are sweet fruits and citrus up front with a bitter finish.

UPDATED: NOV 29, 2015 One of Dogfish Heads exemplary IPAs, fresh bottle from NYC, thanks Marie!  Rocky and frothy, very thick, dense, egg-white head leaving papery lacing on the glass, clear orangey amber colour with no visible sparkling.  Powerful aroma of pink grapefruit flesh, tangerine and mandarin, fresh pine resin, biscuit, papaja, gin, dry autumn leaves, some haemoglobin iron, bitter honey, dried flowers, cigarette tobacco, subtle earthy touch.  Clean sweetish onset of blood orange, mango and sourish red berries, finely tingling carbo, somewhat oily, full mouthfeel, lean body achieved by a fairly thick and creamy caramelly maltiness with a slight toasted edge blending in perfectly with a big, yet gentle hop finish, very aromatic, citrusy, a tad piney and very floral, providing sufficient bitterness deep down but allowing more than enough of the juicy malt sweetness to pass through.  A piney, herbal, spicy hop bitterness remains after swallowing along with persisting caramelly malt sweetness; the alcohol, though considerable, is very well hidden and only reveals itself as a warming glow in the throat without becoming wry or obnoxious at any point - thus leaving the tender love-making of the malts and the hops alone.  This beer has become a classic and should be viewed as such: there are a lot more extreme examples of DIPA out there, but this one achieves utter balance and technical perfection.  An ideal introduction to the double IPA style I reckon, regardless of whether the hype is justified or not.  The nobility of this beer, within a style which is somewhat infamous for being aggressive and uncompromising, makes me happy.  Im glad I got the chance to revisit this after many years!

12oz bottled shared by [email protected]/* <![CDATA[ */!function(t,e,r,n,c,a,p){try{t=document.currentScript||function(){for(t=document.getElementsByTagName('script'),e=t.length;e--;)if(t[e].getAttribute('data-cfhash'))return t[e]}();if(t&&(c=t.previousSibling)){p=t.parentNode;if(a=c.getAttribute('data-cfemail')){for(e='',r='0x'+a.substr(0,2)|0,n=2;a.length-n;n+=2)e+='%'+('0'+('0x'+a.substr(n,2)^r).toString(16)).slice(-2);p.replaceChild(document.createTextNode(decodeURIComponent(e)),c)}p.removeChild(t)}}catch(u){}}()/* ]]> */ Tasting II. Vegetal, leafy, chocolate aromas with a whiff of toasted almond set the stage for this slow burner of complex, buried and time-released flavours: the fruity sweetness of a grape cordial and caramelised banana and biscuit dough kept in check by a brawny hop astringency, working in the deep and in the back, before opening up into something like lime cordial or lemon zest sorbet. Virtually no abv burn, lingering, near-vegetal raisin dryness. Unusual IIPA, subtly commanding huge respect.
@DØE Århus Syd: Not violent hoppy fairly sweet double IPA. Weak of hop aroma but soft and delicious.

12 oz bottle poured a golden orange with a little head. Aroma is super citrusy and amazing. Taste is a hop blast of flavor. Lots of citrus and pine, kinda sticky mouth feel. Long bitter aftertaste. What an awesome IPA!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle 02/03/2014 (6 months old :/ ). Pours the clearest ive ever seen in a 9% abv beer. Amber. White, long lasting head. Aroma is pretty sweet and almost white vinous. Citrus, sweet grape fruit and fresh grapes. Taste is sweet, malty, and with a hint of the alcohol, but generally its really well hidden. Herbs and faded hops. I bet this beer was great couple of months ago, but the hops are too flat and weak bitter. The body is really nice though, and has a nice medium high carbonation. Really light and easy drinking for an IIPA!

Bottle from february. Pours clear amber with an off White head. Aroma of bitter hops, caramel malts, herbal notes, grass, grapes and a light vinous touch. Taste of grassy hops, herbal notes, caramel malts, medium bitterness and a weak touch of barley wine to it. I would love to consume fresh but this was all I could get.

Bottle shared from Vestergaard and Rasmusott. Thanks guise <3. From 02/03/2014.

Pours a clear dark amber, white small longlasting head. Aromas of slight booze, slighty grassy hops, pretty caramel sweet malty. Kind of orange marmelade-like. Taste is pretty sweet up front, very bitter and pretty boozy finish. Very herby aswell.
De geur is heel lekker. De smaak valt mee voor een IPA. Ik ben geen IPA drinker maar dit is niet slecht
Absolutely great. Nice balance. Not too hoppy. Somewhat hot in alcohol. A little sweet
not for me this one i know alot of people rave about it but just doesn;t tase that great to me the 60 minute is much better in my opinion

Pours a hazy amber with a nice fluff had. Notes of malt on the nose and just a hint of grassy hops. Taste is a tad sweet at first with a big bitter finish and a huge alcohol sting as well. Pretty good imperial IPA.

shared @ 2nd D/F/CH TriStateRating; aromas of mango, vanilla, orange marmelade, tastewise a great balance of orange-marmelade and mango sweetness and subtle but strong bitterness. Finishes with notes of créme brulée and caramel.
Pours a hazy copper colour with a compact white head. Taste is incredibly well balanced between the malt, hops and alcohol with a clean bitter finish.

A distinctly fruity IPA with a sweeter taste compared to most. There is no distinct hop bitterness compared to others of this genre and it is surprisingly smooth. The main thing that surprised me is the fruity and sweet taste at the forefront that is reminiscent of grapefruit and/or citrus, I didnt think I would like it at first but it grew on me and remained drinkable without leaving a bitter acrid aftertaste. Overall a good job was done with this brew and it remains a well crafted and smoothly drinkable IPA.
Bottle at Old Cs. Copper with lasting white head. Sticky lacing. Strong herbal, spicy notes with a hint of citrus. Caramel, quite warming with a great resinous follow through.

Youre kidding. I havent rated this? Had it again during trivia (another suspect week where the trivia guys wifes team comes from behind by acing the last category). Amber pour. Nose has butterscotch, raisins, spruce. Flavor is sticky sweet caramel, raisin, orange peel, spruce. Thicker body than I remember. Loads of crystal in this bad boy with a moderate hoppy punch in the finish.
Very good IPA but for me it is definitely not as good as the hype and I think falls short of the style a bit. Did enjoy but would not seek out again.

From a 355ml bottle on 19/7/2014. Pours a slightly murky dark golden with small fine head. The aroma is actually quite malty with lots of toffee, butterscotch and caramel presenting, along with a touch of fruity resiny hops. It drinks similar, with the malt being most prominent (caramel and toffee again). Theres a big fruity sweetness there as well (peach, mandarin), along with a dash of honey. The bitterness is surprising subdued for a double, but lingers along with a touch of booze. The texture is a little syrupy and the carbonation is average. While I certainly wouldnt complain if someone served another one of these up to me, it doesnt quite live up to its rep for mine. Its a very enjoyable sipper but simply fails to stand out for me. There are many other DIPAs out there that Id take over this.

This beer smells fabulous and tastes great. Throw in the 9% alcohol and you have yourself a fabulous beer. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Clear light amber body, creamy white head, decent lacing. Aroma is light malt, orange, faint peaches, pineapple. Taste is peach and pineapple, faint citrus, lilikoi, surprisingly low bitterness, and fairly sweet. Body is thick, for an IPA, carbonation fine, moderate. This is delicious and juicy.
Strong taste on the palate. Much more happy than the dogfish head 60. One of my faves.

16 oz draft at Joe Squared at the Inner Harbor location in Baltimore, standard pint glass. Clear golden brown to amber with off-white head. Aromas of citrus, caramel, floral notes. Tastes of citrus, honey, sweet fruit, floral hops. Medium body with a dry finish. Medium carbonation, slightly juicy and syrupy mouthfeel. Doesnt really stand out for me with all of the other better DIPAs/IIPAs available.

Earthy, woodsy aroma. Great golden color. Surprisingly sweet taste, with more wood and floral notes. Very mild bitterness for such a heavily hopped beer. Quite good. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Classic IPA. Definitely a hop bomb. Not my favorite IPA, but a very good one.

Ótima segunda cerveja, deliciosa gelada. Forte e bem característica. Melhor double ipa até agora.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Pours a cloudy dark orange with some rocky white head. Nose is orange marmalade, pineapple juice, caramel, raisin. Flavor is loads of citrus, marmalade, really fresh pineapple juice, with a slight herbaceousness and generous grapefruit on the finish. High side of medium body, standard carbonation, slight sugar coating on your lips as you drink.
Ive heard so much about it. I got the recipe and made some before I ever tried it. Mine was better. Yes, its good but not the best IPA out there. Lot of hype. Try Brew Cocky or Maharajah.

Bottle.

A- Chex mix, caramel, biscuits, bready, malty, fruitcake, spices, citrus.

A- Orange color, clear liquid, white head.

T- Caramel, citrus, raisins, spices, bitter, malty, salt, bread.

P- Medium body, average texture, average carbonation, smooth finish.

O- A goodIPA. I was expecting an aggressive hop profile but it was surprisingly smooth and ungodly complex. There were so many aromas and flavors going on, I could never list them all. Definitely need to try the 60 min and 120 min now.
Clear golden well balanced malt and hop character surprisingly low aroma with a good alcohol hit
Incredibly overpowering aroma from the bottle. , floral, earthy, citrus, hay. Has a thin pronounced taste spend across the pallette.

Standard straightforward imperial IPA. Had on draft in a tulip glass and hoped for more. Maybe another minute or two would have helped instead of rounding to the nearest ten :-) Still a very solid beer - particularly if on its own.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Bootle from Publix in Tallahasee. 12 fl oz 9.0% abv. Fresh hoppy aroma. Taste is silky and smooth. Hides the alcohol very vell and nicely balanced. Mouthfeel a littly sticky. A world class ipa.
An IPA with a great malt backbone. Pours a wonderful golden amber with a tint of orange and red. Dangerously drinkable yet full bodied.

12oz bottle 6/30/14 (Osco Singles)-44° in Snifter-Pours am amberish orange with a small off white head. Aroma of hops and malt. Taste of citrus, malt, and more sweetness. This full bodied brew is well balanced and is very easy to drink.

Pours a clear golden-copper, with minimal head. Aroma of raisins, booze, pine-hops, malt. Flavor is very boozey, with dark fruits (plum, raisin), some licorice, sweet, bready malt, and hop-fruitiness (tropical and citrus). Very complex mixture of flavors. An interesting beer.

Before I say anything: I really like this beer, but it is weird. Poured into pint glass. Slightly foggy yellow with thin white head. Maybe I got a weird batch, but the scent is kind of hoppy, kind of malty, and kind of wild(?), almost like nail polish ( like I said, weird). Gets malty-er as it sits in the glass. The taste is similarly odd: hoppy, bitter, maybe a little boozy, maybe a little sweet. It seems like it changes as it spends time out of the bottle. Overall, a pretty interesting, and tasty brew.

Poured from a 12oz bottle, very little head, nice deep amber, thick sweet malty flavors followed by the bittering hops which fall off quickly into a balanced after taste. It tastes, in my opinion, similar to Mudsharks Desert Magic IPA though stronger on the bittering hops. Very malty, sweet, and bitter. Would surly recommend, hope to find this one on tap sometime.

33cl bottle from drinks of the world, Basel. Color is dark orange. Head is thin. Body is medium to thick. Taste is high bitter, and low sweet. Quite balanced. Aroma is malty, hoppy, herby, resin, spices..Alcohol is very well hidden. Deserves all the hype!

Pours amber color with an minimal head. Malty, nutty aroma with a malty, roasty taste and a slightly floral, hoppy, but not to bitter finish. Perfect carbonation. Good malty IPA with subtle floral character.

Flaska @Monks Sveavägen. Bärnstensfärgad vätska med tjockt smutsvitt skum. Doftar mjukt av söt fruktkaka och mango, underbart. Smakar starkt av amerikahumle utan att bli för pepprig. Söt kraftigt maltig bakgrund och man kan ana alkoholen som en känsla av ekfat. Inget man dricker 10 av en sommardag men en fantastisk öl!

On top there is a very good tall just off white colored head. It is very thick and creamy, long lasting and makes cool rings of lace on the glass after each sip. The body has a slight hazy appearance and a golden amber color. The aroma is full of sweet malt and pine resin and citrus hops. The flavor hits you with a full bodied punch of piney, resiny and citrus hops balanced by thick sweet malt and sweet warming brandy like alcohol. It finishes with more herbal and piney bitterness. The palate has a smooth mellow carbonation with a smooth slick almost sticky texture.

12 oz bottle shared by Mike Brown, thanks! Pours a clear copper orange with fading white head that leaves decent lacing. Aroma is light citrus, and prominent booze. Flavor is malt, slight citrus bitterness, and boozy aftertaste. I need to try this fresh, this bottle is nearly 2 months old.
Nice clean golden pour with a big frothy white head. Floral aroma with a touch of caramel. Sweet malt with a big hoppy finish. A really nice beer.
Bottle (12oz): Golden color. Small Head. Very tasty. In WA this is probably the easiest Dogfish Head to find, lucky me.

12 oz. bottle. Appearance: golden color, slighlty yellow white head 2 full fingers, clear, great lacing. Aroma: floral, caramel, lemon, slightly dank. Palate: light-medium body, average to average-soft carbonation, bitter lasting finish, sticky. Taste: sweet malt, to an easy building hoppiness, expands to a full blown bitterness that is lasting and distinct. Overall, balance is pretty spot on for the hoppiness, the appearance is great, and the palate is well put together. Winning beer.
Rich copper color with floral aroma. Immediate backbone to the beer with delicious hoppiness. Great from the bottle, pint or mixed with another dogfish like IBA or Raison D' etre

Bottle shared with friend from Saveur-Biere.com - Color: nice golden copper beer with small carbonation and small white foam. Smell: great grassy complexity and floral notes. Hoppy domination. Taste: great hoppy blast with a nice complexity of fruit as pineapple and peach. Aftertaste: good persistence of hops and nice fruity taste. Good wet bitterness. AMAZING !

Pours a hazy golden yellow color with a small white head. Nose of grapefruit mainly with some other citrus some floral hops. Taste is mainly sweet malts, with some hoppy finish. Not overly hoppy just perfect balance.

Light amber color with a two finger head. Aroma is citrus, floral and slight caramel. Taste is citrus with a nice balance hoppy and sweet taste. A slight taste of alcohol in the end but a good IPA for sure. The warmer the beer it gets, the more you taste the alcohol. ---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Dark amber color with a very floral and citrus hop aroma. Malty backbone with enough hops characteristics to even the balance out. Very drinkable and delicious!
Clear yellow-orange. Small off-white head. Sweet and hoppy aroma, lemon bonbon. Caramel - a bit too sugary for my taste (or Im starting to dislike DIPA). Harsh bitterness lingering. Sticky, syrupy.

Consumed over a multiple amount of times in my life, here is my take on this wonderful DIPA. 
Ive had this in snifters, tulips and chalices and for the most part its always been the same smell and look. 
The appearance was a nice hazy golden yellow to orange color with a one finger white foamy head that dies within about a minute and leaves some good somewhat sticky lacing. 
The aroma has always been powerful through sweet caramel malts combined with a super nice sweet bittersweet citrus to light piney hoppiness.
The taste has always been a super nice long bittersweet citrusy caramel flavoring. 
On the palate, this one sits about a medium on the body with a nice structured sessionability. I want to sip it but often find myself constantly picking up the glass. 
Overall, this was one of my first DIPAs I ever had and if I could ever get it again I would in a heartbeat.

Bottle 355ml. A golden beer with a creamy head. Aroma is faint, but I have a cold so I can´t be sure. This beer is bitter and it has a strong alcohol taste, but overall it is well-balanced. I tried Dogfish´s 60 minutes and Dogfish´s Midas Touch, but this beer is my favorite from this brewery. Really good beer.

Decent head
Refreshing for an IPA
As critics hail, probably the best IPA I've tried. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Reddish golden, small off white foam. Sweet malt, bread, citrus. Very resinous, citrus come in at the end. Not to hoppy, sweetness take a lot of place. Well balanced, great one
Keg at Pub 1842, MGM Grand Las Vegas. Aromas of tropical fruits and grapefruit; incredibly bitter taste with plenty of grapefruit tropical fruits and caramel. Very good!

Lives up to the hype, for mine. A sweet, smooth high-gravity IPA with bitterness that complements the malt sugars rather than overwhelming them. Similar to a barley wine in terms of the food-pairing opportunities. Bronze with a thick, lacing head. Aroma of boiled lollies, golden syrup, sherbet lemons, faint cinnamon (?) - sweet but not in an Uh-oh sort of a way. Lovely oily body. Needs the hop bill to counter the sugars, imo. Otherwise I would find this too sweet. The malts dominate the middle and then theres a big piney, minty, finish. Not as hop-heavy as I expected. Guess expectations increase with every high-IBU release. (12fl oz bottle from Leura Cellars)
Lovely dark amber color, rich floral and citrus hop aroma, and a wonderful array of hop characteristics with enough malt to make this one very drinkable high gravity IPA.
Great beer, thats coming from an iPad hater. Good amount of alcohol but highly drinkable. Well worth it.
Dominated by citrus, a stale floral aroma, some dark bread, grass and herbs.

If Godzilla was a DIPA he would be this DIPA. He would bring his cinnamon coloured, potently thick but muscular body to your town and smash it. Might even thrust his frothy, spikey white head into your office and destroy you. 90 Minutes is great and has it all. Citrus, dank, floral, sweet, bread. All of it, for you to guzzle down, all nine freaking percent of it, to become a monster yourself. Someday DFH will crush all the Macros. Then DFH will BE the Macro, but it will be a sweet Macro. Macro.
Bitter sweet hoppy goodness. Pours clear with a low white head. Plenty of aroma. Sweet and chewy followed by the hop punch. Awesome.
Strong, smooth IPA. just what I needed after a 14hr journey to Florida. Never heard of it before but will try to find again definitely

From a small sample at a tasting. Probably not super fresh. Orange amber, not much head. Bit of tropical fruit, but much more malt than hop really. Tasty, bitter and sweet. Nice and full. Like to try it fresher.

Dogfish Head 90 Minute Imperial IPA has a place in classic craft IPA hall or fame. Nice amber pour with a tight frothy head. Taste is well-balanced with pine and floral hop notes -- some moderate complexity. Finish is clean and fresh. 90 Minute IPA is a solid brew in a style that has lots of competition these days.

Bottle. This beer was great. A perfect amount of molasses and caramel flavour meets the perfect amount of hops. I never really noticed much alcohol taste, all of it hidden behind the raisin bread. A really smooth mouth feel too and almost too easy to drink. My first Dogfish brew, and what a choice it was.

Transfer from BA reviewed on 1-26-12 - 
Poured from bottle into tulip shaped glass

Appearance - A beautiful golden color with a small head upon pouring. The head fades not leaving much lacing.

Smell - A wonderfully sweet tropical fruit smell first meets the nose. Very unexpected but very pleasant. This then mixes beautifully with a piney and floral hop aroma. Very nice.

Taste - At first sweet malt and tropical fruit taste mixed with a mild floral hop flavor. The sweeter malt remains in flavor, but is soon overwhelmed by the hops which really step up their show, intensifying quite a bit with a burst of mostly piney and citrusy hop flavor.

Mouthfeel - A good body but a little on the think side actually. It is very drinkable however as its carbonation is spot on. The thinner body make this 9% a little too easy to drink (good and bad at the same time).

Overall - A very nice IPA it truly is. In my opinion a little over-hyped, but only a little. Definitely a good brew.

This poured one of the prettiest beers Ive ever seen. Dark golden amber with a soft white head that lasted quite a long while. The aroma was less hoppy and more malty than I would have liked, and that malt definitely punched its way through on my overall happiness with the beer. The palate was sticky and almost syrupy, and less bitter than other reviewers seem to find it. This should be ice cold when poured, unless you really enjoy a sweet malty backbone, because it definitely has that to the end!

UPDATED: APR 13, 2016 Pours a deep golden-orange color with a medium white head. Nose is piney. In mouth its a blast of flavors: full body and medium carbonation, malty aromas of caramel and molasse, hoppy aromas of citrus and resinous pine. Perfectly balanced, not too dry like many other IPA. Long bitter, sweet and piney finish. An outstanding Imperial IPA!---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle. An unusually clear gold with an orange hue. Tightly formed off white head that sticks to the glass through its entirety. Big boozy fruitcake aromas (elements of rum as it warms in the glass) with caramel malts, earth and spicy hops. Huge malt bill. Caramel and booze laced fruit cake, followed by long, dry, spicy hops. Bitter without being resinous. Precisely balanced. Hugely complex. The booze is complementary rather than detrimental. Silky smooth mouthfeel and perfect carbonation. Great beer to celebrate my 300th ratebeer rating.
Bottle. Pours orange with nice white head. Good lacing. Nose is mildly grassy hop. Sweetness come through in the taste. Hides the 9% well.

I dont feel like intellectualizing the complexity of the flavor of this beer mainly because Im not very good at it anyway. But this beer is good. I dont know what kind of hops are in it, but it doesnt have the typical harsh bitterness that other IPAs have. Definitely has a very good balance. There is definitely a fruitiness yet its not too fruity. Its hoppy but not to hoppy. And very easily drinkable for its alcohol content
Sweet like a hop syrup you could put on pancakes. Complex hop flavor with hints of pine and citrus. Great example of an IPA that isnt dry.
A clear amber beer with a lingering off-white head. The aroma is fruity hops and pine. The flavor is fruity, malty, a little sour and smooth.

This pours a clear, amber color with a slight head. The aroma is mild with bitter and citrus hop. The taste is strong with bitter hops while having a smooth citrus flavor. It leaves a lingering bitter/pine after taste. Overall a well-balanced brew that is one of the best for its respective beer style.
Served from bottle into pint glass. Golden amber color. Malty, caramel and hops. One of my favorite IPAs.

Nose is sweet malts, spicy hops, floral hops, citrus, and very light resinous pines mixed in there as well. Orangey sweet citrus mixed in there as well. Pretty nice as always but just a really sweet offering.

On tap at Parry's. This used to be my favorite IPA. I don't think it got worse; the others just got a heck of a lot better. DFH 90 tastes too malty and has too much of a pine aftertaste to me now. Thin head dissipates way to quick. Coppery colored body. Just too many great IPA's these days for this one to crack my top 20 anymore. Great memories, though, when this one was king!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

A - is golden yellow with a white head 
T - nice malt backbone with piney finish 
M - smooth on the palate with a balanced finish
I - great beer that should be enjoyed slow


---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

On tap @ Copper Coin. Cant believe Ive never rated this... Pours bright dark copper with thin off-white head. Aroma is earthy sweet caramel malt and floral hops with light citrus notes. Taste is similar: rich sweet caramel malt and bitter hops with pine and citrus. Definitely different from your standard west coast DIPA, this is much more malt driven with the hops more restrained. Funny, I used to think this was the best one around, now this doesnt stand out so much to me with all the amazing hop-driven DIPAs that dominate. Still, the importance of this beer shouldnt be underestimated, it really opened the door for many to follow. And remains a delicious choice, albeit a different one.
Citrusy, malty as hell, sweet yet bitter finish, not really my thing these days, unfortunately.
On draft at the Tipsy Cow. Luxurious creamy imperial ipa! Well balanced with the hops and bitterness. Would buy this anytime.

Tasted on tap at DFH with ML. Pours clear amber with generous persistent yellow head; good lacing. Aroma is citrus, pine, orange peel, caramel, and malt. Flavour is bold yet mellow hops perfectly balanced with sweet malts. This is an awesome IPA. Perfection?

12oz bottle from Wegmans, Buffalo, NY. A golden maber pour with a loose off-white head; a big fruity malt aroma; then an oily texture, and a satisfying sweet malty body with some orange fruit and soused raisins; and a clean, crisp finish with a lingering dry spiciness. An elegant IPA, lacking the impact of some of its Western bretheren, but very drinkable and moreish.
Pours more of a light brown color with off-white head. Dark fruits, raisins, citrus, and pine on the nose; all follow onto the palate. Finishes with just a little sweetness.

Bottled 2/7/14
Appearance - 4 - golden amber color, white head, leaves nice lacing
Aroma - 8/10 - sweet malt is the first thing that hits u then citrus hops come in. Caramel and bread from the malt, grapefruit, citrus zest, but also a lot of sweeter fruits from the malt. 
Taste - 9/10 - for the fact that this is two months old, this is a great tasting ipa, its very well balanced. Sweet caramel and bread from the malt is balanced out by strong hops that give grapefruit and citrus zest flavors, along with spicy flavors
Palate - 4 - light -medium mouth feel, alc bite is there but balanced by everything else, aftertaste is spicy, citrus hops but also a lot of malt.
Overall - 16 - great beer. Good example of a east coast IPA
Delicious, complex flavor. Hoppy with light grapefruit flavors at the finish. Definitely worth trying.

Twelve ounce bottle. Pours a dark, clear golden amber, with a little white head. Complex aroma of hops and grass. Taste is smooth and rich, hops, fruit, and a little citrus. Well balanced and very drinkable, with a real alcohol kick. This is the best IPA I have yet tried. Thumbs way up.

Dont know why I havent rated this yet. Bottle pours copper with white head. Some kind of unusual light fruit (star fruit???), citrus, bread, basement, caramel. Moderate/high bitterness and sweetness. Big, stick malt body. A very intriguing brew.
Wonderful and complex, very hoppy on the nose, taste is bitter at first sip and quickly takes on a sweetness for the malts, then finishes with a nice grapefruit and spice taste.
Cant fault it - lovely DIPA - superb balance - malt sweet but not too so - huge hoppy behemoth - a sipper but its so bloody drinkable I want to just drink it down!

Bottle. Clear amber body with white cap and heavy lacing. Raisins, light floral notes, cane sugar, alcohol and wet grass. Taste is a sugary sweet with a soapy bitterness. Body is heavier with a foamy sticky feel.

frothy, white foam, clear, golden appearance. cereal, caramel, citrus, dough aromas. medium sweetness, medium bitterness. full body, thick feel, lively carbonation, bitter finish. A lot of hype for this beer being considered "The Best IPA", but I think it lives somewhat close to the expectations. Love the simplicity of the artwork for these beers.

Una IPA bonissima, els llúpols i les maltes estan molt ben equilibrats, els 9 graus no es noten gens.
Una IPA buenísima, los lúpulos y las maltas están muy bien equilibradas, los 9 grados no se notan.

UPDATED: JUN 23, 2014 I go to this beer as a standard. Its the best brew you will find. At 90 IBU, you barely notice its bitter nature. It has such huge malts, but it is so balanced you will only notice a perfect finish. After a 4 pack of these lovely brews youll be feeling great, I promise! They are so easy to drink because they are so well crafted. Be careful on this brew, do not drive! Take care friends.

Definitely not a west coast IPA. Some serious sweetness in this one, at least for an IPA. Pretty good, but I prefer the citrus and tropical notes of the west coast style. Very creamy mouth feel, which is awesome.

Bottle on my balcony of the Shore Hotel, overlooking the Pacific, that was probably the highlight of this number acquired from Surf Liqour Santa Monica, 16/04/14.
Clear golden amber with a moderate off white head that retains well.
Nose is caramel malt, straw, bitter grapefruit, bitter orange.
Taste is caramel malt forward, orange pith, bitter citric tinges, straw, light grapefruit, pinch of spice.
Medium + bodied, fine carbonation, semi drying close laced with hop bitterness.
OK DIPA but cant see how this acquires such high scores. Ive had this many times in the past prior to joining RB, including on tap at Rehoboth and remember it being far better than this, perhaps an old bottle?
user_location: Hazlemere, the lower Xhitlerns, Buckinghamshire, ENGLAND

text: UPDATED: NOV 22, 2015 A gorgeous beer. Radiant orange amber. Lasting Large frothy white head leaving lots of lace. Clean delicate hoppy nose balanced by malt. Fruity. Earthy. Floral. Grass. Caramel. Medium body. Great mouthfeel. Soft. Flavor is a complex bounty of hops and malt. No booze to speak of. So balanced. Semi-sweet. Not very dry. Moderate bitterness. Very smooth.

Aroma reminds me of the lake in the summer. Sweet, fruity, hoppy. 
Taste is beautifully smooth hops and fruitiness. A little dark fruit. Sweet, slightly bitter finish.

Served: 12 oz bottle
Look: clear dark honey
Smell: fruity, no alcohol
Taste: first sip was smokey, woody, transitions into more bitter flavors. Alcohol taste comes out more as it warms up.
Feel: nice amount of carbonation
Overall:
First drank: home Decatur March 2014

From 341 ml bottle. Pours a deep but clear orange amber with a small but lasting white head and gentle carbonation. Aromas of tropical fruit, lemon, sweet biscuits, walnuts and a touch of cardamom. Taste is dominated by firm citrus bitterness with lemon peel and grapefruit notes. That gradually slides away to gentler flavours of apple, sweet malt and spice. Lingering spicy aftertaste. Great.
pours a dark murky gold. has a malty nose for a double IPA. taste is spicy and malty, rather sweet too. not especially hoppy for a double IPA. not my idea of an ideal DIPA, but enjoyable nonetheless.
12oz bottle oz wtf move into the 20th century usa big resin hop aroma golden in colour off white head taste is much like the aroma good stuff

Pours a classic light amber color. Highly carbonated with a thick, foamy off-white head with lots of lacing. Not a big aroma. Hints of hops and flowers, but pretty subdued. The flavor is not subdued. More bitter than sweet from the start, this is more complex than it first appears. It starts a little on the cloying side but quickly blooms from its fruitcake and black licorice into a seriously bitter experience. Great mouth feel and very dry finish. Very good IIPA. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Excellent brew. This is the go to craft beer I can buy at a reasonable price here. Big flavor, little to no bitterness and a smooth drink

Pours a deep golden hue. Medium head with lots of lacing. Aroma is sweet and floral with hints of malt, raisins and citrus notes. Taste is smooth and very well balanced. Just the right amount of hops, malts, citrus and hints of fruits abound on the palate. Truly one of the best "go-to" IPAs available.

My go to beer. When all else fails (or there in total crap in the aisles) this is my favorite. Great pour into a snifter with a nice off white head that very slowly sunk back leaving a nice lacing on the glass. The aroma is slight bready, piney, with hints of caramel. Taste is awesome...enough said! Very smooth (too smooth that makes you want to keep drinking and drinking until you cant see straight) nice malty backbone with the piney hopes creating a nice mix and leaving very little aftertaste. Overall one of my favorites!!!

I had this at Beertopia in mid March, and i must say that the balance of sweet and smoothness is perfect, i would never had guessed that it was a 9% beer with 90ibus - aroma was floral and citrus, on the palet was like a rich fruit cake, all that was missing was the marzipan.
Part of a 6-pack IPA sampler. My last favorite so far, but not bad. Too clear for an IPA in my opinion. Nice texture, very citrusy, finishes with pine notes.

香りがとても  
苦味もしっか&

@ Party Source / Bellevue KY --- Clear golden brown with a 1" ivory head that never gives up, mottled bands of lace. Taste is deep sweet caramel malt, with shortcake and biscuit in the palate, just enough hops in the finish to balance, but hops allow some malt again in a two-day long finish. Wow, what an exceptional brew.

The aroma is complex with hops and malt notes. The texture of the beer is delicious with a good balance of butter and acidity. The flavor is excellent with good balance among hops and malt. A big delicious beer.
Amber, smooth, malty, Imperial IPA. Big taste. One of the best. Smooth finish with no bitterness.

From draft, small head (bartenders fault I'm sure) but thick foamy head off-white with extensive long-lasting lace. Clear pale amber liquid. Strong and pleasant floral hops aroma with hint of citrous and spices. Malt aroma in background. Well balance of malts and bitter & floral hops. Big body and warm mouthfeel that finishes clean. Excellent dominant Imperial IPA. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Nice deep caramel color with a substantial head. Rich and bitter hoppy taste with a complex malt middle and a sharply hoppy finish. Found it at our local taphouse.

This beer is filthy. Excellent example of the style. Not a hop bomb considering the amount of hops that go into it but as soon as you take a sip it punches you in the face. Just an excellent and well crafted beer that shows the labor that goes into a good beer. This is just wonderful. Dogfish Head is just it. They love what they do and they make phenomenal beers. This IPA is the real deal. Drink like 45 of these then go buy more.

Pours a nice amber.with a small head. Not much of a nose for a double IPA. Taste is pretty good but not all that hoppy tastes more like an English IPA. Malt profile is ni e with a good malt presence with a little biscuit. No near what I remember it tasting like-- rated with beerbasher/winphone

On tap at A-Bar, Terminal A, ATL. Pours a clear amber color. Good sized white head. Aroma is tropical fruit / citrus / pineapple hops. Not as aromatic as expected. 
Taste is semi sweet pineapple hops. Lingering sweetness transitions to a solid hoppy bitterness. Dangerously easy to drink.
Palate is oily, medium carbonation. Overall a great tasting beer, wish it had the aroma to go with it.

UPDATED: APR 3, 2014 Bottle pour into Shaker glass. Golden/orange color, small off white head. Aroma is of hops and citrus. This beer lives up to its reputation. Smooth very easy to drink especially for a DIPA. Lots of hops flavor meticulously balanced by malt. This is a great beer to pair with food. It is enjoyable on its own and can be savored, but I think it really works well with a meal.  Recommended

Aroma is malty. Caramel and hoppy. Wet. Some nice grapefruit citrus notes. 
Looks fine. Very clear bold amber. Explosive head. 
Wet. Sweet. Hoppy. Citrusy. Smooth. A little malty. Yeah a little caramel note. 
A little dull lingering bitterness on the palate. 
Overall a very solid beer. Nice sweetness and hop balance. Very wet on the palate

Drank from bottle.
Sweet hoppy aroma. Smooth hoppy taste, only medium bitter. Abrupt finish, medium body, average carbonation.

Poured two 12 ounce bottles into an proper imperial pint glass. First off this brew has a impressive color and head. Next, where do i start? Is it the abundant hops? Is it the strong maltiness? Is it the strong hint of fruit cake and currants? NO! Nothing is strong here. It is all properly balanced. So balanced, it is special. Real Special. Put this IPA into a time capsule.

How can you not love this beer. Its a hop bomb. Such an upgrade from the 60 minute. More hips. Its def a big beer. Taste like it is 9. Your typical IPA. Kind of like a go to beer if you want a great IPA. Big, bold, and stays with you.-- rated with beerbasher/winphone
Bottle. Pours an orange color with white head. Toast, bready malt, hoppy, earthy aromas. Bread, honey, grapefruit, caramel malt, apricot flavors. A nice malt balance for an imperial IPA.
UPDATED: MAY 14, 2015 A cloudy, light orange-brown color. A definite ipa smell but a little on the sweet side. A burnt, coffee flavor. Tastes of hard alcohol. Gets worse with each sip.

Pours a clear copper with a huge white head. The aroma is malty, fruity, and floral. The flavor is sweet and malty with floral, citrus, and peach notes. Smooth mouthfeel with a dry finish. Wonderfully well balanced IPA that covers up the 9% abv.

33cl bottle. Pours dark orange/amber with a small beige head. Aroma is moderate malty, hoppy, heavy tropical fruity when it heats up a bit, alchool,some caramel. Flavor is moderate bitter, lively carbonation, spicy,alchool, hoppy fruity, finish is light sweet followed by a long bitterness
Nice all around ipa. Thin head. Thin lacing. Toffee. Very smooth. Clear. Thanks carter.

extra from Firemanchris, i was plesantly suprised by this IPA it has a more prenouced malt backbone than what i am used to but yet it worked well with a slight bitter citrus in the background, overall i really enjoyed it and will definitly seek out again
Pours a dark gold color with decent lacing. Smells of malt and maple syrup. Tastes sweet and hippy. Strong aftertaste of alcohol. A very good beer.

Mörkgul med medelstor vit krona. Fyllig doft som doftar klassisk östkust ipa. Smaken är stor kraftfull på gränsen till spritig. Detta var något av en besvikelse. Jag upplever det som att alkoholen tar över allt för mycket.

Bottle from Proof. Pours a coppery-gold-orange. Head was off white but faded under a minute. Good legs and lacing is decent. Collar has large bubbles and very small bubbles that hold together for a medium thickness. Wisps hold throughout. Aroma is resiny and toasty malt, a touch of citrus as well. Taste is that big malt backbone with the hops playing a much smaller role than I remember. I definitely havent had this beer in a few years, and my palate has changed considerably. I get some of the resin and citrus in the palate, but its mostly a caramel malt sweetness. Mouthfeel is sticky sugar-like, medium body, medium-high carbonation. Slightly boozey.
Incredible citrus aroma. My go-to beer any day of the week. Drinks smoother and smoother the farther into the glass you get.

Tasted from bottle. Pours a deep amber with off white head. Strong citrus, floral and pine aroma. Taste is a very well balanced and complex double IPA. Great caramel sweet malt backbone goes with citrus, pine, molasses notes. Medium bodied with a creamy and sticky mouthfeel. Excellent IPA. One of the best in my opinion.

a bit too strong in the malt department for my liking. Kind of hangs on you like a wet towel. A little more after taste than your typical double IPA. Enjoyable....but definitely a sipper.
Catching up on some old ratings from Untappd -- First rated on 30 Dec 2011.
From a tasting awhile ago. Very well put together. Citrus, fruity but not overwhelming. Would drink again.

12oz bottle aroma of fruit and spice appearance is clear amber with thin white head, taste is complex with sweet malt slight pine and slight coffee whith a bitter finish. Good beer........even has a nice taste when burping.
Im not really into IPAs but as far as they go this is one of the best that I have had.
Full of aroma, extreme hoppyness, a beer that in my opinion would be best paired with food or drink as dessert, as the taste is very complex. A very interesting either you like it or not.
Hops! Amber with white head. Aroma of citrus and hops. Pleasantly bitter, malty and very smooth. Very well done!

Aroma: Strong hops aroma, slight alcoholic hint, resinous, guava, peppery, 
Appearance: Clear copper body, effervescent. Large white head. Long lasting. Lacing.
Flavour: high bitterness, medium-high sweetness. Strong hops flavour, guava, lingering bitterness. Balanced, Dry finish, resinous, The maltiness is there, just hidden under the layers of hops.
Palate: Medium-full bodied. Creamy, medium carbonation. light warming.
Overall: Well balanced, hoppy, but drinkable. Stunning.

330 ml bottle, poured. Thanks Amanda and Wimpie.
14C. Imperial IPA

UPDATED: APR 27, 2014 Pours a clear amber. Piney Casacde hop aroma with a strong malt back. Thick mouthfeel. Hoppy front with excellent malt backbone. Not a huge hop head, but this is a great double IPA.
Nice healthy beer. Can only have a few but has a nice full flavor and pretty strong cascade taste

UPDATED: MAR 3, 2017 355 ml bottle from Beergium, bottled on 11/03/16.
Dark amber, clear body, with a medium, creamy, lacing, yellowish head.
Aroma biscuit, grapefruit, pine, peach, raisins, slight wood.
Amazingly smooth taste of biscuit, caramel, berries, grapefruit, peach, dried fruits, bread, some pine, some wood, some alcohol.
Medium, creamy mouthfeel, with an average carbonation,
Finishes smooth, medium bitter, a bit sweet, fruity, bready, biscuity, slightly wooden, alcohol warming.

Delicious! Smooth and really diverse, with the malt body equally strong to the hops, while still not too heavy. Unique aromas for the style, like dried fruits and subtle wooden notes, that I like a lot. Outstanding, complex and characterful style example, that I also imagine to age very well because of the big malt body.

This is what god drinks.

There are few beers with the complexity or balance of this one. Its just absolutely phenomenal from aroma to aftertaste.
OMG extremely hoppy! This brew certainly earns its 90 IBUs! Pour is magnificent and the head is beautiful and thick. Flavor is hoppy and malty. Delicious!

Sooooooooo flavorful. Glad I finally tried this after skipping it on menus for years.

I had this at Global Brew. Pours clear amber with a off white head. Taste citrus, Carmel, bitter. I thought this was good. I would drink this again.

This is my go to IPA a nice piney smell to it. malty, citrus, raisin, grapefruit flavor with a hint of Carmel. Hops are big in this one! A very good brew! Cant go wrong with it.

UPDATED: FEB 18, 2014 Great smelling beer. Sweet and floral aromas. Grapefruit flavor stands out and blends well with the myriad of other flavors. Lots of caramel, orange, bitter hops, citrus peels, sugar and hints of vanilla, light fruits and rye. Perfect amount of bitterness without going overboard. Creamy texture handles the complex flavor well.
On tap at Pub Republic. Pours an amber color with a bit of head. Intense broad hop flavor. A bit of noticeable alcohol sharpness.
Probably the best imperial IPA that I have tried. Great balance. Does not taste like a 9% imperial. Hint of sweetness.

It pours golden, slightly cloudy. When tasting you initially get the hops but it is pleasent and not too overwhelming, on the way down it is just very smoth. At 9 % alcohol I didnt expect it to be that drinkable.

Really malty and flavorful full bodied front with a lightly hopped finish... Very smooth

12oz bottled on 10/28/13
Beautiful clean pale amber beer. Creamy white head persists.
Full on aroma; dried apricot, citrus rind, peach and stonefruit, with a good dose of toasty, biscuity, almost muesli-like malt.
Moderate carbonation, very smooth, slick, full mouth-coating texture.
Palate offers plenty of complexity; toasted cereals, dried orange peel and apricot, woody spice, dried herbs, light caramels and honeyed figs. A firm bitterness lingers, tremendous balance, highly deceptive and potent alcohol content sneaks in.
A real joy; besides the drinkability and balance, the other great aspect of this beer is offering something different, and delicious, in terms of flavour. Lovely!
Aroma is limited. Beautiful amber with hint of rose color. White head with significant lacing. Taste is hop with playful orange and grapefruit under tones.

Bottle, pours burnt copper with a white head. Aroma of caramel, chocolate, sweet, alcohol, resin, light citrus, raspberry, rum. Taste is piney, caramel, nutty, slight fruit and alcohol warmth. Sweet front with a lasting bitter finish. Medium body. Not a strong hop presence in aroma or taste could be due to the age of the bottle 3 months.

Great IPA!

12oz. Btl. Pours med-dark with an amber tint, light fizz and froth. Aroma is light, but the notes of citrus and malt is present. Taste is bold, hoppy with barley hints. Palate is uber lively and the finish is strong threw the swallow. Excellent...

My new favorite IPA. Nothing else necessary. But, it had a golden appearance with a delightfully aromatic one finger head. The taste was perfectly bitter and sweet. Will update.

Bottle at home, bought from Florida, 11th January 14. Pours clear, good aroma, fairly sweet, nice DIPA, not fantastic though, would like to try fresh off tap, not sure how fresh bottle was

Years ago was common find in Wisconsin... then gone for a couple of years. When I saw it in my store a few weeks back, I knocked over an old lady and a baby as I ran to it like a dog to a T-bone. Simply put this is solid stuff, one of the best Imperial IPAs out there.
A great tasting beer! Smooth and tasty. Nice after taste and the appearance is great.

Out of the bottle maybe that was my problem but I have had similar tasting IPAs not Imperial very disappointed ..I was expecting something like Boneyard Hop Venom, Pints Seismic Upgrade or Heathen Son of Malice...Will try again if I can find it on Tap but I will stay clear from bottles...

Growler from Casanova in Hudson, opened 4 days after fill. Pours a quintessential clear amber with lasting white head and great lacing. Aroma is balanced with hops, caramel, roasted malts, and unexpectedly, a slight bit of coffee. Taste is resinous sweetness up front, a tiny amount of that roasted coffee in the middle, then into a grassy finish with accompanying bitterness, malts to complement, and mild roast in the retronasal. I wasnt a huge fan on first impression, and this isnt my perfect profile for an Imperial IPA, but its very drinkable for the ABV, and respectably balanced overall.

UPDATED: MAR 19, 2015 Bottle from convenience store in Mountain View. Pours slightly hazy amber with lacing. Aroma of raisin, toffee, and (possibly stale) hops. Taste is barley wine-esque; sweet brandy, raisins, toffee, citrus, bitter finish. Tasty!

Red amber with a very nice head, hops galore! This is my first top 25 beer! Great double IPA! Cant believe this has 9% alcohol it goes down so smoothly! Great beer!

Pours clear dark gold with a thick white head. Aroma is slightly sweet and hoppy. Taste is big on hops slightly sweet without being overly bitter (how?). Mouthfeel is silky smooth with light carbonation. Overall my favorite beer to date after over 225 different beers.

This beer is what I almost consider perfect to kick off this new year light silky head , great flavor , fruity , its got a nose on it that is just delicious , Ive been working this one for a little over a 1/2 hour and the flavors just become more intense , like that of a fine wine or brandy. must try!!!

Smoother and a bit more complex than the 60 min (which I happen to prefer by a narrow margin). Nice pour, white foamy head. Great lacing. As I mentioned, its complex. The aroma has a lot to offer.
