170712. Bottle on Seattle. Pours clear golden with a small head. Aroma hops, some citrus. Sweet hoppy taste. Well balanced. Not Bad.

355 ml bottle @ Hotel room, Seattle.
Pours hazy golden color with small head. Aroma of fruits, herbs, floral notes, some grass and hops Flavor of hops, fruits, caramel and mild toffee notes. Bitter fruity and hoppy palate with a sweetish dry fruity finish.
4525

35,5 cl bottle @ hotel room, Seattle. Bottled 11.04.2012
Fresh aroma with lots of mango and some apricot. Flavour is rather hoppy with resin, some mango and hints of apricot. Slightly on the sweet side  but rather good still.

Bottle dated 5/30/12 poured into a Duvel tulip. Pours a very nice clear amber orange with a finger of off white head and nice lacing. Aroma is pine, orange, pineapple, apricot, lemon, and a slight breadiness. Flavor is a complex mix of tropical fruit, grapefruit, caramel, toffee, apricot, and oranges. Medium mouthfeel with moderate alcohol burn, finishes somewhat dry, but a bit sweet as well. Fantastic beer.
This beer is fantastic right out if the bottle... one of the best I.P.A s out there.. enjoy!
Better than I remember this beer from my last time.  I aged this bottle for a year, might be why its improved.

Mild aroma of citrus and piney hops.  Pours a medium amber with fluffy white head.  Spicy flavor, with a bit of cinnamon underlying rich, sweet malt and potent hop bitterness, with resiny hop finish.  The alcohol is present, but well hidden.  Smooth mouthfeel with little relatively little carbonation.  Delicious, complex, and not at all overpowering.  A fantastic IPA.

Easily my favorite IPA the strong bold flavor enhances the beer. A slight hint of coffee and the typical IPA bitter flavor is something that makes me enjoy the 90 minute and all the rest of the dogfish head brews. Dogfish  is one of my favorite craft brewers

Smells of dough with slight grapfruit. Pours an orangish brown with a thick off white head with great lacing. Tastes of malty caramel and grapefruit with a hop bite in the back end. Mouthfeel is creamy and chewy and nice carbonation. Overall this is one of, if not the most balanced Dipa Ive had. One of my favorite overall beers from my favorite brewery.

I actually heard about this beer from somebody in philadelphia I live on the west coast so it was definitely something I was unfamiliar with dogfish head definitely was a tree and im looking forward to trying more like the 60 minute and 120 min IPA as well

12 fl. Oz. Bottle from Whole Foods Market SoMa, CA.. Pours a clear golden/orange color with a medium white pillowy head that shows great retention. I thought the aroma  was going to be massively hoppy. I was wrong. I get mostly earthy, floral and doughy notes, orange and some eucaliptus. In the back I feel hints of green Tea, mandarins, bread, pine and resin. Pretty well-balanced. Taste is bitter but with a huge sweet malty backbone. Sweey citrusy touches of tangerines. Increasing the experience is a nice alcoholic kick. Again, strangely balanced and refined IIPA. Big syrupy body, creamy texture but not overpowering. Highly drinkable and energetic. A boozy touch towards the end. Probably the most balanced Imperial IPA ive tried.

Pours clear amber with minimal off-white head. Floral aroma with hints of citrus and resin, and I couldnt appreciate a sense of the malts coming through. Tastes of rich caramel malts however not overpowering and is nicely balanced by the hops citrus notes. Relatively light body with a thin to oily texture and average carbonation. Smooth and sweet finish with barely perceptible bitterness on the lips.

Bottle: Amber color, creamy off white head. Flavor is  malty, sweet, caramelic and fruity. Maltiness is well balanced by a nice aroma hop note with herbal and resin notes. Also notes of citrus and candy.

UPDATED: SEP 20, 2013 Palate is strong malt flavor on front tongue, bitter hop aftertaste.
Hops blend on the back of the palate to create a bitterness that is a warm, dry alcohol swarm. Hard to find clarity in hop notes. 
A large swig yields a large malty sweetness with hints of bitterness that returns to a malty sweet at the end of the palate. Then a bitter after burn.
Aroma is sweets, including banana, taste does not follow in that regard. 
Taste is subtle hop notes, particularly citrus, mostly catalogued between malty sweetness.

Poured from bottle into snifter. Beautiful deep amber in appearance with a medium head that required some aggressive pouring to form. Leaves behind incredibly thick lacing. Strong aromas right out of the bottle and amplified in the snifter. Aromas include  sweet caramel malts, grapefruit and piney hops. Big hop flavors, but perfectly balanced with super sweet malts. Other notes include honey, caramel, grapefruit, and pine. Thick and sticky mouthfeel and well carbonated, but easy on the palate despite the hop profile. This is attributed to the well infused malts. Overall I am very impressed by this brew. Heavy aroma and flavor make it fun to drink. I normally steer clear from super hoppy beers, but this is so well balanced I can enjoy the hop flavor without killing my palate with bitterness. 

--- Cheers
Hazy orange pour with medium sized white head. Aroma of hops, grapefruit and yeast. Taste of orange peel, grapefruit, slight caramel and a hoppy bitter finish. Good DIPA.

Aroma - Hoppy, grapefruit and maybe a hint of banana. Stronger alcohol smell at first pour.
App. - Golden honey - with a decent head, thin ring staying down the glass.
Taste - Bitter, but not as much as the hops would suggest, and a bittersweet, pleasant aftertaste.
Great Beer!

I had this beer recommended to.me a while back. However never tried it until today. The aroma is perceived right from the opening of the bottle. Modest head. Rich golden color and the taste is superb. You can really taste the roasted dry hops. Really enjoyable. Cheers!

Ah Dogfish... My American girlfriend that just won't move in with me here in Canada... Oh well I'm not about to break it off I'll just keep visiting her.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Aroma is not what I expected; slight hop aroma, but getting a lot of barley. It looks beautiful, hazy dark orange, a perfect color for an Imperial IPA. Definitely not the flavor I was expecting, only a slight hop presence, its got some maltiness to it, but it wasnt especially what I was looking for. The palate is not sticky, and it doesnt stick around. Overall, I am pretty disappointed, considering it is supposed to be one of the best Imperial IPAs in the country, it doesnt come close to Hopslam of The Maharaja for me. Very drinkable, but I was expecting more.

Bottle 12 0z. shared with Jarad200p. Pours a sparkling amber orange with a frothy white head.Big hoppy citrus aroma, Taste of medium sweet with citrus and some raisin at the end. Full body creamy texture. not overly bitter, great balance.
12 oz bottle poured into glass.  Pours dark copper, very clear, with thin white head.  Smells of citrus.  Tastes of the same, grapefruit and mango, with very strong hop presence.  Delicious!

Good beer all around. One of the regulars in the fridge. I like to finish in it with a 60 minute after. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Bottled. Orangish colour. Nice hops aromaswith citrus notes. Palate is a bit disapointing, with a dry and bitter finish.
amber with one finger head. decent malt backbone with crazy hops. the flavor is so full that its not bitter despite the ibus. really good.

Bottled 4 Mar 2010
Consumed 24 Mar 2010

A: Clear orange-tinged hue. Slight effervescence, decent sized head and lacing.

S: Malt, then hops, with very little grapefruit, citrus, pine, etc. I have always thought that this beer is too malt heavy and lacks the classic hop aromas I expect from a DIPA.

T: The beer tastes fine, I suppose, but I always find myself a little underwhelmed when drinking 90 minute IPA. The "balance" of malts and hops heavily favors the malt, and leaves me yearning for that big hop aroma and taste so indicative of the style. I really have to shift my paradigm when I drink 90 minute IPA, and think of it more as a big ale, rather than a DIPA.

M: Sticky and sweet, with a malty and bitter aftertaste.

D: A decent brew, and easy to come by.

Notes: This beer ages rather well, and becomes something completely different. I cellared a case of 90 minute IPA for two years. The beer developed a molasses, caramel sweetness, the hop profile drastically faded, and the beer basically turned into an American Strong Ale. Interesting, if nothing else.

A friend brought a bottle to a constitution day party at my place - thanks a lot, Tom, Wanted to taste this for a long time!
Amber orange colored body, low white head. 
rich fruity aroma, grapefruits, orange, pine over a layer of malt sugars. 
Good balanced sweet and bitter taste, hoppy with caramel, lots of malt. Awesome lasting bitter finish.

너무 점수가 후한가요? 하지만 그만큼 대단한 맥주입니다.
왜 이 맥주가 한국에 들어가지 않았을까요?
IPA, 에일맥주가 한국인들의 입맛에 맞기에는 아직 시기상조인것 왠만한 에일맥주들...뉴 맥주들과는 격을 달리합니다.
병 따는순간 올라오는 진한 꽃향기..미국오 수 있으시다면 주저없이 드셔보시길 바랍니다!!!

Bottle shared at a tasting at the Dancing Camel. Pours hazy amber-golden, white head. Nose is a little alcoholic, hoppy with some citrus. Soft bitterness indicates that the beer is past its prime, some acetone as well. Medium body, ok carbonation, alcoholic bitter finish. Not too amazing, probably due to age.

12 ounce bottle. Pours a hazy amber gold color. Lots of medium bubbles rising to a fluffy white head. Sweet fruity malt aroma with notes of floral hops. Zesty toasted malt balanced by complex piney, citrus hops. Hints of dried fruits, ginger and brandy. Long bittersweet malt/hop finish. The high IBUs are somewhat subdued. A great example of an East Coast IIPA.

Bottle; Thanx to Stefan Gustavsson; Clear red/Yellow colour, creamy big head! Aroma is fruity, and is mixed with citrus and caramelly and malty! Flavor had a creamy mouth feeling of citrus, caramelly,smokey(?) and a nice balanced sweet maltynes. This is one of the best balanced imp ipa Ive try so far. Medium to full body, and a nice medium fruity/citrus malty finish. Werry nice!!!

Aroma is pine, citrus, spice, caramel and booze. Taste is bitter citrus and pine hops. This is balanced out by really sweet caramel malts. There is also raisin, some alcohol and it is a little roasty. This is a great ipa! Plenty of bitter hops, but incredibly balanced with sweetness. Maybe a bit too balanced but I really shouldnt complain. I could chug this down, crazy considering how bitter and high in alcohol it is. Awesome, well done.

Pours clear amber orange with average white head. Aroma is fruity hops-- citrus mostly, with some apple or dark cherry perhaps. Also getting a bit of malt. Taste is simultaneously sweet and bitter-- very awesomely well-balanced. Finish is mild-- not the overpowering bitterness Im used to with an IPA. Slight stinging in the throat due to the high ABV. Mouthfeel is full with moderate to high carbonation. A little less hoppy and more alcoholic than I like my IPAs.

Pours a dark orange/amber with a light head that gives way to fairly heavy lacing. Big aromas of bubblegum and floral bouquets. Taste isnt an overly hoppy assault nor is it too sweet, but there is a big, sticky, resiny finish on the tongue.
Very Hoppy, Very Malty. Excellent balance that leans to the malt.  One of the best!

Pours dark copper with nice amber head that lasts. No lacing. Initial taste of caramel that fades to bubblegum with a small bite of hops at the end. Nice IPA, with a residual that is refreshing, but is.overbalanced toward malt.
Much better than its sister, 60 min, this beer is a great beer try.  The cost is reasonable in perspective with its strength.  Great ipa.

A really powerful and unique double IPA. I have always been a fan due to its boldness and unafraid strength (think taste). Best as a stand alone beer after a meal. It tends to defy any food you place it with, but it will wreck you if you have it on an empty stomach.

UPDATED: MAR 11, 2015 Draft. (Oct 2012). Hazy amber with a big white head that left some swirling lace. Juicy hop flavors. Very well blended. Dark sugar syrup sweetness. Some grassy citrus notes. Semi-dry finish. Aroma is a bit lacking but the taste is powerful. Better than the 60 min. Higher ABV is well hidden. UPDATE: (March 2015) Having this for the first time in a bottle. Blonde caramel malts feel more complex. Some subtle earthiness. Ginsing. Chanterelles. This is a fresh bottle but thinking this might age very well.

Pours a clear coppery-red with a foamy 3-finger off-white head.  Smells of pine, grapefruit, herbs, caramel.  Taste is moderately bitter and sweet, clean and crisp - strong hop presence, citrus and pine.
Not bad! Having one now at Lucky Baldwins in Pasadena right now! Do dig it, a bit bitter, but if ur into that, try it

Hoppy and floral aroma with a basic dusty appearance.  A balanced taste with citrus tones leads to a mildly warming mouthfeel.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Aromas intensos y a la vez delicados. Interesantes, pero elegantes. Ligeros aromas a nuez y vainilla. Pero pricipalmente herbales y frutales. Frutos secos, manzana verde y citricos.

A la vista, Cerveza color ambar, con tintes naranjas a la luz. Ligera capa de espuma que recubre principalmente las orillas de la copa, así como zonas medias de la misma. Burbujas ligeras y carbonatación de media a intensa. Cuerpo medio.

En boca, mucho cuerpo y estrucrura. Ligero amargor en la punta de la lengua en primera instancia.

Al paladar, interesante..... Amargor en su máxima expresión, que inicia en la punta de la lengua y termina en la garganta... Final largo, el cual deja notas complejas a citricos. Es un sabor único, elegante y muy bien equilibrado.

En general una cerveza de los más interesante. Integramente y en todos los sentidos. Aroma, apariencia sabor en boca y paladar. Una verdadera IPA, la cual permite saborear lo que es el real amargor en una cerveza.

Deep amber pour. Powerful aroma of pine, floral and citrus. Just a little sour and sweet with a good bitter component. Very hoppy flavor, with the aromas coming through as well. Nice lingering finish.
The greatest beer I had ever able to buy in a grocery store :) Granted, you would be hard pressed to find something as good in a custom shoppe.

mouthfeel, mouthfeel, mouthfeel. ive often wondered why beer nerds care about palate. this beer is why. goddamn luxurious palate excentuates everythin else good about this beer. some tasty hops, similar to mikkeler tomahawk ipa, with a velvet sweetness to follow. good beer, unbeleivable mouthfeel
Amber colour with off white head. Nice sweet hoppy aroma. Flavour is full and fresh and sweet, well balanced with hops. Quality beverage.
Pours a hazy orange. Lots of sweet aromas and flavours. Citrus and sweet malty flavours. Nice balaced finish. Thick and syrupy mouthfeel. Very good.

Pours copper with well balanced head. Nose is hoppy with raisins, malt, caramel, flowers, and maybe lemon. Taste is well bitter, but has a sweet aftertaste of caramel malts, raisin and citrus. After letting it sit, there is a tingle of spice left on the palate and lips. Quite honestly I am not a huge fan of this style of beer, but it is well rounded and not over hoppy for the style. Great beer.

330mL bottle, pours copper with a small white head and a nice floral/pine aroma but also a hint of alcohol. Big piney bitter hit in the flavour with grassy notes and a warming as it goes down the throat. I guess this is an east coast ipa.
Drunk straight after the 60 Minute this beer has a lot more depth and length of flavours.  Impressive beer.

Seriously, I bought a 4 pack and dumped 3 and 1/2 of these out.

I love IPAs (California style IPAs Pliney, Maharaja, Racer 5, Blue Dot etc)

I honestly hated this beer. It taste dark malty gross. Obviously many many people love it, I am not one of them.

Draft. Pours clear amber and gold. Off white head with little to no duration. Little to no aroma (I blame the bar Im in). Full body, full carbonation. Smooth yet fruity, fruity citrus without beung a dominating citrus. Well balanced, rather complex long finish.

June 7, 2012 bottle at Amp 150.  Pour was translucent orangish golden with some head and lacing.  Aroma was classic double, hoppy and malty.  Sweet malty start with a citrus bitter finish.  Medium bodied, light carbonation but easy to drink.

UPDATED: APR 12, 2013 On tap at The Horse Brass Pub. Served in 5 oz. tasting glass. Appearance is clear, burnt orange, with a nice, thick white head that leaves a lot of lacing. Aroma is light and hoppy. Taste is hoppy, slightly roasty, with subtle sweet honey/caramel notes. Mouthfeel is RIDICULOUSLY velvety and light bodied, easy to drink. Leaves a sweet aftertaste in the finish. Overall, one of the best DIPAâs out there. Surprised to get a roasty character out of this. Definitely one of my favorite DIPAâs!

I have tasted this like four times thinking that this has to be one of best dipas ever but is not. I got a 4 day old bottle and got some of the hops, pine and some citrus but there is still to much caramel and chocolate malt jumping around, so I dont get this.

UPDATED: NOV 30, 2012 Purchased in monroe, ny at Monroe beverage. Bottle poured into my three floyds pint glass. This is hands down my favorite IPA. The blend of hops and the flavor 90 min bring out is bright, complex, hint of citrus followed by a dry and roasted hop finish. I LOVE this beer, much easier to drink than the 120
Well balanced IPA Dogfish Head knows what they are doing. Crisp hoppy bold flavor not a strong alcohol taste. One of my favorites!

Called "possibly the best ipa in america", i agree!  Purchased on a whim from local store.  Was blown away by the amazing collection of flavors and huge hop presence but velvety finish.  Very smooth and drinkable.  This is a GREAT beer!

Appearance was clear red honey caramel gold with creamy lasting off white 1 finger head, lacing throughtout glass. Aromas where sweet honey caramel malts, then soft citrusy lemon, figs, orange,pine and grapefruits.Easy nose with soft hops and sweet malt. Taste was the star, malts of sweet caramel and honey.Hops of citrus and tropical fruitsof figs, orange, grapefruit, and resin with balnace of both. Palate was silky creamy carbonation with a balanced body. The finish was a long beauty of hops and malts. Wonderful, like better colder than warmer...

Bottle to chalice poured an amber with orange hues, medium frothy white head, and minimal lacing.  Aroma includes tangerine, grapefruit, and figs.  Taste is a symphony of flavors including honey and raisins upfront followed by citrus and pine hops.  Finish is extremely smooth and creamy with a wonderful mouthfeel.  Excellently crafted, complex, yet very drinkable Imperial IPA.

Ruby red pour no head simple lacing. Light aroma of citrus, hops, pine, and grass. Butterscotch taste with pine, citrus, hops and spice. Super smooth and creamy on the palate. This one finishes really well.
12 once bottle, aromas of all hops, flavors the same, best off the 4 variants DFH does.
Amazing brew.  Hoppy hoppy hoppy. Butterscotch, citrus, toast, caramel, banana, leather, smoke, woody.
Tastes like a darker ipa but is medium in color. Interesting flavor, not as good as initially thought. Slightly citrussy with slight pine.

Smells fruity and hoppy with a little straw as the pour matures. Blondish amber colour. Decently creamy head with great tracing. Taste has a good balance of booze. Palate is pretty thick, long-lasting. From City Market Co-op in Burlington.
On tap at Yardhouse in Brea. Sweet hop aroma and a nice white head. A  hoppy citrus flavor that with a smooth aftertaste.

Bottle. Citrus fruit on the nose, some honey. Appearance is perfect. Golden orange with a creamy, frothy off white head. The flavor is hops, citrus, honey, some pine and a boozy finish that lingers. Great IPA, but you have to enjoy hops & booziness.

On tap sampler at The Bungalow Alehouse in Gainsville, VA. 

Clear, sparkling orangish amber with a very fine, creamy head and excellent lacing. 

Aroma of floral hops with some pine and citrus hops and a touch of sweet caramel malt. 

Taste of floral, pine and citrus hops neatly balanced by sweet caramel malt flavors. 

Medium body and above average carbonation. 

A very good beer, but I enjoyed the bottle version much better.  Maybe my senses were a little off that day, but I felt that all four beers I tasted at the Bungalow Alehouse were less aromatic and flavorable than I remembered from previously. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Pours clear amber/copper, perfect head and lacing, stays long. Aroma is big citrus, some say resin too... Sounds plausible. Also a bit of sweetness. This Carries over into the taste. The bitterness of the hops are swamped by sweet malt and alcohol. Hard to tell the hop flavor from the bottle im drinking. My lasting impression though is that the beer is remarkable for being so smooth and drinkable at the ABV. Not as good as other top IPAs though.

Bottle. Pours matt golden, with a small creamy head. A bit disappointing that the expected monster aroma turns out to be a quite average woody pine. Flavour is in the monster division though, with  fiercely bitter hops that has notes grapefruit and resin. The bitterness sticks, and gives a nice orange peel finish.

Color dorado palido. Espuma blanca poco persistente pero acompaña ligera hasta el final. Aroma maltoso principalmente con notas lupuladas. Con mucho cuerpo integra perfectamente alcohol, malta y lupulo. Con un final alcoholico seco y lupolizado.

Bottle. Pours copper medium off-white head. Strong hop aroma, floral, pine, and some citrus. Big beer with mild sweet caramel, citrus flavor. Medium body, average carbonation, highly dry and bitter finish. Overall this is a more drinkable Imperial IPA but doesnt sacrifice the high alcohol or hops. Excellent.
One of my two favorite Imperial IPAs. Whenever I want to splurge a little, it is between 90 minute and Stone Ruination.

On Tap at the River rd tavern. 
Pours a deep amber color with a fluffy white head that persists for a while. Smells of hops, lots of pine and citrus with a solid bready and caramel base to round things out. Taste is pleasingly bitter with lots of bitter citrus and pine atop a solid caramel malt base. Medium body with a moderate level of carbonation and a slick resinous mouthfeel. Nice IPA, a bit on the malty side, but very nice going down the gullet.
Light roasted malt aroma with some wet grassy hops as well. Very balanced flavour with nice complexity. Incredibly smooth.

Aroma: caramel, resin, citrus. Appearance: golden, cloudy, minimal head that dissapared quickly. Taste: medium sweetness, medium bitterness, umami. Palate: full body, oily feel, soft carbonation, long bitter finish. Overall: I had high expectations of this beer and was disapointed. There is plenty of bitterness and lots of hop flavour but i found the aroma to be a bit busy and the taste a bit clouded so that no flavours or combinations of flavours or aromas came through clearly.
UPDATED: NOV 29, 2014 Bottle, orange pour, white head, nose is hoppy, taste is super bitter, citrus, hoppy

12 oz bottle poured into Stone IRS tulip.  Pours dark copper with a small head which settles to just a tiny ring.  Almost no lacing left at all.  Aroma is grassy/floral hops with a tad of cereal/toffee.  Medium-bitter with some sweetish undertones.  Medium body with a texture that is kinda slick.  Very low carbonation.  Medium-long bitter finish, which I also found to be very slightly astringent.  A nice product overall (classic) but not my favorite.  Alcohol can barely be perceived, so it gets a bit treacherous!  I say that you have to drink it at least once, but I definitely had better.

Bottle. I love this more than the 120. Its the perfect balance and strength for an IPA. Sweet grass hop, toffee scent. Translucent bronze appearance with a foamy head quickly dissolving to film. Thicker medium body with a sticky texture. Grassy hop fronted flavor to bitter to sweet toffee up into your nose with a burn, then back to finish on a bitter note. Awesome!

I am still getting in to IPA's this one is good but not great.  I think as I drink more ipa this will become much better

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle shared in courtesy of Amundsen-Tom, thanks.
Copper clear, big beige head. Smells of citrus, orange, pine and some malts. Very malty taste, heavy sweet, very fruity too. Medium body, soft carbonation, oily feel. Then the finish takes over, a wall of hops, medium to heavy bitterness, quite resiny and piney, also some citrus and grass. Typical east coast hop mix

Bottle 35.5 cl thanks to Aaron. Orange is the color, above all a white head persistent and frothy on the average. But after? This one definitely represent the concept that a non-hop bomb DIPA isnt necessarily a boring caramel mash. On the contrary, even in the aroma 90 minutes has something different from other DIPAs. Sweetness is gentle, from raisins to plum, with a good citrus and tropical fruits components, both not strong. Dough and yeasty notes too. Maybe even some sugar, but minimal. Nothing is exaggerate, balance at its top. But flavor, its the real show: malt, caramel, molasses, blood orange, star fruit, grapes, white wine, brandy, burned sugar, walnut (!), Fact is, its incredibly complex. SO complex. But pleasant, and you literaly fear to finish it so fast. Alcohol doesnt disturb or annoying you. Carbonation is nearly perfect, and nothing, NOTHING has the strength to shock you: every component has its dignity, and makes you appreciate it. Finish is initially that of a white wine, but after it turns to the dryness of a Gran Marnier or similar triple sec. Leaves the palate really harsh, even in the gums. And lasts, lasts. This is maybe the most complex DIPA ever had. But at the same time has a basic simplicity. Fantastic work by Dogfish Head.

Tap. Pours slightly hazy amber with average, frothy white head; good retention and lacing. Aroma is caramel and cookie malt, floral and dank hops, citrus fruit, figs, and pine. Flavor is balanced malt and hops with good supporting fruit esters; smooth throughout with a slightly hoppy finish. Medium body, warmth, and carbonation.

citrus, grass, resin, hay, dough, orange, hazy, frothy, white foam, medium sweetness, very bitter, medium body, oily feel, lively, long finish. Very well balanced beer. Noticed some tones of raison and honey as well. Changes over time while drinking. Nice how malt and hops play off each other. Good beer, allthough not worth the cost in the Netherlands.

Cloudy brown colour and a thin white head. Hoppy aroma with hints of toffee. Smooth, medium body. Taste is strong and very nice. Hops are not too overpowering. Aftertaste lingers in the mouth for a decent while. Its a very good beer.

12oz bottle dated 2/7/12 poured into tulip glass. 
Aroma:  oranges, grapefruit, caramel, malt, alcohol, floral
Appearance:  orangish gold color with very little head. Laces glass nicely.  Bubbles rising to surface
Taste: heavy sweet. Medium bitter.  Mild sour. Malt backbone really comes through in the taste.  
Palate:  medium sour mild bitter and mild sweet on the finish.  Lively carbonation. Thick mouthfeel and slick texture.  
Overall:  this is a great DIPA.  Definitely not bitter or extremely floral.  Lots of sweetness and flavor.  Will get this again when I can.  

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
UPDATED: AUG 8, 2012 Bottle from super market. Amber color, white head. Rich hoppy taste with caramel, citrus and dry bitter finish. Excellent imperial IPA.
Strong pine/citrus hops and an undercurrent of malts in the aroma.  The flavor is piney hops, a hint of hop resin and a slightly syrupy, malty body.

Bottle. Pours clear amber with a small quickly dissipating head. Hoppy aroma with some pine and citrus notes, slightly sweet malt backing, alcohol notes as well. Flavor is extremely bitter from start to lingering finish; hits you like a freight train. Some malty caramel sweetness mixed in as well. I realize I am in the minority here, but this one goes to far for me, and I find it hard to drink more than one of.

Pours a nice orange amber with a medium creamy white head.  The aroma is fruity, malty, citrus, and pine.  The taste is fruity, malty, and hoppy with notes of apricot, strong hop bitterness, and just a hint of roast.  Balanced more towards the malt than Id like, but still a very good DIPA.

Bottle (dated March 2012) poured into a tulip glass. Pours an orange/amber color with a small white head. Minimal lacing around the glass, with a thin head hanging around the top of the beer. Thin body, nose is fantastic! Apricots, citrus, pine, malt, everything comes together at once and the scents are very complementary! Taste is similar but the IPA hoppy ness really shines through. A great contrast between hops, malt, and fruit! Have never been a big IPA fan, but now Im a believer!

Very flavorful imperial IPA. Sweet full malt with a hint of raisin and molasses. Solid hop bitterness evens out the sweetness. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

UPDATED: MAY 6, 2012 A well-crafted imperial IPA. 

Pours amber copper with little head. Abundance...sorry, ridiculous amount of barley! Hop is there but it plays second fiddle. This is really more of a barley wine than IPA. Good weight on the palate. Smooth finish.
12 oz bottle.   Citrus aroma,  pours a nice copper color with minimal head.   Taste is grapefruit,  pine,  malts with a big alcohol bite.   Very little bitterness,  finishes smooth.

Aroma of sweet grass with hints of clove; beautifully mild sudsy head and clover honey body; taste and palate is where this IIPA really shines, with intense hops and rich tone.  A pleasant palate wrecker.

12 oz bottle pours a clear orange with a small white head and some lacing.  I was expecting another hop bomb, but was surprised to smell mostly candied fruit - no pine or citrus hops.  Aroma is fairly complex, and full of fruits, Malts and something like licorice comes out in the finish.  The hops are evident when you burp.   Taste is bitter, but not as bitter as most IIPAs.  Carbonation is moderate and perfect for this.  A great but atypical IIPA.

Nice appearance when poured. Good flavor and a pleasant aftertaste. Aroma can be off putting for some

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Love this beer. This IIPA is not like most. Rather then intense hops, pine and citrous, this IIPA appears to be more focused on fruits, caramel, raisins malts. The typical IIPA notes are more subtle and less pronounced. However, the more prominent flavors mask the high alcohol content making it very drinkable and smooth. Its more like drinking a fine wine or whiskey in my opinion. Fantastic brew.

UPDATED: JUL 15, 2013 Nice clear orange color with a nice head that lingers a bit.  The aroma makes me drool.  I smell lots of fruit, strawberries, oranges, and raisins.  Also flowers and caramel malt.  Nice bitterness up front, then a mixture of fruit, flowers, and a nice malty backbone.  The only thing I dont like is that the alcohol burn seems a little too much at the finish.  Nice aftertaste though.  A top notch imperial ipa.  Re-rate - 7/15/13 - I find myself rarely drinking this anymore.  I love the nose on this but something in the taste makes always makes me a bit diappointed.

Bottle poured, golden Amber color minimal head, nose is strong with piney hops light booziness and sweet smell like candy, very leggy, mouth starts sweet with citrusy hops and ends bitter with the hops, the first feel is thin but.thickens and coats the entire mouth, after taste is bitter with slight alcohol burn, beer is muy bueno

Originally reviewed: 6/17/09. Poured into my tulip glass a dark orange/gold with a nice 2-finger ivory head on top. Retention was firm, and there was plenty of sticky lacing on glass. Smells of alcohol, flowers, sugar cookies, and faint citrus. 

This is the smoothest DIPA Ive had to date. Very mellow and creamy. Nice touch. This seems to have a bit of an age on it for a hoppy beer (5 months), but from what Ive read from other reviewers, age is good on the 90. The hops have definitely faded quite. Theres a touch of hoppy piney bite on the tongue but it is very subtle. Rather, the malty sweetness plays a big part in this beer. Very caramelly and warm. I had to keep myself from chugging this beauty. Seriously. This was drinkable to the max. Smooth, creamy, sweet, and satisfying.Ill need to revisit this one fresh.

Bottle. Pours an amber color. Small foamy off-white head. Very sweet caramel malt and piny hop nose. Flavor was of estery candy, caramel, and pine, with a little spice. Palate was sweet up front, then bitter in finish. Crisp, but not harsh in carbonation. Very nice overall.

Pours a nice golden amber color, with slight lacing and head, on tap or from the bottle. Aroma, like most Dogfish beers is heavy on the citrus and pine, lighter on the malts, although there is more of a maltiness than the 60min. Bitter finish with a bit of an alcohol backbone. Solid double IPA, but not the smoothest or best tasting in my opinion.
As good as they say... Pours amber with an off white head.  Caramelly sweetness accentuates the hop-based pine needle character of this beer.  Pungent aroma and a sharp aftertaste.

UPDATED: MAR 9, 2013 Tap @ The Ginger Man, New York 15/04/12. Pours a dark amber with a large, yellowish-brown head. Aroma is pithy hops, nettles, pine, juniper, some caramel in there as well. Taste is a strong mixture of caramel and pith. Rather sweet, surprisingly so. The bittering effect at the end is strong with pith and pine. Palate is smooth.

Had this at pint house a Legit beer bar. Had it In a pint glass on draft.
Very solid u would recommend this beer to anyone looking for a quality ipa 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Not much into IPAs but Dog Fish head is probably the best ipa ive ever had. Will definitely be a continuous choice.

Bright citrusy aroma. Very bitter. Very hoppy. Archer's in Dayton, OH. Beautiful head. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

May 2010: My third and final beer in Ales&Aces (Las Vegas).

Half a pint poured into a stemmed tulip glass.

The bar is fairly dark, but you can see this is a copper coloured beer with a thin white head on top without having to ask for extra lighting.

The aroma was all hop, a fairly bitter hop aroma at that.

The beer taste was predominately hops too, although a malty aftertaste appeared as the beer warmed in the glass, it got sweeter too, as it warmed.

I thought the alcohol well hidden at first, but it did show towards the end of the tasting. It didnt become overpowering, but you could tell it was hanging around waiting to attack if youd let it.

12 oz. bottle poured into a DFH Signature Glass.

Pours a dark golden amber with a fluffy two and half finger clean white head. Fantastic retention and beautiful lacing. The smell is dominated by earthy, grassy, and floral hops and a bit of fruit with citrus accents. Floral hops first greet the tastebuds, transitioning to sweet malt backbone and finishing with a slight grassy bitterness. The mouthfeel is exceptional an abudant malt backbone, smooth and very creamy. 90 Minute IPA is a modern American beer classic and an exceptional brew.
Bottle. Aroma is a pleasant floral, not tons of aroma hops that I thought I might get. Taste is smooth, with less bitterness than some top tier ipas. Overall I was impressed.
Quite drinkable despite the huge bitterness. Overall a very enjoyable beer. This is not my favourite beer style but I still enjoyed it.
fizzy, medium body, long finish, medium sweetness, medium body, floral, grass, licorice.

Context: Bottle, second beer of the night, kid tugging at my arm intermittently. 

Golden straw with a solid lingering head. Balanced hop and malt that I havent tasted before. Was wondering why it was hitting me so hard and then noticed the alcohol content. Slight bitter aftertaste. Will drink again, but find other IPAs more to my liking.
Full hoppy aroma, more floral than citrus.  Dark golden pour.  Spicy hops, malty backbone.  Surprisingly smooth.  An excellent IPA.

UPDATED: DEC 10, 2013 Bottle into DFHs signature glass, hazy golden-copper color with light tan head.  Aroma of piney/citrus hops and a fair amount of caramel malt backing.  Taste starts with the hops shining, pine/citrus (orange, grapefruit) notes followed quickly by heavy malt notes of bread and even light cocoa.  Heavy body, low carbonation, syrupy, oily, boozy with lingering bitter finish.  One of my first IIPAs, still solid after all these years.
High expectations for this one and it didnt disapoint. Found it balanced and flavorful and will enjoy this again!
This is a very good IPA. Hoppy palate with fruit and caramel notes. Good beer. ........

Floral aroma. Amazing head...rich, full mouthfeel. Heavy going down. Beautiful rich color. Could use stronger flavor.

12pz bottled poured into snifter. Wonderful sweet hoppy floral aroma.  Perfect golden reddish hue. Bitter herbal citrus flavor blends and finished perfectly, absolutely a favorite!

Pours an amber color with small white head.  Aroma is completely dominated by hops, grassy and citrusy.  Strong bitter flavor balanced with sweetness.  Creamy mouthfeel and bitter finish.  This is really good.

DFH90 is a great example of what a DIPA should be. Hoppy and well balanced with full flavor.

UPDATED: APR 28, 2012 More hoppy than I wanted. But it does have some malt to make it okay, but not my favorite.

Drank as part of the "continuously-hopped challenge" (drinking 60, 75, 90, 120 minute DFH ipas).

Darker amber pour than 60m. Nice dark color for IPA. Immediately, the hops are hitting you in the aroma. The taste doesnt disappoint regarding the hops, but you also get a malty (almost nuttiness) that gives way to a perceived sweetness at the end. Floral throughout. Strong mouthfeel - medium bodied, the right amount of carbonation. 

Of the four, this is the one I would probably reach for if I could just have one. 60 is good as a session. 120 hits you over the head. 75 is interesting. 90 got it right!

The aroma hits you perfectly in a snifter. The appearance is almost dead on where I would want it, but the taste is something that I simply do not know if it could be beaten. Overall it is one of the best beers around.
Bottle shared in Seattle. This is a great IPA - very mild and complex. Its a paradox, full of contradictions...

Bottle @ Cosmopolitan Hotel, New York, USA. Clear golden with an off-white main medium. Aroma of malt, caramel and grapefruit. Sweetish taste down notes of alcohol and barley wine. Moderately dry and bitter in taste and aftertaste

On cask at Ashleys in Ann Arbor.....mild aroma but huge

hop smack in the face.  Smooth, dense palate
with perfect imperial finish.  You know the alcohol is strong but
balance and smooth dominates.  This is a hammer!

Very nice DIPA. Clear golden brown in glass with not much lacing or head. Smell is of citrus, pine, and hops. Taste is sweet hoppiness with a bitter finish. Enjoyable beer that I would highly recommend.
Sweet hop aroma on nice golden pour with white head.  Hoppy citrus resin flavor that is a bit sticky on the palate.

Hoppy as heck without being overpowering. Really good would have again in a heartbeat.

-- Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone.
Bottle from beersofeurope.com. One of my favourite ipas. It is well tasty.
I love this one. Hoppy and smooth in all the best ways, this is an easy beer to drink for the beer lovers out there.

This one tastes very similar to their 60 minute IPA, but has 3% more ABV.  So watch yourself because this 9% doesnt have the bite that most 9%s have.  Just a tad light on being hoppy, but overall a solid beer.
Aroma is disappointing but you take one sip and WOW. Hops! Citrus! Malt! Caramel! Raisins! Cream! What an IPA. Top of the line. Shame if you see this on a menu and dont order it, its wonderful.
Amber with good head that sticks around with good lacing. Aroma is very strong of citrus and hops. Taste of lemon, pine hops, and malt. Medium bodied.

A very malty IIPA. Great appearance and taste. If you like more malty IPAs, this one is for you. The taste and smell to me is like a cross between a IIPA and a Scottish ale. Great beer and is one of my favorites. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Bottle from bevmo. Beer is heavy. Taste thick an malty. Has hoppy aroma and taste.....

Amber, orange color with a moderate haze. Nice head that lasts. Hops hit the nose first with some pine and malts in there as well. Taste was so nicely balanced. Lots of hops at first then mixes with some malts and some fruits.
Dog fish head 90 minute impereial ipa is a great ipa with a very smooth finish loads of hops with a very good finish

Pours amber with a tan head. Lots of flowers, tropical fruits, citrus and malts of the nose. Taste is thick with caramel malts, citrus and fruity hops. This is pretty sweet and has a med-full body. After taste is very dry with some fruity and nutty flavors. Very good.
Hoppy but balanced and surprisingly sweet and malt-forward for an IPA, even a double IPA. A wonderful beer, I really wish it were available in Ontario.

bottled. pours amber with a minimal offwhite head. aromas of spruce, caramel and grapefruit rind. it is bitter but well balanced. it has a light alcohol bite and sweetness from caramel.the beer lingers on the tongue with its bitterness. this is an extremely well balanced beer.

UPDATED: FEB 27, 2015 This beer truly lives up to all the hype it gets! It pours a clear bright amber with a nice two-finger white head that lasted throughout the beer and left lots of lacing. The aroma is so inviting, I picked up a lot of floral notes, pine, hops, breadiness, and some tropical fruit. The taste is very good! You pick up lots of tropical fruits, sugary malts, some pine and hops but I feel like the malts overpower them slightly. The alcohol is slightly picked up in the taste. The mouthfeel is on the medium side and the drinkability is average, it is more of a sipper.
From the bottle poured a clear, golden brew with a thick white head. Lots of malt and hops at the nose. Very full bodied, silky smooth in the mouth. I like it, and IIPAs are not usually my thing.

A very dark orange with a two finger
head that lasts for a while. Nice lacing which leaves
some good sized rings. Smell has sweet hops, some malt and white chocolate
smell. The malt really shines, interesting for a DIPA. Taste has a nice kick of the hops, followed immediately
by the intense malt backbone released in the smell.
Finishes sweet, makes you lick your chops and go
for some more. Mouthfeel is very thin and light, smooth sailing. I absolutely love this beer. By far one of my
favorites. The hops and malt balances perfectly,
which was interesting to me for a DIPA with 90
IBU's. Will stay in my rotation for a while.

Cloudy copper with a nice white head. Aroma is piney and citric. Taste is very nice starts out lightly sweet and malty that lingers for a moment then it is wonderful, citrusy hops that finishes dry. Mouthfeel is very smooth.

Appearance: Pours a golden/yellow color with a nice white head. Aroma: Full of hops with a nice sweet malt aroma in the background. Taste: Full of bitter and sweet hop notes that is followed by a very sweet malt backbone. One of my go to beers.

UPDATED: JUN 4, 2013 Dogfish Heads 90 did disappoint... Too malty for an IPA for me personally.... I wanted note of a hop bomb. Overall, I would drink this again because its a tasty brew but not what I expected.

UPDATED: DEC 23, 2012 ipas arent for me; this wasnt nearly as hoppy as I thought it would be.  bottle to glass.  orange amber cloudy pour.  aroma is malt piney hops slight citrus.  palate is nice and creamy.  Taste is the downer for me - way too sweet which seems odd - hops are there; some bitterness and something else - not for me...

Pretty good for an IPA. I suggest the Dogfish Head 120 Minute IPA which is in a whole other class which raised my expectations to disappointment when I had this one. Thick body/palate with NOT great hops

One of the best smelling beers Ive encountered. While others aroma dissipate over time this one goes on throughout. Poured from a bottle appearing as a honey yellow nectar...not quite as hoppy as I expected (or prefer) but a great tasting ipa
I enjoyed this beer alot. great aroma pours great with a nice thick head. very nice finish.

Bottle. Pours a rusted orange and amber color with an inch of dense off-white foam. The aroma is sweet and floral with notes of orange citrus, tangerine, honey and malt. The taste starts off with strong resiny hops bitterness and tropical fruit flavors as well as some pine, citrus and caramel. The bready malt backbone asserts itself toward the end before leading to a mildly boozy, bitter finish. Mouthfeel is slightly syrupy with medium-level carbonation and a subtle alcohol presence. Overall, a smooth and potent East Coast style DIPA.

Spicy floral aroma, thin lattice head ckings to the sides well. Color is a unique dark amberstone, cloudycannot see through the glass. Great mouthfeel, almost chewey, to be sipped and savored. Taste is well balanced ,liquid bready, mossy, with hints of blue cheese. Finish is long and satisfying. Very filling and satisfying IPA, the hops they chose for bittering are a perfect blend, does not taste as bitter as the IBU number would indicate. This is one to serve when you want to show off.

Dark gold color. Nice head retention and lacing. Wow!! Hops aroma bowled me over. What a great smell this brew has. Hops over the malts, although the malts are present. Hoppier than the 60 minute IPA, as expected. Very bitter.

What a great IPA! I usually dont prefer the overpowering hoppiness in IPAs but I couldnt believe how smoothe this tasted. It seems that there was a strong maltiness to balance out the bitterness of the hops. This IPA definately is in its own class and is probably what other American IPAs should aspire to emulate.

UPDATED: OCT 29, 2013 Before I traveled to Southern California, this was my favorite IPA. It is still a very good one. Deep amber color with big head. The aroma is malty and with very little floral aspect. The unique taste puts it in a different category than other IPAs. Almost too malty and thick for me now.

First try: October 22, 2010, Im Atlanta with Jesse. My first legitimate IPA, and it was overwhelming. Too much for me at that point. The Belgium quad won me over that day.

This is one of the best beers I have tasted. Very smooth and bursting with great taste. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Copper colored beer with a very slight head. There is a prominent hop aroma, but the bitterness is not as prevalent as some other IPAs, this is probably due to the sweetness from the malts. The high alcohol content is definitely noticeable in the taste.

Hazy light orange color with a thick head. Herbal and citrus notes on the nose. Caramel notes up front with a lingering citrus peel finish. Palate is fairly large with hints of grapefruit and florality. This is a darn good IPA.
A beer that defines what an IPA should be, all others are aspiring to tis standard.  Nice crisp head, awesome flavor.  Bitterness that is balanced with a full body.

on tap at daily pint
pours an amber hue with a white head that is mostly diminishing
aroma of hops and tropical fruits with some malt at the end
flavor is pretty much the same as aroma
medium mouthfeel with light carbonation

Bottle - Pours deep clear copper with a massive head and lacing. The aroma is malty and the alcohol is fairly obvious. Detected caramel and spruce in the taste. The body is thick and the mouthfeel is oily. Had I not known in advance that it was a DIPA I would have thought I was rating something a little darker like a stout. Its not my favorite for this category but much like the Great Divide Titan IPA, I completely understand the high ratings.

Poured a clear copper with a large head. Aroma is very caramel scented. Taste is hoppy with caramel notes and tastes a bit woody. Palate has an average carbonation and feels a bit thin. Over all a very nice beer. 

Franks

Hoppy nose with malty undertones.  Being an American ipa, its focused on the the hops, but...  Its not too crazy.  Great flavor and bitterness.  While not the example for hop heads, it should be what american ipas should be.

Looks like a normal IPA, smells like a normal IPA, however the taste has a nice balance. There is a nice malt behind the hops, which makes it a refreshing drink. Good IPA.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Nice, strong imperial IPA... Not much I can add to peoples reviews, but I highly recommend it! I would like to say that it has a good grainy flavor that some super hoppy beers lack.

Pours a hazy amber with little to no head. Aromas of grapefruit, raisins, citrus and some piney hops. Tastes amazing, an up front hop bite with a nice multi-fruit finish and some caramel malts adding a nice balance to it all.  Alcohol is covered pretty well but there is still a noticeable burn, but thats not a bad thing just something worth noting. This is a great beer and worthy of the hype. I could drink this anytime, anywhere. CHEERS!

Nice copper colored beer with a very slight head. There is a prominent hop aroma, but the bitterness is not as prevalent as some other IPAs, this is probably due to the sweetness from the malts. The high alcohol content is definitely noticeable in the taste.

Bottle. Clear amber orange beer with little head or lace.  Heavy, thick, and powerful with aromas of malt, grapefruit and other ripe fruits. There is some alcohol and a bit of floral spicy and herbal hop aroma to round it out.  Sweet flavors of English malts with some cheese and funk. Bitterness grows throughout.  Thick and sticky texture that is also a little soapy with slightly rough carbonation.  A really nice beer that Im happy has such good distribution. Reliable and drinkable (just not too many on a Friday night).

Pours hazy orange with a tan, fine head. The aroma is powerful, with strong notes of caramel and vanilla, as well as some hints of citrus fruit. The taste is very complex - a lot of malt sweetness, a hint of acidity, and well-balanced bitterness that builds as the sweetness fades. This beer is solidly medium-bodied and well carbonated. This is an exceptional beer.

Pours a clear golden with moderate carbonation coming from the base. Small head that persists for a bit, but then disappears leaving very little lacing.  High bitter hop aromas with spruce and herbal upfront. Grapefruit enters in a little later. Some moderate caramel and roasted malt aromas are present despite the strength of the hops. Hint of raisin/dark fruits. Carbonation is moderate with a medium body and moderate to long finish that is incredibly well balanced between the malt and the hop

On tap poured into dfh chalice

A: nice amber hue, 1/2" off white head that reduces somewhat quick to a light lacing cap

S: pine and light citrus

T: citrus hop flavor cuts through sweet caramel backbone. Nice, like how a Dipa should

M&d: nice clean mouth, slight drying. Very drinkable for abv.

Another quality dfh product. May not be the best, but u know you wont be disappointed.

Well. Very well done, DFH. Thanks for the treat. Preferable to the 120 Minute in my opinion, given the elegant balance of alcohol, super heavy hop, and perfectly roasted barleys. A favorite of mine, and Im not even what one would call a Hophead. I prefer it a little less chilly than average fridge temperature, but I hear its best nearly warm.

Got this in bottles and was pleased to find the aroma is that fresh hop pungency which I love- usually a sign of good things to come. Taste is equal parts malt and hops in very good balance with some boozy notes. Beyond that nothing really stands out to me; a little disappointing. Not worth $12 for a four pack imo.
UPDATED: FEB 24, 2012 Just plain great IPA. Everything new IPA lovers are searching for. Ripe citrus, pine, nice malt balance. Chewy and fruity, dry bitter citrus finish. Excellent.

Appearance: Golden Orange, small white head. Aroma: pines and malt and pines again, lots of orange peel and malt. Flavour: bitter pine, mango, oily, spicy, a little alcohol tingle, orange peel again, tingly on the tongue. Long bitter finish. Delicious.

From beerlicious iphone app:
Orange and clear in color, frothy tan head
Light bitterness to start, heavy bitterness with an avg duration
Texture is creamy and thick with fizzy carbonation

From notes.  First reviewed 4/17/2010.  Poured from a bottle into a pint glass.

My pour has a moderately hazy burnt orange color, with a 3 cm head with good retention. Nice lacing sticks to the glass.

90 minute IPA has a robust hop aroma, with a fuller spectrum as it warms. Earthy and floral notes predominate. The complex nose makes it difficult to distinguish the various aromas.

Although the taste is balanced with a moderate malt presence and even possesses a caramel sweetness, the real draw is the hops. With quite a few types, the complexity on the tongue is a real treat. Sweet fruits, pine and floral hops, soft grapefruit, and lemon rind all have a noticeable presence. Finishes with a sweet and bitter twist, with a mildly bitter aftertaste.

A creamy and oily feel, and the crisp carbonation bites just a little bit. The combined effect creates a smooth effect, while letting the flavor pop as well.

To me, the 90 minute has a nice balance of depth and complexity that can normally be found in Dogfish Head offerings. Carefully constructed, with a great taste and full aroma that make it easy to drink.

12 ounce bottle. Pours a golden copper with frothy head. Nose is a little bitter. Mild bitter onset followed by more of the same with a relatively clean finish. Not as hoppy as some other IPAs Ive tried. A good, solid beer.

0.355l bottle shared with The Tasting Crew. Ha! A little whale this :) This one pours a light blurry bright copper body with a small bubbly and sidesticking head. The aroma is not to extreme of fruity, but more malty and light sweet with tones of cortex and grass. Subtle but nice. Average carbonation and a good oily mouthfeel. Lots of malty sweetness in this one. Suspect the bottle could be a bit older than it should have been, but still, its really tasty. Caramel sweetness with a good amount of bittering hops. Kinda marmalade-ish towards the finish and that goes on for quite a while. Would not mind having this as a regular in my supermarket.. 30.01.2012

To me, this IS the best IPA in America...that Ive tried so far. Hands down impeccable flavor, super hoppy and dry, harmoniously infused citrus notes, tickles the gums and just puts a smile on my face. Quality brew, high ABV at a reasonable price that goes down so damn smooth. If you want that out at the GOOD beer bar (you know the one!) feeling, bring a four pack of these babies home with you.

Bottle:
Medium pretty vast white to yellow ish head on top of an almost clear orange colored beer. 
Smell hops, fruits, peach, sweet barley malts, light caramel but most of all hoppy fruits.
Taste lots of fruit: peach, pine, pine apple, some abricot, spices, bitter, floral, hops, nice bitter, soft smooth and thicker mouthfeel/texture, some barleys malts and some hints of alcohol and metal, though just a tiny bit present.
Fruity herby hoppy bitter aftertaste.
Low carbo, soft almost silky mouthfeel, full body and a thick creamy texture.
Tasty, thick and hop fruity. Good stuff!
user_location: Best of E-Town mit 2 Brauhausen, NETHERLANDS

text: UPDATED: FEB 22, 2012 Pours a dark copper color with a 1 finger head.  Smell of citrus and hops.  Taste is pretty sweet, citrus, floral notes....very good IPA.  A lot of people love this beer and I can see why.
Wow...so glad I have become a hop fan. 1st time I tried this years ago, I hated it. Now, LOVE isnt strong enough!
A singular IPA. The nose shows pine resin and citrus notes. Medium bodied with some baking spice and even caramel on the finish. Extremely long finish.
Bouteille 12 Fl oz. Ambree-orange claire. Nez dherbes et de malt. Bouche de houblon fleural bien balance avec le malt. Rien dover-the-top, tres bonne.

One of my favorites and so glad to see more and more places carrying it on tap. Beautiful, deep brown color with a rich balance between medium bitterness and medium sweetness. Well-balanced poetry of malt and hops. Highly recommended.

In my opinion this is the best beer in the world. I love IPAs and this is my idea of the most perfect representation of that type. It balances the perfect level of hoppiness with a robust, malty flavor. Some IPAs try to go overboard on the hops (which I love) while neglecting the rest of process and ending with good, but not great, product. The only beer that I would rate as high as this one would be Dogfish Heads 120 minute IPA. Theyre both at the top of two slightly different categories as far as Im concerned.

Appearance amber, orange and clear. is Nose is floral, herbs, carmel and alcohol,.  Taste is medium bitterness and medium sweetness.  Very enjoyable, been meaning to try this for sometime now. Top notch IPA.
IPAs dont get much better than this.  90 Minute is packed with hops but still nice and rounded.  If you like IPAs, grab a bottle or glass at your next convenience.
UPDATED: JUN 10, 2012 coper color, flavor is citrus hops and lots of malt, flavor is citrus, caramel, toffee, a lot more malty than most DIPAs

The pour creates a modest head with nice lacing. The aroma is wonderful with the first aspect of smelling fresh hops. The aroma also has hints of citrus and malt. It has a more malt flavor than many IPAs which balances the hops nicely. It leaves a wonderful hops flavor with a malt and caramel palate. It is by far one of my favs.

Poured from the tap with a nice head. Golden orange in color with a citrus, caramel, and grapefruit aroma. Very balanced with a caramel and bitter aftertaste. Im also picking up grapefruit and a touch of biscuit. Very tasty, worth the buy.

Bottle,Pours a copper color with a slight foamy head. Smells and tastes of heavy citrus, spruce, bread, alcohol, clove, light sweetness, very bitter, medium body, sticky, bitter, got to love it one the best at what it is.

Pours to a hazy medium orange with a good head and nice lacing.  Aroma is quite hoppy with citrus notes. The aroma is misleading, as the taste is more malty than expected. Caramel and toffee with a slight coffee note.  Mouthfeel is pretty full. This is a great brew.
clove, alcohol, basement aromas, citrus, cereal, spruce. Awesome no matter how you look at it.

Clear, light copper with off-white head.  Sweetness of a jolly rancher, orangish citrus.  Greta malt and hop balance. A little grassy and grapefruity.  Bracing, sharp finish with residual sweetness.  Fuckin A nice.

Från denna brunorange öl strömmar det upp dofter av citrus, knäckebröd och smörkola. Den höga alkoholprocenten sticker i näsan. Smaken är frukt och russin och en jäkla massa (men i det här fallet inget negativt) bitterhet.

16 oz draft at winking lizard bethel road

A: one of the few beers as of late, it seems, that fits the bill of an india PALE ale. so many of these should actually be called imperial amber ales

S: its a fantastic aroma, but i wasnt sure to rate it as an average DIPA or above average beer

T: the bitterness doesnt seem to wait for you to swallow it. the hope flavor hits as the penance for such excellent flavor

M: there is no chalkiness or syrupy feel. this goes down as beer should as easy as water, but not quite as thin

O: considering this is probably the most popular IPA in the US, my opinion doesnt matter

Bottle, courtesy of Eric who shipped this baby all across the Atlantic to the Bergen Beer Geek Tasting Crew - thanks man! :-D This is my first-ever Dogfish Head beer (thanks to lack of distribution in Europe) and after seeing all the "Brewmasters" eps Im pretty psyched up about finally popping one! :-) So here goes: pours a clear deep golden body with a small, off-white head. Aroma is surprisingly sweet, with grassy hops and syrupy notes, hints of spices, pumpkin and roasty malts in the back. Taste is smooth, clean grassy hop notes with thick syrupy malt tones as a dense backdrop. Smooth and full-bodied. Not too impressive in the ways of complexity, but thats made up for through an amazingly clean taste; almost like a lager DIPA. I like it.

Draft at Picco . Nice deep brown , taste strong but very smooth , enjoyed it but didnt want a second

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

UPDATED: FEB 5, 2012 Deep amber with a monster fluffy white head.  Leaves lots of lacing.Aroma is fruity (hint of pineapple) with a hint of alcohol.Taste is much smoother than I expected.  It starts off a little milder than I expected but then you get hit by the hoppy bitterness midway through which lingers long after you swallow.Good IIPA though I think I prefer Stone Ruination and Three Floyds Arctic Panzer Wolf.

Bottle. The aroma was of floral and grass hops, a grain malt and a soapy yeast with notes of caramel, citrus (grapefruit) and a mild alcohol tinge.

The taste started with a mild sweetness and a slight bitterness with a note of caramel and then finished quite a bit hoppier with an excellent bitter citrus taste and a slight alcohol presence at the end. The flavor lasted a really nice long time with the smooth hoppy citrus taste fading very slowly.

Mouthfeel was just a tad over light in body with the texture being a bit dry and having a slight oiliness to it with a nice strong carbonation.

Overall a nice strong hoppy brew that had such a good balance of a bitter citrus and caramel sweetness that the high ABV was hardly noticeable.

"Had this in a sampler at the Dogfish Head Alehouse in Fairfax VA. Ive had this beer many times but waited to get it ""near the source"" before reviewing it. Best 90 minute Ive ever had.
A - Dark amber, 2 finger head
S - Pine, lots of hop and some spicy notes.
T - LOVE this beer. Spice, vanilla and pine. There are some hoppy features but its just a solid hoppy beer with nice alcohol hints as you drink it. 
M - This beer is literally mouth numbing. As it hits the tongue, parts of it go numb and its really high carbonation.
O - Once youve had this at an ale house that gets shipments daily, you cant go back to bottled 90 minute. This was so great!
This would go great with some chili cheese fries!!!"

Pours a clear orange amber with a big frothy white head.  Aroma is sweet floral and slightly citrus hop.  Taste is a little resinous, nicely bittered and well balanced.  Sweet, bitter and loads of hop flavouring.  Awesome IPA.  Thanks to wimperoo for this.

I really enjoy IPAs, but I have to be honest, for all Id heard about this one, it was  bit of a letdown. A little too malty for my taste, and a little too average considering the ringing endorsements Id received from others.

UPDATED: FEB 26, 2013 excelente, aroma intenso y penetrante con notas frutales y maltosas, cuerpo de medio a alto, alto contenido de lupulo, alto contenido de malta, cerveza compleja y sin embargo sigue siendo una cerveza refrescante, algo que me encanta de este estilo; el sabor es maltoso, afrutado y amargo, si te gustan las IPAs, este ejemplar es uno de los mejores del estilo.

Draft. Pours a nice hazy dark golden with a 1/2 finger head. Aroma is citrus, ripe raisins, grapefruit and a touch of dankyness. Taste follows with a nice sweet backbone. Very well put together IIPA. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
6 month old bottle pours clear amber with two fingers of off-white head and good lacing, aroma of hops, malt and caramel, Im not usually a fan of IPAs but this is delicious.

I thought I poured an IPA in my pint  ... but its not. 
THIS IS THE IPA: hops, caramalt, crystallized orange zest, mouthfeel, complexity, richness, body and soul ... so many aromas that kick your nose, your brain....
My favourite "Imperial IPA" for the moment.
I am eager to taste the whole Dogfish Heads clock: 60 minutes and 120 minutes ! 
Santa Klaus if you hear me ! ! !
Super Cheers !

UPDATED: MAY 4, 2012 Poured from growler into snifter. Orange color with about a finger of white head. Very hoppy and fruity smell, bit grassy. Taste isnt overpoweringly hoppy. Its got a raspberry kind of flavor, almost soapy, bit of caramel. Claims to be high on the IBU, but I dont taste it as that bitter. Pretty drinkable for the ABV. Used to like it a lot more, and its still one of my favorite IPAs, but its not as good as it used to be in my eyes.

12 oz bottle pours a deep amber with a reddish hue. Smells of deviant hops, peaches, and caramel malt. Taste has a huge citrus hop bitterness but has a sweet malty backbone to balance everything out perfectly. Obvious this beer is infamous among craft beer but dont know why I havent rated it sooner. Cheers

a very complex and intricate beer. you are first struck with the citrus flavors that segue into the chocolate/coffee/nutty flavors. The beer ends with a strong hoppy finish. One of the better IPAs Ive had.

Pours a clear amber with a medium white head.  Delicious hops  aroma that isnt overwhelming.  Wonderful sweet taste with light to medium bitter taste.  The palate really stands out to me.  The body is full without being heavy and it is a seductively creamy texture with average carbonation and a slight bitter finish that makes you come back for more.  By far the best IPA I have ever had.  It is also up there with my favorite beers of any type.  Well worth the $10.99 for a 4-pack.

Reviewed from notes. Bottle poured into a Duvel tulip glass.

A - Pours deep amber orange with a thick pillow of one and a half finger tall head leaving light rings of lacing down the glass.

S - Smells of strong caramel malt sweetness, dulled citric hops, pine, and some faded out citric fruit. This one appears to be a bit old...

T - Starts off with a quick burst of piney hops quickly giving way to a mix of strong caramel malt sweetness and dulled citric fruit. Finish is a mix of caramel sweetness and hop bitterness, lingering for some time. I love 90min. but this bottle is just a bit past its prime.

M - Medium body and flavor with moderate carbonation. Full bodied with a mix of sweetness and bitterness in the finish.

O - I have always enjoyed this beer. It is very well rounded and has all the qualities I look for in a hoppy beer. I just wish more stores would stop selling these older bottles as it never does this beer justice.
Bottle.  Pours a bright copper color with a thin head.  Aroma is big with hops which show up big up front in the flavor but not overpowering.  Pretty easy to drink given the high alcohol content.

bottle. Slightly cloudy orange, smallish head. Aroma is bright, fresh exotic fruits. Wow, that first sip was awesome; sweet caramel malt on the front end, great hoppy bitter on the back end with notes of pineapple, mango, citrus. Great beer.
My boyfriend loves this beer...very nice aroma and appearance..a little too hoppy for my taste buds :)
Hoppy and earthy. Distinctly bitter initial after taste, but a nice lingering smoothness afterwards.

Poured from a bottle into a standard pint glass. Aroma faint but hops and grapefruit come through. Appearance is light brown with a white head and lacing. Limited malt, very hoppy, predominately citrus. Slight alcohol bite. Overall its an excellent IPA but wasnt the 100 I expected it to be, I bought my first 4-pack and I think its worth the added cost over the 60 Minute IPA but still not a perfect beer.
12 ounce bottle.  Pours a clear umber with a nice white head.  Great lacing.  Aroma of citrus and piney hops.  Taste is sweet malt, citrus, piney hops, and caramel.  Great balance.  Exceptional.
Likable DIPA.  It did not change my life like some have, but it was great to enjoy while in Atlanta

12oz bottle poured into a pint glass.

Appearance is a slightly hazy medium orange with a hefty 2 finger head. Excellent head retention and decent lacing as well.

Aroma is quite hoppy with citrus notes but there is also a solid bready malt base.

The taste is quite a bit maltier than I was expecting from the nose. Quite a bit of caramel and toffee with a slight coffee note. Hop flavors are somewhat buried underneath but are present. A nice bitterness is there to balance out the malty sweetness. Mouthfeel is pretty full and sticky. A slight alcohol presence towards the finish.

This is a top notch brew and one of the best I have had. I will definitely come back to this one again and again.

Perhaps they are right and this is the best IPA in America.  Maybe not, but its up there.  Pours a golden amber with a decent white head. Great grapefruit and orange zest aroma.  Lots of yeasty malt in the aroma as well.  Very bitter with the alcohol very well hidden.  DFH might often be over hyped, but this beer is top notch.

UPDATED: SEP 21, 2012 Bottle pours hazy darker orange with lasting off white head. Aroma is sweet and bready with a lightly toasted character and some resinous oily hops. The taste is malty up front with a lightly burnt toffee and tiny alcohol tinge but has an inherent bitterness that matches perfectly. A little bit of orange and earthy grain bitter mostly. The carbonation and the full nature of the beer are big but it goes down easy. I feel like it could be just me but I also get a strange chocolaty mouthfeel like I would from a darker beer, kind of a creamy/grainy palate. This is not the most stupid amazing iipa ever, but it is a very well crafted beer and could be considered a standard for the style. Classic.
Just like the 60 min IPA, I love this beer.  Nice color, very hoppy taste.  I drive 2 hours to buy this beer, well worth it.

Bottle. Pours a slight hazy orange with a large off white head. Aroma of caramel, sweet malt and citrus grapefruit hops. Flavor has the perfect sweetness with a sweet malt beginning and a citrus finish. A slightly syrupy mouth feel gives this brew a full body. Well balanced and delicious. This is a landmark version of the style in my opinion. A truly wonderful brew from Dogfish Head.

Wish I were a fan of overly hopped beers...but Im not. Highly unbalanced with no malt character at all. Fantastic for the style...just not into the style. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Poured from a bottle into a pilsner glass. Color was caramel amber. An inch of head. Healthy amount of bubbly lacing on the top. Sporadic but consistent film on the sides.

Smelled caramel malts up front. Also some coffee and toffee. Citrus hops came in late, which was a bit surprising.

Tasted similar to the nose with some more alcohol bite. Caramel rules the day here. So smooth.

Medium body. Creamy texture. Average-to-lively carbonation. Smooth finish.

Was looking forward to trying this beer. Thanks to Chris Harris for picking some up for me. Yum!

Quite possibly my favorite beer on planet Earth.  As Im from St Louis (Dogfish Head doesnt distribute here or nearby) this is my MUST purchase when in a DFH city. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Deep golden amber pour with a small white head and lacing. Very fruity and heaving with hops, malt and caramel. Citrus fruit, particularly orange, malt and hops are the dominant flavours. 90 minute is quite complex with pine and cognac coming through as well. 

This is really really good. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Great hoppy taste with hint of  caramel. Very smooth. One of my favorite full body IPAs.

UPDATED: OCT 17, 2012 A - nice crisp copper pour with 2 finger off white head, with lacing. S -bready yeast apricots caramel malts. M - creamy mf medium body with high carb. T - nice bitter throughout. Hoppy on the nose, grassy, creamy apricots and biscuity and caramel malts on the palate. Lingering bitter hoppy finish. Subtle tang. O - my favorite ipa. 8+/9-

Great aroma. Almost fruity in a way. Taste is very smooth for an IPA. Nutty/Carmel lingering flavor. Very different from most American IPAs. Would recommend for the adventurous. Drank from tap in a 12 ounce pour

12 ounce bottle.
Aroma: huge American hop nose, sweet malts cut through the hops
Taste: resiny thick, large amounts of American hops, sweet malts to balance the hops
Overall: A solid IPA with a hop punch soon followed by the sweet malts.

Bottle at Concordia Ale house. Fairly flat high alcohol taste.Good but not as great as all the hype in my opinion. Overpriced. I enjoy high %ABV usually but not when the flavor is dominated by alcohol taste.

#1064 bottle; nose is red grape, decent lemon, mediumweak grass, urinal cakes, feel is broad, carb is medium, taste is earth, leaves, weak red apple sweetness, moldy, decent bittersweet dry hops finish

Bottle @ Beer Temple. Clear copper orange color, big lightly creamy white to off-white head that linguers for a long time. Smell a lot of hops, pine, resin. Taste hops, a lot of pine, resin, barley. Bitter, lightly fruity, hoppy aftertaste. Medium carbonation, medium body.

Great ipa. A little on the pricey side thats for sure. Still worth every penny. A very hoppy beer thats for sure!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

UPDATED: FEB 13, 2012 Bottle. Pours orange/amber. Aroma contains floral, pine, malt, and bread. Tastes of raisin, citrus, pine, toffee, and malt with quick bitter finish. Medium body with great balance.

Poured from a bottle into a St Bernadus goblet. Beer is copper in color, slightly hazy. As I drink this beer the haziness clears up, this is chill haze and indicative of poor brewing technique, although is common with DIPA style. Carbonation is minimal, forming a thin head on the very surface that barely covers the top of the beer. Some lacing on the glass. Smell is not overly hoppy but sweet and malty.
Taste is sweet, warming, strong. Lots of back end bitterness, a nice thick feeling to this beer. Beer is shy on the front end of the palate, bitterness builds. There is a slight aftertaste, very interesting. This is a good beer. It has the characteristic malty sweetness other imperial IPAs have. Overall a good example.

Bottle to glass. Aroma has a pleasant sweetness to it along with notes of citrus and a little bit of pine.  Pour is a golden amber with a nice white head. The finish is bitter as well as slightly boost. Overall, a very excellent beer.
Bottle-Aroma of Hops and rye, with hints of bread, Pour is light, with a nice head, Taste is Roasted malts and Hops with rye and an earthy Grain Palate, This is a very Solid IIPA..

Looks golden dank
smells hoppy dank
tastes malty hoppy dank
feels smooth medium dank
overall 4.2 dankies.

There is a nice amber color and fluffy white head with a floral hop aroma.  In the taste there are apricots and more floral hop notes.  The body is medium but balanced nicely.  A very pronounced bitterness resonates on the tip of the tongue, but it goes down nice and smooth.  Overall I think this beer is wonderfully balanced and a great beer.  A nice slight alcoholic warmth, and a slightly dry, but not overly so finish are very welcome.  As it warms up the sweet malt and slight breadyness are welcome.

Bottle. Hazy amber orange color with little head. The nose is of orange, grassy hops, mild malts. The taste is more malt-centric then anticipated, nicely sweet and balanced. Mild hop bitterness on the finish. The palate is medium, pretty comfortable. Medium carbonation. Overall, not the hoppy beast of a beer I was expecting. Interesting though.

Draft pint at yard house. Golden with white-gold head.  Fruity, floral scent. Thin head with moderate lacing. Piney, complex hopping.  Well balanced for an imperial IPA, but still has a strong alcohol aftertaste. Dry, but hop flavors really refresh. Very good, but strong alcohol afterbite omnipresent.  Will get again.

The color is opaque copperish amber.  The head is short but leaves a lot of Belgian lace.  The aroma has a sweet maltiness.  The taste is more mellow than expected.  The hops provide a bite but the malt smooths it out.  Finish leaves a bitterness that is mouthwatering.

Pours an amber clear golden hue with a short one-finger head that dissipates quickly leaving behind a delicate lacing. I caught some of the alcohol on the nose, but its just a real hoppy grassy aroma that meets well with the taste and mouthfeel. Its all very typical...archetypical if you will. This is the model Imperial IPA - variants from this can be very good, but in the Imperial IPA world, this should likely serve as the model. The robust hop punch in the flavor gives way to some heat and a bit of a residual bitterness that you might expect from this brew. Mouthfeel is crisp, clean, and has a glorious lingering finish. Im a fan.
Started with a bit of molasses and quickly slipped into a great fruit filled medium bitterness hop filled bottle of goodness!!

Aroma is not what I would expect of an IPA. I can detect some bread, yeast & malt. I dont get the typical pine & citrus scents. It has a beautiful, clear, dark amber color. The taste is a light molasses and grain up front that finishes with an ephemeral bitterness tinged with black pepper. The alcohol is not very prominent, its blended in well. Good beer.
Bottle.  Aroma is light pine and spice.  Taste is of bitter hops, sweet malts, and alcohol.  Flavor is well balanced.  Heavier body, but not quite to the level of being syrupy.  Lighter carbonation.
Draught. Pours a clear amber with a frothy white head. Smells of pineapple and grapefruit with strong hops. Tastes of pineapple with a medium bitterness. Texture is creamy. Medium body.

Purchased as a 12 oz. bottle from Barunis Bar and Hotel in Baden, PA. Pours dark amber with medium carbonation and about a quarter inch of yeasty foam. Strong hops without a bite on the tongue an an uncertain creaminess.  Many complexities throughout.
UPDATED: SEP 27, 2012 Pours a hazy orange with thin white head. Aroma is very earthy and floral with some malt creeping in. Superb!

The taste actually isnt as strong as some other IPAs, which is surprising considering its an imperial IPA. Theres a bit of a fruity citrus taste. Very slight sweetness added to the bitter dry IPA flavor. Its a very tasty beer, but Ive had better IPAs.
Kopparfärgad öl med lätt vitt skum. Gott om exotiska frukter i både doft och smak. Aprikos, ananas med mera. Välbalanserad.
UPDATED: JUN 11, 2012 Hazy orange with decent white head. Strong citrus hop and light malt aromas.  Flavor is very well balanced with citrus, raisin and some lighter malty notes. Outstanding IPA.

UPDATED: JUL 6, 2012 This is the prototypical East Coast IPA.  Malty, piney hops dominate the nose.  Not the citrusy, resiny type that often accompany their west coast brothers.  Heavy maltiness makes this brew almost cross into barleywine territory.  Heavy and smooth, with understated hops. RE-RATE:  after tasting some of the better IPAS, I just cant get behind this beer anymore.  Will never buy again.

UPDATED: MAR 21, 2012 Pours a slightly hazy orange peach with a really nice white head and great lacing. Nice floral and citrus aroma. Taste is pine, citrus, grass, and, caramel sweetness. Alcohol is apparent. Great bitterness.
One of my favorites... unfortunately Dogfish Head is no longer sold in my town.  Come back to Kokomo, Indiana, Dogfish Head!!
